description:
I'd prefer to rate them a 3.5 so I'll round up instead of down since that's not an option. I ate here two days in a row due to the fact that it was a convenient vegan spot as I has a conference in the Westfield. 

The food options are pretty good - sandwiches, apps, soup, hot entree options, even lots of dessert options!

The first day I ordered white rice with eggplant, noodles, and lemongrass tofu. It was all pretty good but the eggplant was just ehh to me but overall good. Nothing amazing but good. If you read my other reviews, you might notice by now that I love eggplant dishes lol.

The second day I ordered spicy pho and it was okay. It could've been better in terms or flavor but it wasn't awful. I still ate the whole dish lol. 

Everything was overpriced, probably because it's in downtown SF, but literally it was way too expensive for what you get. Also, their customer service is not great. They rush you and barely let you finish talking as you try to explain your order. Sure, it's busy, but relax...they stress themselves out more than we stress them out. I felt overwhelmed and flustered because they were in such a rush - I felt like I was running out of time or something. 

Granted, it's a food court...expectations aren't exactly high to begin with. Food is good, I'd go again if I have to be in the area and can't make it in time anywhere else outside of Westfield Mall. Also, I love supporting vegan companies. However, if I can spend less or the same somewhere else with better service and more bang for my buck, I most definitely will.
author: Gjenes B.

description:
Good job Westfield food court for having a little something for everyone!  I was really glad to have an inexpensive food option accessible even before leaving the BART area!  

Loving hut has some nice options.  And, I always love a restaurant where I don't have to ask many questions because everything on the menu is vegan.  

I had a meal with two sides.  I chose fried rice, mushrooms, and potato curry.  For a lower scale vegan experience, the seasoning was to be expected; nothing extravagant or new to my taste buds.  The food was not too greasy or oily.  And the portion size was generous for $10.50.  Next time, I need to try the vegan cheese cake.  Yes.  There is such a thing as vegan cheese cake.  It looked great!  And, yesterday was a bit of a food marathon, so I opted for no dessert :)

My helping critique for this place would be to better distinguish where the line should be.  We had several folks skip us because it was confusing how the line was intended to form.
author: Eli'jah C.

description:
Happened upon this place looking for a vegetarian option in the mall. Especially for a food court, I was not expecting to find a vegan stand. The meatball sub tasted more like a banh mi than a meatball sub, but I honestly liked that way better. It was a delicious sandwich, and the bread was lovely and crunchy.

I also got the vegan cheesecake which, while really good, didn't really have a flavor. The texture was insanely smooth though!

Menu is a little hard to follow because they have menu items or an option to pick a few hot dishes. The staff was nice and I saw them give one man a sample though!
author: Michelle S.

description:
I took my fiend's family, visiting me from Texas, here today for dinner. We got three plates and got chance to try almost all curries and veggies they have. Two entrees with rice or chow mein was $9.95. We also go the golden roll which was $4.95. Food tase was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Altogether spent around $45 for 3 people plus two kids. 

The downside was the customer service. The counter lady was unfriendly. When we asked for extra empty plate she was so hesitant and did not want to give it. I have to ask her couple of times and she was staring at me. My friend asked for paper napkins and the lady was unwilling to give it either, she gave only a couple of them for 5 of us. I had to go to another food stall and get paper napkins. The other stall had it outside the counter so anybody can take it. I am not sure why these, Loving Hut, lady was hesitant to give extra paper plates and even reasonable quantity of paper napkins. I felt bad in front of my friends who came from Texas. Very bad customer service. I never had this experience in any of the restaurants in the whole Bay Area so far. 

I wish they would do not treat their customers badly like this again.
author: Devan K.

description:
The most critical metric in my ratings is value for money (VFM).  Anybody (not really, but still...) can produce an amazing plate of food for buckets of cash.  It's a sliding scale.

Case in point, my 5-star rating for Loving Hut.  Yes, it's a food court.  Yes, the food is pre-made.  And yes, for $10.80 their veggie dishes are SPECTACULAR.

The eggplant teriyaki could be arranged on a pricey plate with half the serving you'll get here, and be sold for 2x the price.  Veggie fried rice is pretty great, but then it's just rice...ooh but it's gooooood!  The grilled veg is sauces to perfection, and they're very liberal with both portions and special requests.

And for those of you reading from outside of San Francisco's epicentre and are doubting my view of VFM, let me put this in terms that'll make more sense...this is like finding a Chipotle-quality burrito for only $5!

Alas, it's still a food court, so be aware - customer service is not included in this rating beyond speed and basically not being a d**k to customers.  Check and check!
author: Nathan B.

description: Vegan cuisine with a Southeast Asian twist is what you'll find at Loving Hut. It's Californian, hipster, and not particularly authentic, but the flavors and the concept I can really get behind! For lunch, I ordered the garden vermicelli bowl, which came with vermicelli noodles, lettuce, bean sprouts, crushed peanuts, fried spring rolls, and a chewy soy protein in dark sauce that was supposed to mimic a beef stir-fry. The fish sauce on the side wasn't particularly pungent or flavorful, but overall, this combination made for a nice dish of chewy, crunchy, and soft textures along with sweet, savory, and refreshing flavors. Complaints? The service was incredibly slow and I had to wait an eternity for my food (that being said, they do have a steam table of ready-to-go curries and stir-fries), and the price definitely wasn't particularly cheap for what you get.
author: David K.

description:
Dang! First all vegan place I have ever been too, and I got to say, it really surprised me. The employees that worked here were really nice and got my order ready just 5 minutes after I ordered. I ordered the pho.

Pho- Pho is one of my favorite soup noodles of all time. I am OBSSESSED with it, so obviously I had to order it. Having no idea how this can taste like pho without the delicious meat, the alternate of tofu actually worked really well. The portion was huge and as a person with a big appetite, I was very satisfied. One downside was that they cooked the noodles a little bit too soft for my liking. However overall, I felt very healthy eating a vegan meal although it's probably not as healthy as I think.

Overall, Loving Hut is DELICIOUS! Vegan cuisine here I come. I am definitely going to come here again and I recommend it!
author: Felicia C.

description:
I absolutely love that there is a vegan option amidst all the standard food court fare. (Actually this food court is pretty diverse with Korean, Thai, Brazilian, etc fares compared to the food courts I grew up with in the Midwest.) I wanted something light and refreshing so that food coma wouldn't interrupt my shop till I drop Black Friday weekend. 

I chose the tropical salad and it was just I needed. The portions are generous and the service fast. Veggies looked a little sad but probably bc it was the end of the day. The protein tasted very much like meat and I love the Asian flavor aka sesame seed oil. 

They are also kind to serve free water. I will definitely be ordering from here again in the future!
author: Lisa K.

description:
Loving Hut has been on my vegan radar for quite some time. I knew it was vegan fast food, which means a whole lot of soy products in their menu items. I also knew as this particular Loving Hut was located in the food court, the level of expectation I needed while dining there was of fast food level. 

I ordered the hot ramen and some fried rolls. The ramen was yummy and very big. I'm kind of a ramen snob, so I can definitely say I've had better. Nonetheless the "meat" on top truly had a pork texture - which freaked me out. It's great how pink and significantly similar the texture was to ham I ate a couple years ago. The noodles were plentiful and I was happy that the amount of veggies on top were to my liking.

The fried rolls were good, but I didn't care all that much for the dipping sauce. I would rather a fresh roll or something else to pair.

All in all, I wasn't impressed nor disappointed with my meal. I've had both better and worse vegan options All the soy deters me, I would like to see some seitan or other meat textures used as alternatives. 

There's a location near me in Sac that I want to try dining in and seeing how experience compares. Will update.
author: Carly Q.

description:
Came here for lunch because of all the great options in the mall food court. 

I am a pescatarian so sometimes it can be hard to find good options for lunch- but this place is so great!

Service: there was no line when I went and the girl helped me immediately. I asked her what was her favorite and she said the pho- so I decided to go with that!

Food: I got the pho and a Thai iced tea. Love how everything is vegan but still tastes so flavorful and delicious. The pho was so good- might of been the best pho I've ever had. The broth had really good flavor and all the toppings were super fresh. The Thai iced tea tasted like a Thai iced tea (soy based) which makes it so much better. For sure want to get the pho here again.

LOVE! Will be back to try the plates of veggies/curry. Everything looked so good.
author: Hayley D.

description:
A vegan place in a mall food court? I had to check it out. I've been to Loving Hut a couple of times now while on lunch break from taking some classes nearby. Since the classes are all day I want something light but filling and not something that's going to make me take a nap. So I was pleased to see Loving Hut. The Heavenly Salad is so refreshing and flavorful. It also looks very appetizing with all of its colors. I even had someone come up to me and ask me what I ordered and they said it looked amazing. 

Loving Hut does offer more than salads. They offer steam table entrees as well as noodles. I'm just glad to see many different types of food offerings in a mall food court!
author: Sara P.

description: Healthy and tasty food, almost makes  me want to switch to being a vegetarian...almost. I enjoyed the chow mein, tofu and sweet and sour savor. The pizza is not the best.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I needed to buy shoes at the mall and remembered that there was a Loving Hut available in the food court, so out of convenience decided to come here for dinner. 

I was craving a vegan dumpling noodle soup and to my disappointment, while they had pho available, they had no dumplings. This location has a limited menu compared to other Loving Hut locations because it is set up food court style where you point and order what you want them to scoop up for you. I strongly prefer my food to be made to order, so it really wasn't appealing to choose from what was already pre-made and on display. 

I ordered the pho and a steamed bun. Both were pretty good, but weren't amazing, and I felt like $15 for both was expensive. I thought to myself that I wouldn't come back here unless I was starving and it was the closest place available with vegan options. 

I don't plan on going out of my way to come back since there are so many other options for vegan food in San Francisco.
author: Regina W.

description:
We've been on a plant based vegan diet kick lately but Wednesday night we needed a quick bite. We're moving close to the Westfield mall so after getting our keys for the new place, we stopped by here for dinner. 

There aren't a ton of vegan options out there but this place was a great option! We got a plate from their hot bar, egg rolls and the "meatball marinara" sub. We normally eat super healthy so it's nice to indulge and still stay on the vegan kick. 

Everything was tasty but I'll def say that the meatball sub was def more of a meatball bahn mi. No complaints! But I wouldn't classify it as Italian by any means. 

The cook-to-order food came out quickly as well. Would recommend!
author: Katlyn H.

description:
It pains me to write a 2 star review for this place as I really appreciate having a vegan option in the mall food court. I've been to this location many times over the last decade and I'm sad to say the quality has decreased. My go to dish is the vegan pho.

1) the portion of pho has decreased down to a smaller bowl.

2) the basil is not fresh - many rotting pieces (see picture)

3) what bothered me the most this visit was the poor hygiene habits of the staff. The young man did not take off his disposable gloves as he moved between packaging fresh basil, accepting my credit card for payment, and sweeping the place with a broom. Seems pretty unsanitary. 

I'm hoping I just caught them on a bad day!
author: Diana M.

description:
I had been running around the SFO area all day with only garlic fries and a pink drink to sustain me. Famished, I opened my Yelp app and my vegan filter showed me that this Loving Hut was only steps away. Yay! We entered the mall and found the Loving Hut in the second food court area.  It's a shopping mall, so the set up was very different from what I'm accustomed. 

Immediately noticeable is the buffet-style set up (similar to Panda Express) showing most of their available items. There was mostly tofu, which I try to avoid, so I was initially disappointed. Then I noticed the menu board above; it was still very limited (compared to the LH restaurants) but there were soy protein options, which I prefer over tofu. 

I ordered the Queen Sandwich -$9.50. It came with soy protein, marinated in a caramelized sauce, vegan mayo and lettuce (I omitted the cucumbers and tomatoes).  It also came with small salad mix.  It was tasty and filling. 

They had a tempting dessert case, which included 3 different cheesecakes.  Unfortunately, I didn't get to try any this time... Maybe next time.

It's exciting to know that there is a LH in a shopping mall food court, and I can only hope that instead of being a rarity, this will become the norm.
author: Tigra C.

description:
I like their commitment to vegetarianism. It is located in a food court. You can choose from among a variety of pre made veggies. 

I love the texture of the veggies, especially the eggplant, but they are a bit too salty for my taste. Overall, it's a good, fast, and cheap option for work lunches.
author: Vivian C.

description: Great food! After a fun day touring SF it is wonderful to be able to walk in, sit down, and recieve fast healthy food. The service was good, the resturant was cleanly, and the food was nummy
author: Erin L.

description:
Only came here because I realized Bristol Farms is now closed.  I strolled around the food court trying to find something relatively healthy and ended up circling back to Loving Hut.  What they have out in display - buffet spreads - didn't look too appealing.  It looked like it had been sitting out all day.

Decided to go with the vermicelli noodle with mock meat.  The dish came of fast and with generous portions.  It actually tasted delicious to my surprise.  The mock fish sauce was flavorful and I'm still wondering what it's made out of.  Dish came out to be about $10.  It was well worth it.  I'm a true carnivore, but after having Loving Hut, I'm almost convinced to do meatless Monday's.
author: Bailey N.

description:
Asian fusion vegan casual place in the middle of the Westfield Mall food court. Ordered a sandwich because I was on the run and in a hurry and I thought it'd be faster but in retrospect probably rice with 2 items would have been just as fast if not faster because they actually have to make the sandwich and the other items are already made. Either way, my sandwich (the Queen) was absolutely delicious, and the other items that I didn't get looked mouth watering as well. It is in the middle of the food court, which contains stands that almost all serve dead animal carcasses, but this place is a safe Mecca for the vegans.. 
They use compostable cups too, which is great. I hate traditional plastic cups.
author: Reba W.

description:
After a couple of transitioning more and more to a vegan diet, I'm having a lot of fun finding places around SF and the North Bay that offer great vegan meals. I'm happy to say I found another one that I hadn't heard of before but was right under my nose, thanks to Yelp. 

I ordered the Sweet and Sour Savor and the Sweet Potato Curry with rice. Both had a distinctive, complimentary flavor and helped affirm that vegan doesn't mean bland. I'm psyched to have another delicious, quick, convenient place to visit for lunch!
author: Russ S.

description:
I love Loving Hut restaurants! They truly care about the animals, the environment, and our health! I had their Pho and it was the best! Will definitely come back when I'm in SF next time.

Be veg, go green, & save the planet!!
author: Solongo O.

description:
Food courts in SF don't come cheap. Expect to pay around $10 at any food stall, unless you're really broke and can only afford a small side of something. 

I was HUNGRY, maybe even hangry, and I decided to get food here after a couple loops around the food court because I used to love going to their Milpitas location. I got noodles, stir-fried eggplant with tofu, and some other veggies. Everything was DELICIOUS. I only get 30 minutes for lunch, and despite being a super slow eater that works more than a couple blocks away, I managed to finish every last bite and make it back to work on time. Either that or... the servings were kind of small. 

My taste buds were satisfied, but my stomach would've been a bit happier if I splurged on 3 sides instead of 2. If I ever wandered into this mall again on a rainy day, I'd absolutely get the same thing again.
author: Christine L.

description:
I had the pho noodle soup and I thought it was ok. It's a bit pricey ($9.50) especially since it came from the mall. I had better vegetarian pho in the past. 

It seemed like there was more tofu pieces than the other veggie meat and the tofu tasted kind of plain to me. I did like the different types of veggie meat that was used though. The broth wasn't the best. Sometimes, it was hard to scoop out the noodles from the compostable bowl. The noodles kept sticking to the edges. Even though I am not a big fan of beef, I think the beef broth that is used for pho typically tastes a lot better. I would have liked this dish a lot better if I was given lemon slices on the side.
author: Kristina M.

description:
When you think of mall food and vegan, Loving Hut isn't the place to stereotype your thoughts. I can say that because that's what I was thinking prior to ordering from them. My favorite dish is the tofu and eggplant. The sauce is amazeballs delish! Their fried rice and potato curry is also good. You can't go wrong! 

The rainbow salad is plentiful, colorful and satisfies the hunger. I was on the verge of having a hunger headache, so I wanted to eat everything in sight. I went with healthy and this salad was delicious!
author: Sharon B.

description:
Amazing food, great location adn awesome quality.
SOS for vegans and super strict vegetarians like me.
author: Vani J.

description:
Pros: Best Vegan good I've ever had!!! This is vegan Vietnamese and the food here is pretty close to the real deal! Food here will definitely satisfy a meat lover. Service is always quick and the food makes me want to be a vegan. 

Cons: A little pricey, but worth it. The location is a bit hidden since they're facing the far end of the food court but you can't miss if when exiting Bloomingdales. Koja Kitchen will be right in front of it in the future.

Ordered: The two entree combo plate with potato curry and sweet & savory ($10). Love the texture of the tofus and fake meat in all their dishes. 

Would I recommend: Yes! Perfect meal for days you want to feel less guilty.
author: Terry N.

description:
There should be a health investigation on this place:

Came to this stand in the food court on Sunday around 4:45pm. We wanted a quick snack, so we ordered TWO (2) side orders of garlic fries. Cashier only rang us up for one. Had to re-order -- no big deal.

As we are standing there waiting, I notice the two cashiers/food handlers are sitting there EATING some weird white fruit. To my horror, I look down and see that our sweet potato fries are sitting on the counter, next to their open fruit. Then, I see the cashier eating with one hand OVER our open food container, and closing it with the other. 

When our buzzer rang and she handed that bag of fries to us, I called her out for eating over our food. Her and her other fruit-loving co-worker pretended like they had no idea what I was talking about and claimed they "didn't understand". Once I slowed it down for them, they only sheepishly said "sorry" and walked away. Her other friend said "oh I only closed the container". I was going to have them re-make the fries, but decided not to out of fear they would do something worse than eating over it.
author: Zoe Y.

description: Dear Loving Hut. I love you. And more importantly, I am grateful to you for the cruelty free, vegan offerings you provide. My favorite is the kale and mushrooms over brown rice, but everything you make is delicious. And so very loving. Xoxo.
author: danica s.

description: Pretty good food for the price. But as indicated by others, the customer service is abysmal. The person who took my order was very cold and made me feel like I was bothering her when I was making my order. As she forgot to give me napkins, I went back and asked for them and the second person there all but threw one (exactly one) at me. Given the location and the price point, I don't expect to be fawned over, but a little basic courtesy would be nice. Definitely will be checking out other options in this food court in the future.
author: S W.

description:
Lots of veggie options and good quality vegan 'meats.' 
$10.95 for a two item combo + price.
Food is flavorful but I really wish they used less oil!!!!
author: Daniella O.

description: Expected it to be much much better! Everything was soaked in oil, don't be fooled that this place is going to serve healthy food just because it says vegan! Vegan doesn't mean that you drench everything in oil and sauce! Not enough flavor and way to expensive! Vegan food isn't necessarily expensive, veggies are in fact  cheaper than some meat! Overall I will not be going back there again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone either
author: Simar K.

description: My favourite vegan Vietnamese cuisine in San Francisco. The veggie noodle is the best and Loving Hut sandwich very delicious. Wonderful experience, love it.
author: William C.

description:
UPDATE:
I visited this restaurant again recently & their portion sizes have decreased significantly (roughly half what they used to be).  I can no longer recommend this restaurant because their small portions make the food not worth the money they charge.

---------

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
Excellent Vegan restaurant that has a desirable selection of hard to find Vegan options.  Portions are on the smaller side (I recommend eating here for lunch) and it's location leaves much to be desired (being in the middle of a mall food court).  The food makes up for this though... it's delicious!

BTW, to find this place take the mall elevator to the concourse level (denoted by "C" on the elevator panel) & then walk towards the rear of the food court.  The trek is worth it!
author: Mike P.

description: The quality of the food was pretty consistant from the one in milpitas. We bought 2 items lunch but they gave smaller portion. It was so different with the one in Milpitas. The place was like a fast food setup and it's yellow. You can spot it really easy. You can't miss it! But I love their food. I brought and recomended to my parents who visit from overseas. They love it.
author: Kartika A.

description: This place is bomb.com!! The food is amazing and the dessert are amazing as well. This is a vegan staple.
author: Marty E.

description:
If you haven't tried it, you must get the Garden Vermicelli here. 
It is like heaven on a plate.
author: Eunhye K.

description:
So, I expected to love this place and was sadly disappointed.  I ordered the steamed table combo w/ noodles.  They were out of both curries and when asked, said they were not done yet so that left steamed kale, roasted mushrooms, eggplant, & spicy green-beans or another 'stir-fried something'- both in pools of oil.  I'm not a fan of pools of oil so opted for the kale and eggplant.  Way over-priced for what I got!

We also ordered a meatball marinara sandwich.  Neither choice was great and the sandwich should have been called meatball teriyaki-there was not a speck of marinara?!   I would not eat here again.  There are vegan options at a few of the other places.  Be picky!
author: Mardy L.

description: Great place for vegan meal, in the Westfield mall lots of choices and desserts too great lunch spot
author: Anjana P.

description: Ordered the heavenly salad from here as a quick bite while shopping, and overall: the food is expensive (over $9) for its small portion and lack of meat. The salad is basically cabbage, carrots, some lettuce, peanuts, soy protein, and a typical Vietnamese sauce. All these items are inexpensive, yet somehow the price comes out 50x higher. I would suggest walking to the next block to Tu Lan for delicious, inexpensive, and well-portioned Vietnamese food and salads.
author: Christine L.

description: I ordered the Meatball Marinara Sandwich. It was nothing like marinara, which was disappointing. I'm not sure what the sauce was, but the sandwich filling besides the meatballs was mostly a ton of cilantro and lettuce. The spring rolls are good but too expensive.
author: Shiva A.

description:
I'm not vegetarian, but have not eaten beef/pork for the past 12 years. Had my doubts coming to a food court. Wouldn't go out of my way to come here, nor will I re-attempt trying fake meats anytime soon..

- PHO NOODLE SOUP ($9.50 / 1.5 stars): broth was decent, tasted like 5-spice. Noodles however, didn't taste like they were fully cooked, and I really was NOT a fan of the fake beef - I don't really enjoy eating things that look like meat, even if they're not... I'd rather eat them in their original form. Fake beef tasted slightly rubbery and the triangular tofu/protein pieces tasted like leather. Saving grace was inari-like pieces. 

- AVOCADO SMOOTHIE ($6.50 / 1.5 stars): wayyyy too creamy for me even though it was soy based and you can get it half sweet. Tasted almost kind of foamy - don't think there was enough milk/ice... though extra credit for the amount of avocado. 

- GARDEN SPRING ROLLS (~$6 / 3 stars): liked the filling which included veggies + some kind of asian fungus type thing, dipping sauce was good. 

Probably won't be back anytime soon - fake expensive meat is not my thing. Perhaps worth a try since vegan-only food is relatively novel around fidi?
author: Kristie C.

description: I came here for lunch one day with a friend during work. I came and ordered one of their Vietnamese dishes which was really good. I ordered the vermicelli noddle with the spring roll. They even had the vegan "fish sauce". The spring roll was fresh and crispy. The noodles and soy pork meat was as close to what bbq pork is. It was delicious and definitely coming back here!
author: HENRY M.

description:
Came here for lunch today. We were surprised that there was a line outside. 
We ordered the chow mein, lemongrass tofu, and spicy green beans and vegetarian pho. The pho was ok, the soup was very herbal tasting, noodles were ok. The chow mein was good, tofu was delicious and has good flavor. We were slightly disappointed with the green beans since they were not spicy and contained pieces of the seitan, which we're not a huge fan of. 
Overall, service was decent and food was satisfying. In the future, we would probably stay with the pre-made food.
author: Goku U.

description:
I am far from a vegetarian or vegan but I give huge props to those who are. My co worker told me about Loving Hut so we decided to check it out. It's located in the Food Emporium downstairs of Westfield right in the middle. 

I was pleasantly surprised to see how many people were in line. I got the eggplant, string beans, and the rice. It was all so good. It was hard to believe that it was all Vegan. I didn't even crave any meat or felt like there should be meat in there at all. 

My favorite would have to be the eggplant and rice. They cook the eggplant just perfectly! It's great. Def try it out and keep an open mind. It has to be one of the best options in the food court that will satisfy anyone and their dietary needs or restrictions
author: Yinja L.

description:
Thankful for vegan options in the food court! Not veggie myself but I try as often as I can to eat veg!

Being in a food court still has it's downsides as service is expected to be faster, which sometimes affects quality. This Loving Hut location definitely doesn't live up to it's actual restaurant locations but it's pretty damn close.

I've had the Crispy Tenders & Sweet Potato Fries and the Garden Vermicelli. Both very, very good. I looooooooove big protein nuggets so the Crispy Tenders was a hit with me. Although it only came with four (4) nuggets... :( BUT they made up for it with all the sweet potato fries. Would have really preferred more nuggets though. The Garden Vermicelli came as a very full order - plenty for a dinner portion. So yummy. :D

Going to continue to stop by here after work for a quick snack or dinner. Definitely want to try the sandwiches next! Price is nothing compared to the quality of the food and the healthy feel you get after eating here. :)
author: Shanise M.

description: I've been coming here regularly for over 2+years since I work nearby.  The past few months the service as well as the portion is declining. The counter young lady is always unfriendly. My regular order is the noodles and yellow curry.  She gave me noodles the portion for children, I asked politely to add just a little more, and she literally gave me a couple of strings of cabbage and maybe one string of noodle.  REALLY?  If you ask for another napkin, beware, you are better off going to other stalls that has them on their counter.  Their other location Westfield in San Jose, I couldn't even close the container because they give you so much portion, it could easily be two meals. There are other vegetarian stalls in this mall that actually leaves you full and satisfied, and be treated with courtesy.
author: Dee H.

description:
My favorite vegetarian/vegan fast food spot!
The food is delicious, ingredients are high quality, good sized portions, and the prices are great. 

My favorite thing to get is the garden vermicelli ($10.83 includes tax). The spring rolls are crisp and amazing. The tempeh quality and seasoning is so spot on you can hardly notice the difference. The veggies are always fresh and the "fish sauce" is pretty close to the real deal.

The hot bar food is pretty decent too - the sweet and sour "pork" is tasty and the mixed veggies are good. They make a great hibiscus tea as well. Everything I've tried here has been fresh and tasted great.

I've been cutting down on my meat consumption to practice what I preach - living more sustainably and eco-friendly. Loving Hut makes that part easy!

Location is also super convenient - in the Westfield Mall lower level food court - the Powell St BART is right across the way.
author: Brenda L.

description: Took me a while to decide on place to eat with all the options in the Food Emporium, but I am happy I went with Loving Hut. I ordered a plate with veggies, sweet potato curry and chow mein. Sadly the vegetable were forgettable and lacking in flavor. I was also disappointed to find that the sweet potato curry was mostly potatoes and hardly any tofu. But I will say that it had amazing flavor. The sweet and spiciness worked perfectly! The chow mein, however, was the star of the show. I may almost dare to say it's the best chow mein I've ever eaten. Admittedly, I have been so used to Panda Express chow mein or greasy chow mein from cheap Chinese take out. My eyes have been opened to what good chow mein tastes like! I had to stop myself from going back to order more for later. I may just need to start eating more vegan food if this is what I am missing out on!
author: Karina G.

description: I've been back a few more times when in town. And I have to say, so super convenient to have Loving Hut in this mall. And they are still here! The food court always has had a high turnover rate in restaurants, so I'm always worried when I stop by. But nope, they are still there and hopefully thriving. Every time I visit, they always have a line. The food is always good and everything is consistent. I feel like the food gets better each time.
author: Natasha S.

description: I love a vegan option in a mall food court. The portion sizes are big and the food is super tasty.
author: Purna V.

description:
Had the garden vermicelli. It was good but it was really hard to eat. It was served on a compostable plastic plate (really appreciate that it's compostable) but it was kinda hard to eat. I think it'd be easier if it were in a bowl. The mock meat is supposed to mimic marinated beef - it's good but it has this weird after taste. 

The servers were not friendly. They were kind of rude and didn't give the best customer experience. It is in a food court so I guess...
author: Jessica K.

description: I have seen the Loving Hut in the Sunset and I know it's popular for food delivery services. I meant to order food from another stand at Westfield today, but I decided to try Loving Hut even though I am far from a vegetarian. I had the 2 item combo. I had sweet potato curry and tofu with fried rice. I thought they didn't give me as much fried rice as they could have. The meal was pretty good. However, the curry and tofu had a lot of veggies that were not very exciting to eat. It was enough to carry me through the rest of the day. I thought it was a little bit overpriced at $10 something for the 2 item combo.
author: Denise C.

description:
This place is why veganism has a bad rap. Over priced and under flavored. 

Meatball marinara sandwich does not really have marinara sauce on it. It's basically mediocre meatballs with some vegetables inside of bread. Try asking for some on the side and they won't give you any...because they don't actually have any. 

Thai iced tea is like 90% creamer, almost no tea flavor. Don't know if this is normal or just penny pinching on the part of this location. 

Also just a generally lackluster experience - did not feel any love at the loving hut, just poor English speakers and apathy.

That's all before I get to them telling me they wouldn't put onions on the sandwich and then putting them there.
author: Tony H.

description:
The Westfield San Francisco is fancy.  High end stores, cascading escalators, oh, and of course amazing VEGAN food.  I mean, what mall has an all vegan restaurant? Sooooo California. 

Loving Hut is a international vegan 'fast food' spot that offers affordable and delicious meals.  Each location has a bit of a different menu, but this one focuses mainly on pan-Asian style cuisine (Pho, Vermicelli, Spring Rolls, Red Curry, Sweet and Sour Tofu,etc).  Also, for the kiddos you can pick up some 'chicken' (soy based) nuggets with fries or a vegan slice of cake (mmm).  A meal for 2 will run you about $20 and for the good portion size and an actually healthy eating option while in a mall it is a great deal.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Honestly I was just glad to have found a veg option, even if it was in a mall lower level/subway foodcourt.  The area is SUPER clean and nicely lit (thank goodness, likely one of the nicer foodcourts I've happened upon).

The menu is sparse in comparison to their brick'n'mortar locations (it's an international chain, so I was already familiar with their offerings), but the helping I got (an 8"x8"x2" block of noodles, curry potatoes, and tofu) was really great (I definitely couldn't eat it all).  There wasn't much spice to the dish, but the noodles were ok.  Big thumbs up on the $4 spring rolls (like 8 halfed rolls) and the peanut sauce!

Service was quick (thank goodness), the price was good (yay!), but.....why would a VEGAN place use styrofoam??!
author: Marcy L.

description:
I was running errands in the area and decided to grab some food for takeout. Since I've given up red meat for a bit, I had a hard time picking something for dinner. Then I thought, why not try something vegan? It was Friday, February 12th around 6:30pm.

After looking through a bunch of pix on Yelp, I decided to get the Garden vermicelli ($9.95): noodle, lettuce, bean sprout, cucumber, herbs, fried rolls & grilled soy protein. I wanted to try their golden rolls anyways, so I figured this would be perfect. I wasn't sure what to expect as I don't really recall ever eating faux meat in the past. I was pleasantly surprised. The ingredients were fresh. The grilled soy actually fulfilled my red meat craving. It's not quite as savory and beefy, but it does the trick. Their sauce (I believe it's supposed to resemble nuac cham?) could have used a little more flavor. I like mine a little fishier. Added some sambal to give it a little kick.

They also have some (stir fried?) dishes displayed just like some fast takeout Asian restaurants. (Panda Express comes to mind.) That day, they were offering:

*Vegetable chowmein
*Fried rice
*Spicy green beans
*Basil mushrooms 
*Sweet potato curry
*Organic tofu with eggplant
*Red curry with vegetables 
*Sweet & sour savor
*Steamed kale
*Organic lemongrass tofu

You can get a one or two item combo. I was tempted to get this as everyone in front of me was ordering combos. Plus, the food smelled really good. Maybe I'll use it as an excuse to come back.

Thanks Loving Hut for opening me up to vegan food. It's actually mighty tasty!
author: Elena N.

description: Definitely a great fast food type option for vegetarians. I really felt like I was eating meat and had one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes that I really miss now as a vegetarian. Service was pretty decent and price was on point!
author: Kristian A.

description: Great vegan/vegetarian fast food place! Had the vegan meatball sandwich. Very tasty. The rice noodle dishes looked good also!
author: Adam E.

description:
When I need extra Vegetables I come to Loving hut. At first I was kind of hesitant that I was only getting veggies.  After trying it I realized it filled me up for lunch and it wasn't so bad.  I always get the steamed table combo which is 2 items plus fried rice or noodles.  If you don't want the rice or noodles, let them know and you can any of the 3 items on the table.

My favorites are the Eggplant, Sweet and Sour tofu, potato curry, or the tofu and vegetables.  Try it out if you want a somewhat healthy alternative!!
author: James H.

description: It's a mall food court, so different from the Loving huts in AZ which are sit down restaurants where people have long lunches. This was a vegan Panda Express. You pick out entrees with a side of rice to make a plate. They also had sandwiches on the menu and desserts like cake slices and mini cheesecakes on display. The food doesn't taste super fresh and you can see it sitting on hot plates but it's great for grabbing on the go. Came to the 12th street mall just to get this food after walking around the city all day. It tasted amazing!!! I got rice with two entrees. They were both tofu curry type dishes and really filling. One of them had potato and tofu, super filling. It was way too much food, had a ton of leftovers for the next day. Good leftover food.
author: Keerthi V.

description: I love the rice plate. The plate is huge and completely filled. There's an option of fried rice or noodles, but I usually go with white rice with a side of steamed kale (highly recommended- flavorful and delicious) and the lemon grass tofu (not spicy, ton of tofu).
author: Emily X.

description: Food is really good but they are very stingy with their servings. The person serving me barely served me any food so I asked for them to add extra rice which they only ended up adding another scoop of rice and charged me $5 for ONE scoop of rice
author: Yoselin M.

description:
Poor customer service.
On various occasions like today...I am watched walking up to the counter only to have them turn away from the register to go do something else.

Today...I just paid around 7 bucks
For a measily side of rice.

Vegan elitist B.S.-- so sick of it.

Vegan hut I thought was supposed to be a loving haven for us vegans with limited options....not  become a target to be capitalized on.
author: Chapstiq G.

description: A good solid, healthy, vegetarian/vegan find in the SF mall food court! The pho was such a nice lunch option for a cool Sunday evening during the Christmas shopping rush. Loved the broth as it was simple, flavorful and hit the spot. We also got the garden rolls - loved these as well as I love anything healthy that is fried. I'm funny like that. I will definitely come back!
author: Maile N.

description: You really want to eat your vegetables here. Not just because it's good for your health, it's just that delicious! They have sandwiches and combo plates for $10,50 which include fried rice/noodles + 2 dishes. The drinks are also great! If you want to (finally) eat healthy and good for a reasonable price, this is the place to eat!
author: L C.

description:
This review is for this location's unapologetically rude service, which made me consequently give my food away uneaten as I did not want to honor such behavior by consuming their offerings. I ordered my food (an order of fresh rolls with peanut sauce) with a female employee who asked if I wanted it here or to go. "To go", I said, and proceeded down towards the cash register. Upon arrival at the register, my order was found set upon a plain paper plate, placed there by the same employee who took my order. What happened to "to go?". I kindly (I felt, at least) corrected the woman at the register that my order was to go, to which this new lady looked very confused, annoyed, lost even.  She finally and unceremoniously tossed me a small Chinese take out box to package my rolls in, but, from looking at the contents of the plate relative to the box one would have (should have?) thought the observation would have clicked on her brain's "this is not big enough" button. But, alas, it did not. Apparently the whole stack of clamshell boxes sitting next to the stack of paper plates was invisible. Fine, whatever, I shrugged, but then motioned that there was also a plastic cup of peanut sauce that would require a lid. With the second lady lost and unmoving, again, the first woman took notice and, annoyed at my continued presence, shoved a lid in my direction.

Roll eyes. I shuffled away to the side. The toss and shove was to be interpreted  as "OK then, if you want it to go, then you package it yourself." Had my hands been clean (vs post shopping and touching random things) this would have been fine... but they weren't, so it wasn't. Nonetheless I had to oblige and proceeded to confirm my initial thoughts that, nope, the contents weren't going to fit. And/or, rather, I wasn't about to forcefully shove everything into the box so as to have the rolls' rice paper stick all into each other. Frustrated, I went back to the counter and showed them how the box wasn't big enough. I requested the larger clamshell container. This was met by glares from both women and their refusal -- I had a plate, after all, and a box already! Upon my refusal to leave, they angrily grabbed my little box of food away, said something not in English to themselves (while I can speak another language too, I would not choose to use it to talk behind others' back, especially in a business/customer-facing setting). In the shadows of their food preparation counter, they took out the peanut sauce container that I had not wanted to carry outside the box, closed it, and handed me everything with the peanut sauce container on top of the box. Sigh... if I was OK with carrying the sauce outside, then I wouldn't have intentionally put it inside the container -- I guess that my action was not obvious enough. I explained that I hadn't wanted to carry the peanut sauce outside (lest, I could have placed it outside too and been done with it, Einsteins), but as I still had to travel far before I could eat the food, it was an undesirable option. To that, they said you can pay 10 cents for a bag, and to that, I said no and left.


Loving Hut, you profess to be borne out of peace, love, and harmony... your employees at this location, at least today, do not seem to be practicing what you preach. For your desire to not listen to your customers' orders well enough in the first place, and then to save a paper plate and not give up a clamshell box, you have lost a repeat customer. And, while it is great that there is a planet friendly option in the food court at Westfield, I wish its ambassadors were a little people friendly as well.
author: D C.

description: I usually have a positive experience at this place but today deemed itself the opposite. We're regulars so it was unusual. My partner ordered a combo meal and politely asked for one item to be placed on another plate because she isn't fond of the juices touching the other food. We even offered to pay for the other plate. The combo itself is $11.50 with all three items. They wanted to charge us an extra $6.50 because we wanted the other item on a separate plate. I guess I'm some illogical dimension, if the food is not on the same cheap ass plates then it's not a combo. We didn't push it any further and declined the meal. If so we would have turned into the big, scary, black people. Done with this location.
author: Ajala B.

description:
I have fond memories of Loving Hut because it basically kept me alive when I studied abroad in Asia. I'll probably be grateful to it forever. 

The Westfield location in SF has some great options that I love. Their Asian selections are delicious, especially the eggplant; and their sandwiches are really good too! I would highly recommend the queen sandwich! I've also had the spicy royal noodle soup which was pretty good.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Soooo good! I'm not vegan or anything but I wanted to try something different and we were presently surprised ! Even as we were eating some lady came up to us and said do you know that's vegan food ? We laughed and said yes! She then went on to say " oh I was just wondering, I tried it and I had no idea it was so good doesn't even taste like it." I've not had to many experience eating vegan food but this was definitely the best one! The rolls were sooooo good probably my favorite I've ever had !
author: Erica Z.

description:
Hasn't disappointed me so far! Every time I eat here they convince me more and more that vegan is the way to go. People think going vegan is just bland tofu and salads, but the loving hut will change your mind! 
Crispy tenders and sweet potato fries: so good order it! Best crunchy yet soft on the inside sweet potato fries!
Kale: not wilty still has a bite, nice sesame flavor
Basil mushrooms: drenched in some kind of dark soy sauce, good size mushrooms!
Lemon grass tofu: crispy flavorful tofu!
Their sandwiches have an awesome bun! I wonder if they make it or where do they buy it from because omg it is nice and crunchy yet nice and soft interior and tastes so fresh. 
Their strawberry smoothie is a must try!
author: Maria H.

description: Not worth the 10.00. I asked for my money back when I saw the small porti ok n size and was told NO REFUNDS...Given the choice if many other places to eat I along with my coworkers friends and family will not be dining here again..
author: Rachelle L.

description:
I'm not one for vegan food; as an avid meat eater & lover, I will not be swayed by the vegan/PETA propaganda. However, I was craving a salad and settled on Loving Hut inside Westfield Center. 

I ordered the Rainbow Salad, which came with lettuce, cilantro, peanuts, wontons, noodles, cabbage, tomatoes, corn, cucumber, and shredded carrots. 

I was pleasantly surprised, it was really tasty! I enjoyed mostly all of it, and I was sad to leave a quarter of it unfinished but they absolutely drenched my salad in the peanut dressing. By the time I got to the end, it was a soggy, inedible mess. 

Next time I'll ask for light dressing or on the side, but I'm glad to have tried something new!
author: Taylor M.

description: Good vegan PhonNoodle soup. Healthy and filling . Tasty . However needed some flavor ... salt and spices (personal preference) I recommend to all the vegans and healthy alternative choices !!!!
author: P K.

description:
Honestly I would go vegan if all vegan foods were like this. This was my first time ever eating vegan and OMG I cannot believe what I put in my mouth was 100% vegan. I swear, the sauce tastes like meat but it's actually meat-free DAMN! 1 million stars out of 5!

I got the steamed table combo, 2 items with fried rice ($9.95). 
1. Fried rice is pretty good. It's pretty standard, but considering it's vegan fried race it's amazing. There's vegan food that acts like meat that has an actual meat flavor. I'm so blown away by how it's vegan. 
2. Tofu Eggplant - I mean eggplant is okay until you eat this dish. Honestly give me a whole bowl of this eggplant and I will be good to go. The sauce is kind of tangy, sweet, and sticky which coats the tofu and eggplant really well. 
3. Kung Pao Tofu - I thought this was kind of funny, but I'm really not sure if I got Kung Pao Tofu because there was pineapple inside. Anyways, each tofu was literally like a burst of flavor. Also they put vegetables that would be in a traditional meat dish in it and it was actually like a nice touch. 

Definitely a go! You have to try this once in your life to really get to know how good vegan food can taste like. If all vegan foods were like this, I would be vegan by now.
author: Vivienne C.

description:
First, I am NOT a vegan. I love dead flesh, especially bbq'd, but as I evolve, I am keeping an open mind. 
Therefore I tried Loving Hut.
Pro's: great food, especially loved the spicy green beans and also the sweet potato curry. I thought the mushrooms were terrific. 
Con's: no condiments were offered or available except a mostly used bottle of Sriracha sauce.
The price was high for fast food, but I would eat here again
author: Andy B.

description:
If you are vegetarian, this is a must try. Everything here is organic and local. Food is full of flavor and there are so many options. 
If you aren't in the mood for Asian, they have western style food as well. 
I highly recommend Their orange sesame bites.
author: M. R.

description:
I have been to several Loving Hut locations in NYC, Tampa, FL, & Portland, OR. I recently visited Loving Hut in the Westfield mall in San Francisco located in a food court right near a Bloomingdale's. Loving Hut here stands tall head & shoulders above other establishments as like the other branches Loving Hut offers all vegan cuisine that is healthy in affordable good size portions.

I would opt for getting the Asian entrees here as opposed to the Western dishes. When in Rome... 

I went with the Garden Vermicelli for $10.83 including tax. It came with two spring rolls cut into small portions, noodles, veggies, faux beef, mint cilantro, & was topped w/ chopped peanuts w/ a sauce on the side. I found the dish to be flavorful, hearty, healthy, & affordable for how much you get w/ a focus on quality ingredients. They also had a Oreo Chocolate Cake on hand that would make a nice treat if you were splitting it as was pretty big for $4.95 plus tax. 

The daily special listed as Today's Special was a Meatball Marinara for $9.25 plus tax. They also have the popular steamed table combo which is two items w/ rice for $9.25 plus tax served buffet style. 

Other dishes I look forward to trying are some of the other noodle dishes:
Pho Noodle soup for $9.50 plus tax
Spicy Royal Noodle Soup for $9.50 plus tax
author: Shane S.

description: If you're strolling Market Street or riding BART, stop by the Powell Street Station mall for a food court vegan meal. You can rest assured that no animals were killed for the sake of your eating pleasure here. You can look at the food through a glass case and choose what strikes your fancy, from options such as spicy green beans, sweet and sour soy, organic lemon grass tofu, sweet potato curry, basil mushroom, steamed kale and more. There is also a regular menu with starters, salads and bowls. It's worth the stop. I just wish there were more organic items (especially the tofu).
author: Zena B.

description:
Very tasty food for food court. Their curries are really good and most veggie options are also delicious. I liked the tofu, as well.
My only problem with this place (and other places in this food court) is that they serve lukewarm food! I don't know why. I went there around noon and the food was cold. I told the guy working there but he didn't care. Then I went back around 8pm (before closing) and food was also cold. I told him that it's almost cold and he said: "It's still warm". Noo, that was not warm enough. I had to eat very fast so I don't have to eat too cold at the end (I hate cold food). So 3 stars because they don't care!
author: Sanita M.

description:
I am a big meat lover myself and I always avoid vegetarian restaurants cuz everything is tasteless without meat for me. However, I was with my friends and gave this place a try (social pressure I guess you understand). OMG, it is so good! I love their egg plant and their tofu! Their fried rice, hmmm, I guess they could do better than that. But what else can you expect from fried rice without meat right? 

It's one of the best vegetarian food I ever had. Even thought I would still prefer food with meat, but I won't resist the option without.
author: Alexis R.

description:
I just love this place ! 
The vegan option is great as I have allergies to fish and seafood, so no need to worry about any fish sauce or anything ! 
I just adore their garden vermicelli ! There are rice vermicelli, fresh herbs, veggies, vegan springrolls, peanuts and a sauce. There is also a protein substitute in this dish that looks really like beef and tastes pretty good too. 
The service is quick and efficient. Loving Hut is located in the food court of Westfield, really close to the Bart Station (Powell). There is plenty of seatings. 
I also say I'll try something new on their menu but I'm so fond of the garden vermicelli that I haven't tried anything else yet :-)
author: Caroline P.

description:
Vegan food...in a mall food court? Although a little
skeptical, my post-flight craving for a pile of veggies lead me in Loving Hut's direction. 

This restaurant is one of many located on the lower level of Westfield mall. They offer Asian-inspired vegan eats--a few salads, sandwiches, and hot options that you can use to create a combo. I opted for a plate of steamed kale, eggplant with tofu, and spicy green beans. The plate was satisfying and definitely beat an order of Kung Pao chicken, though still tasted pretty "mall food court" if you ask me. 

Word to the wise: if you avoid soy in any way, steer clear of this restaurant. It appears that they only use soy based protein, which is great if that's what you're into but personally not my favorite.
author: Megan R.

description:
Ordered:
- 2 order combo: fried rice, red curry with vegetables, and lemongrass tofu. ($9.25)
+ The fried rice didn't have much taste.
+ The red curry with vegetables was pretty flavorful and was definitely the favorite of the bunch.  I coated my fried rice with the sauce from the curry and it made the rice taste really good.
+ The lemongrass tofu was kind of dry and wasn't really appetizing.

Would I come back? Probably not... If I tried something here again, I'd stick with the curry and try something else... Although I'm not sure there are any other vegetarian options in the mall (although I'm not a vegetarian), I'd rather try out the other places at Westfield.  I highly suggest going to Ajisen (for ramen) on the SF Shopping Center side, next to Panda Express.
author: Gilda W.

description:
The food was absolutely delicious. I got the rice, sweet potato curry, and veggie curry. It absolutely filled me up and tasted so yummy. To me, the portions were not small.  The entire place was filled with food. For two plates of this for 2 people, it was $22. I also want to note how this place did not have a line today while places with the word "cheesesteak" in them had very long lines.
Another note- the meat-eater I was with loved the eggplant tofu.
I already miss their food... If you like curry and or tofu, both of which I love, you will love this place as well!
author: Sarah C.

description: In the predawn apocalypse of my skittering toward a meatless option for an early dinner, I waded through the basement food court in a mall version of a high school cafeteria. Greeted by a smattering of Cantonese pleasantries, overheard verbal exchanges between the young female counter workers, I imagined they were giggling about White Gorilla wants health food. I ordered the wam sesame kale with tofu and broccoli in Thai-ish peanut sauce, all of which was tasty yet on the Luke Warm side of temp-temp. They also poured me an unsweetened green iced tea, which was super adorable and delicious; I would recommend this happy yellow "meatfree" joint to a vegan in mall duress.
author: Ronald P.

description:
First time going to vegetarian place (which located at the food court in the westfield mall) that actually sell few vietnamese food. I always wanted to try it whenever i passed by this place. 

When looking at the kind of food they have, it seems like they have small selection of what food you can get. You either look at the food menu or look at the already cook food. I got the pho noodle  soup since i was craving for soup. It costs about $9.25 or so. Quite expensive since they dont give much vegetarian meat and noodle for a medium size bowl. Made me felt half full...broth had good flavor but heatness was more like warm.
author: Julie N.

description: It's pretty decent place for quick bite. Price is reasonable and plenty of seating available since it's inside a mall.
author: Sal S.

description: Sooooh good. Yum yum yum. If you are trying a plant based diet or just love salads, veggies and healthy food, try this place. Queens is my favorite. I'm getting hungry just writing about it :)
author: Alex K.

description: Usually get the Spicy Royal Noodle soup and it never fails. Tried the 2 time combo today with eggplant tofu and the sweet potato curry with noodles and loved it too
author: Alka M.

description:
I had been to this Loving Hut several times before I moved to SF, and even today I am STILL impressed with their offerings. The food is great, well flavored, and priced right. 

While my tastes have changed over the years and I've strayed away from fake meat products, I was surprised at how well balanced the vermicelli dish was with the noodles, seitan, peanuts, sauce, spring rolls, etc. Essentially, throughout the day I described this dish as a spring roll in a bowl (with fried rolls on top). It was so good and light...I didn't feel like I was going to fall asleep at my desk at work afterwards, huge plus! Highly recommended as an excellent, decently priced lunch option.

Below is my original Happy Cow review posted on 09/15/2010 (HC is an excellent resource when looking for vegan places around the world):

Posted on 09 / 15 / 2010
This location is situated in the food court of the popular Westfield San Francisco Shopping Centre. Normally I wouldn't be jumping up an down about food court restaurants, but I'm surely jumping up and down about this one. First thing, this is a great place to go to if you're traveling with someone that is not veg*n, as there are plenty of great choices for them within the food court and there are actually good options. This food court is also connected to the BART stop at Powell, so if you're coming in on the subway, walk on in.

As always, the employees at Loving Hut were very nice. One thing I noticed is that they didn't have the TV's broadcasting things from their religion/beliefs - although I don't have a problem with their TV station, I often have a hard time getting some friends to go to their restaurants because of it. The location is very clean, cute, and inviting as well and there were many people ordering food from here (a very good sign). I ordered the Philly Cheese Steak and absolutely fell in love - I'm not sure if I loved it so much because I hadn't eaten for over 14 hours, but wow! The sandwich itself was very flavorful, they even had a garlic flavoring on the bread, the flavor of the sauce was very well done, and the seitan was tasty and had a great texture. The sandwich also came with a side of cole slaw (very good) and two slices of orange. Overall, this place is great and I will surely be eating here at least one more time before I leave - this is also the train stop that goes back to the airport.
author: Christina M.

description:
Legit mall food for the conscientious mall warrior. Nice employees too. 
The Pho is not all that but they more than make up for it with the Spicy royal noddle soup, which is their best dish. Do yourself a kindness.
author: Winter M.

description: Whats not to love about this place its all Vegan. Right up my ally.  Can't complain! I love their sandwiches to rice and noodle plates to their beverage menu! Definitely a fan!
author: Meishi M.

description:
Damn, didn't know vegan tasted so good, but hurt my wallet so bad....
I ordered the philly sandwich & the tofu spring rolls, my total was almost 18$.
I never had a tofu "philly sandwich" that tasted almost just as good as if it were actual beef. The tofu was well marinated and had a "beefy" texture that didn't make me miss the beef taste as I thought I would. The sandwich had arugula that offered a nice balance with the sweet tofu. I liked how the sandwich gives you a side of fish sauce to dip into, which gives it a nice Vietnamese touch. 
Spring rolls were boring.. Not much memorable sour it. I'd skip it if you are looking for a pleasing appetizer.
author: Maria C.

description: This is a little Loving Hut in the shopping mall.  The menu is entirely vegan.  I had the Philly Steak Sandwich, along with a slice of cheesecake.   Both were amazing.   The Philly Steak had a creamy sauce that was outstanding.
author: Anthony A.

description:
This Westfield mall food court stand serves some solid vegan Thai food. The portions were a little skimpy in my opinion, but I was super hungry after traveling and walking around since 4 am.

The following are very delicious:
1. Sweet potato curry
2. Eggplant tofu
3. Spring rolls

The cooked dishes are slightly greasy despite being vegan, so if I'm feeling indulgent I'd consider ordering food from here again. The spring rolls are a must though.. super fresh and light!
author: Christina C.

description:
Mall food? Meh. Wait...you haz a Loving Hut? *heart*

Waltzed all the way downstairs to the food court. And there it stood. Refraining from drooling and ordering one of everything (as I had a big dinner planned a few hours after) I settled for ordering a smoothie and steamed bao to snack! 

The ladies behind the counter were friendly. I wanted a Strawberry smoothie however was informed they were all out for the day. So I got the Kale Drink instead. It was nice they heated up the bao before it was served. It was also nice to see them use a good bunch of fresh kale (no skimping, the blender was completely stuffed!) and fresh dates (my love...) into their vitamix. 

The steam bao was reminiscent of the "cha siu bao" aka pork buns. It captures the sweet and savory flavors really well. All the taste without the cruelty. I definitely enjoyed the small treat! If only Arden Arcade Mall would open a Loving Hut...sigh.
author: Alice A.

description: If I'm in the area and I need vegan this is a reliable go-to. On some days the dishes they have are better than others. Overall I would say that while this isn't my favorite place to go to, it is convenient and it is more or less healthy. I'll echo some of the other reviews and say that the service is generally good but sometimes not so much. Again, for vegan this is a good choice unless you want to do a bunch of walking.
author: Paul K.

description:
Looking for a quick lunch, my friend and I dropped into the shopping center's food court. I held down a table while she went scouting for noms. When she came back, she opened up a vermicelli bowl that looked fairly standard, but it was vegan. Interested, I followed suit and picked up one of my own. 

I'm not vegan, but that's how I roll when I'm with my girl, and I'm usually not disappointed with the food. I ate the entire meal and left satisfied. No meat necessary.
author: Lisa S.

description:
All vegan, which is great, but it's also the same old Asian/Vegan fare which isn't super inspiring.  I can here for a sandwich ahead of a dinner event I knew wouldn't be vegan.  The sandwich was OK, if a bit heavy, and it kept as leftovers for the next day.

Ultimately though, this is mall food, and a bustling mall dining experience, which is why I only give it 3 stars.  The food also took a tiny bit longer than I might have expected to come, given that there was no line.

I'd come again for sure in a pinch, but only if I can't go anywhere else.
author: Peter N.

description: Just visited with my family...we're all plant based. The food is greasy beyond belief. The customer service is slow and rude. The venue itself is filthy. So sad that vegan faire is being presented in this way. The food has the potential to be really good if they would hold back on the oil and salt...it tasted like vegan panda express which I understand some people may like but it could be so much better. Stay away if you care about cleanliness, service and your arteries.
author: Jodi V.

description: Not the choice for those with sensitive stomachs. It may cause upset stomach and nausea... within hours of consumption. The food tasted decent, but one should question the food-handling safety practiced here. Loving Hut is "the Vegan 'panda express'".
author: Lydia V.

description: Vegan food and delicious? I'm in! I'm most definitely not a vegetarian nor a vegan but this place has been on my mind before as I always been wanting to try it so today was the day. They have food already prepared, similar to Panda Express in a way. I got the two item choice with brown rice and the eggplant w/ tofu and the sweet and savory. Total was $10 which is a good price for vegan food. The food was amazing which made me not miss the meaty taste at all. The sweet and savory has chicken like tofu cubes while the eggplant and bigger softer tofu. I really liked the sweet and sour dish better than the eggplant since it was greaser. The only downside was that food was a little too greasy. Overall, this place is worth it for the price and their amazing flavors.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Eh, not my favorite lunch spot in Soma, but doable when there are very few customers.  But if you order pho during lunch hour... 

You can experience surly service at the counter as you watch 4 people get their orders ahead of you.  By "you," I mean "I."  

Got my money back before that number grew to 5,6,7...?
author: Miran C.

description:
The first time I tried to have their vegan meatball sandwich, it wasn't available.  So today I tried again and finally got to taste it. It tasted good! I mean, I'm definitely no expert, but the fake meatballs really tasted like meatballs. But it was supposed to come with marinara sauce. Now, that's something I do consider myself an expert on. But the sauce on this sandwich looked and tasted nothing like marinara sauce. I mean, totally different. Don't get me wrong, it was good. But...
If you're making a meatball sandwich with fake meatballs, shouldn't you try to make it as realistic as possible? And isn't it easy to make vegan marinara sauce that actually looks and tastes like marinara?
Or is the problem that the folks at Loving Hut don't know what marinara sauce tastes like?
That's scary.
author: Robert C.

description: Called these guys up to ask one question and they put me on hold for about 7 min before hanging up.
author: Sahlik K.

description: I was so excited to see this restaurant in San Francisco yesterday since we had such a great experience at the Loving Hut in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia few months ago. We were very disappointed when we tasted the food. Perhaps it could be because we ordered pre-cooked  food from under the heat lamp? It tasted like food from Panda Express. The menu was different from the LH in Mongolia also. The staff was very friendly and pleasant.
author: S M.

description: The lady with the glasses serving food is exceptionally rude. I asked just for noodles and rice as I am overcoming food poisoning. I did not want to stuff myself and then end up having to gag all the food out. However, when I asked for just noodles and rice, the server acted as if she didn't hear me and said 'noodles, rice, and ..' I was a little confused so I repeated myself 'is it alright to just have two items?' The server proceeded to 'well for $1 you can have an extra item. ' I did not want to make a scene as there were customers waiting in line so I asked 'what do you recommend ?' She said 'tofu and tofu'. Me 'ok...' great.. I ended up throwing half the portion of my food away
author: Ohduh H.

description:
For sure, I'm an omnivore...and funnily enough I was sitting opposite someone today on the bus who was reading the Omnivore's Dilemma.

The last few days, however, I've been feeling very vegetarian-inclined. I've been craving greens like crazy.

That's when I recalled that there is Loving Hut at the Westfield Center underground.
Loving Hut saved my life!
I was starving after a long day out and I wanted something really healthy.

I siddled over to the Loving Hut counter and saw the beautiful Steamed kale, the Tofu stir-fried in lemongrass and the tofu with eggplant.

My mouth watered.
My head said, "Gotta have it!"
The two item combo plate ($8.95) allows you a choice of fried rice or noodles. A deal!
I got the above with the tofu with lemongrass yesterday. Awesome!
I got the above with the tofu with eggplant today. Awesome!

I don't think I'll be getting tired of Loving Hut anytime soon. I'm going to have to check out their other locations in the City as well.
Yup, I'm an omnivore but I can do vegetarian too.
author: Joanna T.

description: The staff is super accommodating and friendly. I came here on a whim while browsing the mall area. They have salads, sandwiches and deserts. I tried the philly cheese steak and the luv special sandwich, along with their cheese cake. The beverages were coconut water, assorted sparkling juices and some teas. The proteins blasted away any expectations I had, they are probably some of the best I've ever eaten. I can tell they did use Daiya also, which made it super yummy. The food was light and not too filling. I wish we had one of these in North Carolina! I really enjoyed this place, and hope to see them expand to other areas
author: Melanie S.

description: My second bad review of the day (BARF). They recommended this place for lunch, and today I gave it a try during lunch. BAD IDEA. I had to come back to return my vegan spicy pho because there was a damn hair. It was strangling the damn noodle! I was so livid! I had to walk all the way from my work place back to this place with only 7 minutes left out of my lunch time! Although they were respectful about giving me back my money, NEVER AGAIN. Regardless I don't trust this food court!
author: M M.

description:
I had the Spicy Royal Noodle Soup, and it was too greasy!  The noodles were also not the typical pho noodles.  I just couldn't get over the fact how greasy the soup was - my friend had the regular pho noodle soup which wasn't great at all!
I don't think I will come back since the soup was way too greasy!
author: Nicole S.

description:
The price is very good and their serving size is generous.

If you're looking for something more on the raw side, I'd go for their garden vermicilli. It has a great amount of vegetables and their vegan meats taste like actual meat. I imagine it's a great source of protein too! It includes a couple spring rolls, which taste amazing.

Although I got their garden vermicilli multiple times, I recently began to enjoy their steam combo, which is rice or chow mein with two entrees. My favorite is their mushrooms. I'm not a big fan of their red curry sweet potato, but their sweet and sour tofu is really good.
author: Raakin H.

description: Came by here for a quick bite to eat before heading off to the airport and was amazed at how tasty the food was! I just ordered the loving hut sandwich and I'd have to say, that was one of the best vegan sandwiches I've ever tasted! Just wished it was a little bigger hahaha. I would totally order it again and maybe try some of the Asian-style dishes next time! I also love the fact that they have so many different dishes to choose from. Each time you visit, you could try something new!
author: Bella B.

description: First time here, it's so delicious! Got the philly sandwich, SUPERB!!! wish i lived in san fran so i could come here all the time!
author: Seruni E.

description: Great vegan/vegetarian option in the mall!  They have a number of hot foods that you can choose from for a 3 combo plate. I really like their eggplant and tofu dishes. Tip: you can skip the rice in the 3 combo plate and get 3 entrees instead!  You can also sample the hot foods before you place your order.  They used to have a full restaurant in North Beach, but it sadly closed last year.  Glad that this place is doing well!  Some of these dishes can be a little salty, so just an FYI.
author: Naomi P.

description: I am not a vegetarian or a vegan, but I really enjoyed the meal I had. I'd recommend to anyone. Can't wait to go back and try another one of those delicious and healthy meals!
author: Ari W.

description:
Who would have guessed there would be Vegan options at a Food Court? I was surprise myself. Anytime we are out shopping or with a group of friends or family, this is usually the area we meet up. Since it is accessible to BART. 

My go to order is the Vermicelli bowl. Heck as much as I order it, I don't remember the name. LOL. It has it all...noodles, "beef", veggies, broth and they top it off with two eggrolls. Great for the winter and summer. Can't go wrong with this dish, a must order.

My other favorite item here is the fresh spring roll with peanut dipping sauce. Perfectly wrap with tofu and veggies. It's so good, I sometimes just order this for a snack while we are shopping.

Don't leave this place without getting dessert. The Oreo cake is AMAZING! No matter where we eat in SF, I'll always swing by here to get dessert. I guess it's because there is not a lot of vegan dessert options in this area.

So what are you waiting for, after that long day of shopping or before you get your $$ spending spree, hit up this place and enjoy a tasty meal.
author: Rachel B.

description: Nice concept here but don't be fooled it's basically meatless Vietnamese style food with lots of tofu as a substitute. I opted for the royal noodle soup for my late breakfast and since I've always wanted to try this spot I knew that this was going to be a long foodie day I felt compelled to opt for this guilt free delight. The soup itself was flavorful and not too overly spicy, it was like a typical spicy bowl of pho but with tofu as the main ingredient. The ladies had just opened up so I wasn't able get a glimpse of their other items. Luckily o was in the mood for their soup anyways. Pretty simple meal and the big plus was I didn't feel guilty after eating in the food court. It's a nice change of pace of you feel the need to try the vegan lifestyle. Give this place a try but consider the fact the soups are basically Vietnamese style pho with veggies and tofu as the main ingredients.
author: Omar R.

description: I actually loved there food. There have large vegan/vegetarian selection. In fact they don't carry meat at all. Portions are huge and easily shareable. I choose to create my own plate. I gave a try to steamed kale(it was a bit oily for me), coconut curry yellow tofu and noodles. It filled me up and was under $10
author: Ilmia N.

description:
Food is pretty good for mall food court. Since it's pre-prepared in metal tubs I can't go to 4 stars though.  I also knocked it down for the sign I saw. See my picture. 

Not happy about the sign that says "this may or not be organic due to price restrictions or availability". Either u commit to organic or not. Otherwise, I'm assuming u will do the cheap or easy thing. When u eat vegan I assume organic kind goes with the turf.
author: Jim T.

description: My go to place when I'm feeling guilty after too much meats. The royal spicy noodle soup is awesome!
author: Tinou B.

description:
Every time I've visited San Francisco, I've been to this Loving Hut. Food has always been great. However, yesterday I went and the portion size was abysmally small. When I said more Chow Mein they wanted to charge $2, which would have been fair if the portion size had been normal.

Definitely overpriced for the amount of food they give. It certainly used to be more in the past.
author: Hari S.

description: Got the spicy tofu noodle soup and it was amazing!! Ever non-vegans loved the food here. Was fast and friendly service and will definitely be back!
author: Cass M.

description:
I think this location is great, but after trying the location in San Diego, I don't think it meets my standard.

I think the portions are great, the service is good, and food is fresh. But, in terms of the options on the menu as well as the overall taste, I still think the San Diego location is the best by far. But, keep in mind that this may be because I am bias because I love Mexican food and the SD location is the only one that I have seen American and Mexican options for on the menu.

Regardless, if you are looking for good vegetarian options, this place is great!!!
author: Umang P.

description:
Ambiance: It's in the mall, so find your own seat. Thank goodness we came here on a non-busy Monday for dinner. It's SF's main mall so of course it's gotta be lively because if it wasn't, it must mean that aliens have taken over the planet and humans are hiding like hermits.

The set-up of Loving Hut is exactly like a fast food Chinese restaurant. Although, there's more than just picking 2 items + rice.
