They offer a variety of delicious looking vegan foods such as spring rolls and noodles! Yum! Because there were so many delicious-looking dishes out of display, I opted for 2 items + rice. 

Service: My server was so nice! I asked if I could substitute the rice for another item and he enthusiastically answered with "Of course you can!" He even wished me a good meal and good evening multiple times. Such a sweetie! :)

Food: 3 items (Sweet potato curry, sweet & sour savory, kale)

Sweet potato curry - OMG THIS IS THE BOMB. Everyone needs to try this. It's sweet like Thai curry and has just a tiny tinge of spicy. 

Kale - Plain and decorated with sesame seeds. A great base and substitute for rice! :) This went very well with the curry and sweet & sour savory. It turned my 3 item plate into a cooked yummy salad. :)

Sweet & sour savory - Tastes just like sweet & sour chicken at your typical fast food Chinese restaurant, but without the meat. Very tasty! I love my sweet food. ;)

Price: $9.75

Tip: - Sweet potato curry is amazing!!

Conclusion: I really enjoyed my meal here today! I would definitely come back whenever I'm in the city. Next on my list to try is the avocado smoothie and spring rolls! Eeep, so excited for my next trip back! xD
author: Cindy M.

description:
So stir-fried beef vermicelli is my favorite Vietnamese dish. Love, love, love it and my benchmark for Vietnamese places. Well, in the middle of chatting with my friend about my dish (Garden Bowl. Which is precisely that plus two imperial rolls!) I was gushing about my love for fish sauce until my friend pointed out there was no fish in the sauce -- because duh it's vegan. I literally stopped mid-sentence when I realized the gravity of that statement. Yes, it's that good.

Yeah, it's vegan so obviously the soy protein beef isn't the exact same, but it's pretty damn close. You also get a filling meal with two rolls that's still light and flavorful. Very good bang for your buck.
author: Ramee S.

description:
Fake vegan!

They put so much sauce that upset my stomach; turned my Friday night treat into Friday evening dead!
author: Michelle W.

description: Love the spicy tofu and coconut curry. Th noodles and fried rice are great too. Makes for a great quick vegetarian takeaway
author: Harshad M.

description:
Definitely vegan heaven. I love their sweet yellow sweet potato curry, and chow mein! 
I would highly recommend this place to people who like good fusion chinese/vietnamese/thai food.
author: Shalini P.

description: good vegan Vietnamese food. I had the basil mushroom and sweet potato curry. Fast service although the staff is very busy trying to get all the food and orders out. Just be aware if you have special needs outside of the normal lunch rush program - its hard to get their attention unless you are in their work flow.
author: Marandah R.

description:
Great meals, good to have a Vegan option in such a busy and large food court.

I personally am not Vegan, but my Girlfriend is and she was excited to try it. She wasn't let down, and neither was I! The food is great, with the bonus of being Vegan. 

We had the Queen Sandwich and Loving Hut Sandwich, both of which were delicious. We also got a strawberry smoothie which was great, though very strong. They have Thai Iced Tea, which seems to be a very difficult thing to find as a Vegan.
author: Colonel N.

description: The food here is nothing special...i got the one item combo which comes with fried rice or noodle. Tried the sweet potato curry which is nothing special. It's reasonably priced but that's about it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It wasn't listed on the mall directory map when I walked in - but it is down there in the food court!

The Loving Hut Sandwich was delicious and a hearty size (plus side of zesty cole slaw). 

I also tried my friend's noodles - they were awesome as well. Oreo cake was great. Golden rolls were great and only $3.50 or something.

I'll be back often!
author: Stuart F.

description:
I really like this place. I'm not a huge meat eater and I like my veggies so this place works for me.

Today I tried their crispy tenders and sweet potato fries. Let me tell you, I don't eat fried foods often. These were not overly greasy at all. The tenders are made of soy protein. I liked these. Savory and then sweet from the fries.

I've had their Heavenly Salad before. The dressing is good and is evenly distributed.  It's kind of a big portion for me but I can finish most of it. 

I had their strawberry shake before. It was just alright from what I remember. Looking forward to trying their their avocado shake next time. 

Haven't had their hot plate combos yet but they do look good.
author: Karen G.

description: In a rare instance, I was stranded in the Westfield food court due to a BART delay and wasn't sure about the options in front of me. While I'm not vegan, I definitely lean towards a vegetarian diet and as far as mall food courts go, those options are typically scant. Enter Loving Hut. While the food wasn't mind-blowing, I'm definitely a fan of the garden vermicelli noodle dish I got. It comes with soy protein in sort of a beef-flavored style, vermicelli noodles, an "eggless" egg roll, greens and a delicious sauce to pour over everything. I felt great afterward, especially knowing everything I ate was completely vegan.
author: Rachel F.

description: I want to love this place more, but it's $11 for one entree. I say 1 because I had to pick out soo much peppers and onions from my "2 entree". I enjoy eating them but it's such a overwhelming amount of it. In the picture you will see what I mean. I will have to stop coming here unfortunately it's a rip off. :/
author: Selina K.

description: Fabulous Vietnamese style vegan food. Reasonable prices with good size portions and fresh tasty food.
author: Holmes B.

description: Very good! It's located in the food court, but don't let that fool you. There's a nice variety of flavorful food.
author: Ania N.

description: Good vegan food . Had  tropical salad too much to eat. Had  enough for dinner. Friend had heavenly salad. Also lots of leftovers. Good value
author: Joel L.

description:
When I think vegan, I think healthy. In short, my experience at Loving Hut did not feel healthy at all.

My friend and I both got the Spicy Royal Noodle Soup. The first thing I noticed was the enormous bowl. The portion was quite generous. Then I noticed the amount of oil in the soup. I was taken back from the abundance of the grease and hoped it won't get me into trouble.

Taste-wise, the noodle soup was okay. The noodles were standard so were the mushroom, tofu, and bean sprouts. The soy protein was interesting. I could've done with or without it. As for the broth, it gave me stomach pains. The grease was so overpowering that I barely ate half of the noodle soup.

If you have a healthy digestive tract like my friend, then go on ahead and have that noodle soup. But if you're like me with a sensitive stomach, I'd suggest figuring out what you can handle first before ordering.
author: Marti L.

description: The food tastes healthy. I probably should have just picked one tofu dish - I ended up with a lot of tofu. The fried rice was not oily. They have a good variety of cooked vegetables to choose from. This is definitely one of the better choices for food in the mall.
author: James S.

description: I've eaten at this Loving Hut location and at other locations and have enjoyed the food.  The food is good and I fully support this chain's mission of serving plant-based food.  The service I received at this location yesterday was terrible. No matter the mission, I cannot support a restaurant that treats customers poorly.  I was there with my toddler and tried to buy a side a rice, a side of avocado, and a side of any fresh vegetables they had in their inventory.  As much as I want him to be, my toddler is not amenable to vegetables in any kind of sauce.  Although LH had these items on hand, they refused to sell them to me stating management policy.  Perhaps there were specific reasons why they can not sell these as sides to customers but they didn't explain the rationale, just merely stated, in a rude manner, it was against their policy.  I was willing to pay whatever they wanted to charge me but they did not budge.  I will not be supporting their business in the future.
author: Amy L.

description: The service was terrible. The lady at the cashier was not nice and was very unfriendly. The cashier is hiding behind trays and a fountain drink machine. When your order is ready, the service is so unprofessional that you have to ask for everything, even napkins. I understand that the staff may not speak English well enough or at all, but that is not an excuse to mistreat costumers ( the costumer before me was also quiet unhappy). Worse, the food is not very good at all. I ordered a soup and it was served in a plastic bowl! (others at this location serve their food on chinaware) silverware, a tiny plastic spoon. I am not coming back, for the price they charge you can do better in many better places.
author: Hugo H.

description: Every time I'm in San Francisco I visit this location. Friendly staff and always a wide variety of vegan food to choose from.
author: Tommy M.

description: The whole food court emporium area down here is nice and there seem to be a lot of great options. Loving hut is all vegan and has a good selection of hot entrees, sandwiches, salads, and some desserts. I got the two Thai curries which were good, not great, but I definitely look forward to going back and trying more stuff. It all looked good. Price for two choices of hot entree and rice is $9.
author: Alyssa N.

description:
Man, I had a TERRIBLE experience with loving hut.

I came in and ordered stuff from their pre-made menu, where they have it out in trays and you just order from it. I got the lo mein noodles with sweet potato curry and tofu & eggplant, and I thought the food was ok - I was trying to decide if I'd give it a 3 or a 4. After I finished eating I thought that maybe I'd eaten a little too much, because I was feeling a little uncomfortable. I decided to stop by my office, which was pretty close, instead of going home. I'm really glad I did, because once I got to the office I started dry heaving and eventually threw up. Once I did, I felt a lot better - but man, what an experience! And that was the only thing I'd had that day, other than yogurt for breakfast (which I'd been eating, so that def didn't cause the food poisoning).

Never coming back.
author: Amaresh S.

description:
This was my first time trying out the "fast" shopping center food court version of the sit-down restaurant chain I am otherwise familiar with. Was in need of a quick snack to take with me and was curious how this location's fare was, and I was definitely not disappointed :)

I got the sweet potato fries with "chicken" tenders, plus some rice and the sauteed eggplant dish and it was all quite tasty. Mr. Piano (who isn't vegetarian) stole some fries and crispy tenders and was pretty enamored of them as well! Next time I want to try some of their drinks and such (like the Thai iced tea), and will definitely need to avail myself of some of their desserts!

The staff is really friendly, and they were pretty quick with my to go order when I was there. Definitely a good addition to the food court, and I will be back again next time I'm in the area and hungry :)
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The food here is alright. I've eaten here twice and was very pleased with some dishes but not the others. It is definitely overpriced. 

I got the avocado smoothie, coconut noodles, vermicelli, cheesecake, and green tea. They overloaded the green tea cup with so much ice that my sister only got a few sips from it. It was pretty disappointing considering that our total came out to almost $40. The avocado smoothie was really bland. One would expect it to be a bit more tasteful than just tasting like straight avocado, but it really seemed like I was just drinking blended avocado with a little bit of sugar. I know that you may think,"Well, what were you thinking.. You got an avocado smoothie!" I thought it would be a bit more delightful and this is a personal opinion. I am a great fan of avocados, just not of this smoothie. 

The vermicelli was amazing. I would eat it every day. This dish rates 5+ stars. Tastes like real meat. (Yes, I'm an omnivore. Don't kill me.)

The cheesecake was bland and tasteless. Would not order again. And to clue you in, I am not a fan of super sweet desserts, so me saying that it is bland should tell you something. I mean, I eat bowls of white rice unseasoned and celery raw. I like bland. Bland actually has my last name in it. (Lan is my last name.)

My sister got the coconut noodles and hated it. That's saying a lot for her because she hates wasting food but she did not finish it. Even her garbage disposal boyfriend didn't finish it.

All in all, this is a review coming from omnivores. Perhaps it's because our taste buds have been tainted and destroyed by meat. Perhaps we have not been eating enough GMO, grass-fed, organic, gluten-free products to build a loving for Loving Hut, but we did not enjoy 80% of our order here on our first try. The second time I went back, I actually forgot that I had already ordered the avocado smoothie before and didn't like it and made the same mistake again, then was WTF-ing myself all the way back to my sister's apartment. I enjoyed the vermicelli from last time. That is an absolute must.

Overpriced for mediocre food.
author: Esther L.

description:
Thai Tea, Sesame Chicken Bites, fries, cherry icecream, and Coconut Cheesecake were AMAZING!  The rest of what we ordered were okay-good, but not great.

Staff was friendly!!!!
author: Joni L.

description:
I didn't feel the love at the Loving Hut, and that seems so wrong, doesn't it? After my initial disappointment that their name didn't signify that they sold aphrodisiacs and contraceptives, I tried to get over it and regale in the fact that it was a plant-based eatery smack in the middle of the Westfield Food Emporium. I've been trying to be very good about my diet only going out to places that provide vegetarian options. What I'm discovering is that just because a place serves veg-heads doesn't mean taste gets thrown out the window. Witness places like Gracias Madre and Thai Idea, restaurants that have figured out how to serve food you actually want to eat again. Sadly the Loving Hut is not in that camp.

The execution is quite pedestrian, and I made the mistake of ordering from their tired-looking buffet - two dishes with brown rice for $8.25. Unfortunately like most Chinese fast-food eateries, the food had been left in the warmers too long by 3:30PM, and it was scorchingly hot while lacking in genuine flavor at the same time. I tried a combination of their Eggplant Tofu - which indeed was eggplant and tofu, not an eggplant-flavored tofu - sauteed in that familiar brown sauce we all know from the dregs of the red egg & ginger parties. Added to that hot mess was the Szechuan Green Bean which also had tofu strips to make it substantial. Didn't work since it just drooped from the pool of garlic oil in my plate (see photo). Unlike Englebert Humperdinck, after the loving, I'm not in love with the Loving Hut.

FOOD - 2 stars...bad buffet
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...it's the mall, stupid
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...I honestly can't remember, so I'll split the difference
TOTAL - 2 stars...when loving is wrong, nothing goes right
author: Ed U.

description: Solid vegetarian food-court option.  I had the lemongrass tofu, which was well-flavored and not too oily.  The single portion (without rice) was large enough for lunch, plus a sizable amount of leftovers.
author: Katie E.

description: Was a pleasant surprise to find such an awesome vegan spot in a food court - organic tofu & eggplant sauté with sides of BBQ mushrooms and steamed sesame kale for $10! Great value, big portions, and very flavourful. I definitely recommend if you are in the area and you need something quick in a pinch!
author: Jenna M.

description: I've been to many loving hits before and they had great food as usual. Not greasy or oily. I did think that they were not giving out as big portions as I have experienced with other loving huts.
author: Rashmi P.

description:
Since the food choices around the Union Square/Powell Street station area are a tad limited, I've been planning on going to Loving Hut for quite a while now. 

After an exhausting day walking all around downtown San Francisco, my friend and I decided to do a little shopping then get some dinner. I looked up where Loving Hut was located, and was surprised to find that it was right inside Westfield! We figured that it would be in the food court on the bottom floor.

It was -- though it does take a little snooping around to find it. It's tucked behind a counter with a couple of tall chairs, so the sign isn't obvious at first. But come around on the side where the San Francisco Soup Company is, and you'll see it.

Now, Loving Hut looks like a regular ol' Chinese food takeout place... at first. But upon closer inspection, you see that they have sides like kale and papaya salads.

My friend and I both decided to get their Rainbow Salad, which was chock full of all sorts of nutritious veggies and soy protein. After a day of eating unhealthy foods, this salad was like a godsend. Not to mention, the peanut sauce dressing that came with the salad was SO. GOOD.

Since, for whatever reason, it's pretty difficult to find healthy places to eat in San Francisco, I know I'll be back at the Loving Hut.
author: Sara C.

description:
I've been eyeing this place every time I am at Westfield Mall so I finally pulled the trigger this last weekend. 

I ordered the Garden Vermicelli, which comes with soy-based "fake beef." it took a little longer to get my food but it was well-worth the wait. My best friend & I order the same thing & people kept coming up to us to ask us what we ordered because it looked THAT GOOD, lol. It came with veggie spring rolls, so yummers dude! Gahhhh, love veggie spring rolls!

Filled me up but not food-coma filled me up. lol.
I recommend it.
It is Vegan, FYI.
author: Camille C.

description:
I really appreciate the fact that I can stroll into a mall food court with 5 other people, order a vegan lunch, find a table, and get my food in like 10 minutes. That's crazy! Plus, the food is good. I personally went with the steamed table combo which includes two items and rice for $8.50. Here's a secret though - they'll give you half noodles and half rice if you want, or all noodles. Pretty cool stuff. And if you don't want the buffet-line style of food you can order directly from the menu, which is much appreciated.

Bottom line: good food, cheap prices, a quick in-and-out all add up to a nice little lunch pick.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I'm exploring my vegan side.

I've tried the Garden Vermicelli.  It is basically rice noodle with loads of lettuce, sprouts, chewy tofu beef, and vegetable egg rolls.  It comes with a light fish dressing.  In my mind, I thought vegans don't like flavors in their food...boy, was I wrong!  This dish was very tasty and more importantly, I didn't feel gross after I ate it.  

This is my first vegan adventure...let the exploration begin...
author: Jenny T.

description: I LOVE loving hut. Every location I've been to has always been fabulous. This one is in the food court at the mall, so food isn't made to order, but I was very pleased with every item I had.
author: Paige L.

description:
I don't know what kind of self-respecting meat lover gives a vegan place 5 stars, but I've always had trouble with self-respect. 

Loving Hut has become my guilt-free guilty pleasure. Guilty pleasure because well... I actually look forward to going to eat in the basement food court of the mall which isn't exactly cool.  And guilt-free because I'm eating vegan so anything I get here is healthy... right?!

Everything I've had here has been good... the pho - I love that they provide a few different types of soy protein so it changes up the texture and flavor. I thought I'd miss the meat, but I didn't. The fried rice, and "chow mein" type noodles have a hint of garlic but neither are overly oily. The eggplant and the "sweet and sour savory" is also really yummy. The 2 item combo gives you a huge plate of food and everything is so fresh and flavorful, you don't miss the meat.

The vermicelli is also quite awesome... though I saw someone ask for peanut sauce instead of the traditional vinaigrette which I think is a travesty. I know we all have our preferences but it's meant to be eaten with the vinaigrette... dumping peanut sauce all over it is just disgusting. ...Some may say the ladies behind the counter aren't the nicest... but when you have people totally disgracing their food by changing the dish entirely right in front of their faces, I'd be kind of annoyed too. 

There was another time when these older ladies were trying to arm twist them into giving them a little bit of everything for the price of the 2 item combo. Jesus... this isn't a buffet... people are trying to make a living here.. stick to the rules! Maybe it's something about me being asian... we just don't do that... be happy you get to eat food in a nice mall.... in life you don't get everything you want! God!
author: Bonnie H.

description: Food looked amazing. As a vegan, I was happy to see so many options for lunch. The customer service, however, was terrible. The workers looked miserable and had bad attitudes. I was allowed a maximum of 2 samples. My sister wasn't even allowed a sample. They were very dismissive of us and were reluctant to answer any questions that I had about the food. I obviously wasn't valued as a customer so I chose to eat elsewhere.
author: Normal G.

description:
Located in what is probably the fanciest food court I've ever been in, Loving Hut is a delicious vegan option just steps away from Union Square. The food was really good and there was a decent amount of it for a reasonable price. I ordered the two entrees / rice combo for about $10 with tax. This is no mall food-court plastic tasting Chinese food!

Also, bonus points for having real plates, silverware, and glasses for water. So fancy! I guess people in San Francisco really know how to dine in style at their shopping malls!
author: Alyssa J P.

description:
My mom took me to Loving Hut for lunch today.  We both ordered their Garden Vermicelli and we were happy we did.  Two large bowls filled with salad and herbs, two large vegan egg rolls, some vegan protein that looked like beef and hot vermicelli underneath all of this.  Both bowls came with sweet fish sauce.  

I was stuffed and it was such a better deal than the veggie bowls offered at Sorabol.  I used to like their veggie bowls but they now give much smaller portions for higher prices.  You get twice as much food for less money at Loving Hut and it's so much faster because there are no meat lovers standing in line here as they do at Sorabol.

High quality, healthy, fresh, tasty, and satisfying.  This is very rare in a mall full of junk food.  M.Y. China is my other go to place when I come to this mall and want lunch.

Highly recommended!
author: Lorissa W.

description: A little overpriced for a smaller plate of food, but everything I had was absolutely delicious. The veggie chow mein was perfect, and had the right ratio of veggies, and the spicy green bean mix was a vegetarian heaven. The carrots, broccoli, and green beans were cooked flawlessly and were just the right amount of spicy for a quick bite before more shopping.
author: Kyle B.

description:
3.5 stars

Located in the food court on the lower level of the Westfield mall, Loving Hut serves vegan Asian food, which is a feat in itself. I came by with family and family friends to duck out of the gusty wind and to grab some dinner. My sister and I shared a bowl of pho (Vietnamese "beef" soup) and a Thai iced tea. The iced tea was average, not enough tea flavor for my taste. As for the pho, it was decent, particularly for vegan pho. The fake meat and tofu pieces were quite tasty. I'd say the pho is good for vegan pho, but it just lacks that little somethin' in the broth, ya know?

Next time I'm around the area, I'm going to try a combo rice plate. Some of those sides look/sound pretty tasty!
author: Judith C.

description:
- The pho was relatively good for someone who typically likes beef pho. The garden vermicelli looked authentic, I might try that next time! ~$10
- The combo choices out in the open were tasty and fresh, not at all greasy and meh like panda express. I got the eggplant and tofu, kale and vegetable curry with fried rice for ~$11
author: Gabe L.

description: Loved this place! Portions are good, food is quality, and service is fast. So happy that I have a Vegan option now at a food court, hope they expand to more malls. :)
author: Leeana B.

description: My food was cold. I asked manager for something warm or a refund. She was very rude and said she would hear in microwave. Do not go here, waist of 10.00
author: Debra F.

description: Food is decent. I like their salad. Price is alright... however, their food  portion is small. $10 will not get you full, at least, for me.
author: Queenie L.

description: Very tasty all vegan. It was busy but worth the wait. Would certainly eat here agin when I'm in town
author: Jonathan A.

description:
Loving Hut is one of the many options available in the foot court area of the Westfield. 

I stopped by for lunch and there weren't too many people in line which was nice, but it took awhile for one of the workers to take my order, so I was left standing around awkwardly for quite a long time. I ordered the rainbow salad because it seemed to have a great variety of veggies, and it was under $10. They gave me a buzzer so I would know when my salad was ready, which I thought was a bit weird, but it really did take quite awhile for my order to come out. 

The salad was pretty good, but it was mainly cabbage and there was barely any tofu which I was looking forward to eating =( However, the peanut sauce was delicious, and the size of the salad was good for the price. If I came back here I would probably order from the hot food display instead of getting a salad again because it would probably fill me up longer.
author: Sam F.

description: The Loving Hut! My husbands favourite place in the world! For a food court place it equals any vegan restaurant I have eaten at! There is not one dish of the dozen or so we have tried that is not good! Their sauces are amazing and the food is light and healthy. We will continue to eat here regularly.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Food was tasty and fresh. The pork was definitely better than the chicken. This would have been 5 stars but they don't serve pho before 3 PM which was a downer as I was jonesing for some pho.
author: M. Todd S.

description:
Food is decent but nothing super special. 

I had the vegan chow mien and the spring rolls. Chow mien was greasy and didn't have a lot of veggies other than cabbage. 

Lastly it was inside a mall. Not what I was expecting, but the food is on par with food court food.
author: Tasha T.

description:
Grew up eating home cooked (meaty) Vietnamese food. Could eat here everyday.

On the lighter side, I'd get the Loving Hut salad or the old Garden Vermicelli standby. If in the mood for a sandwich, I'd go for the Queens Sandwich. The pho is good in a pinch.
author: Will T.

description: I love this place. The food is really good and everything they have is vegan. I found the staff to be fast and friendly.
author: Dean C.

description:
'Welcome to Vegan Panda Express, oops, I mean Loving Hut.'

I Can't Believe it's not Panda

Mock meat and other sorts of vegan craze have extended their far reach to the lower food court of Westfield. Loving Hut is considered by many to be a 'healthy' option. I think there is a misconception here. Vegan food is not necessarily healthy. Loving Hut is most definitely not.

Their oil drenched option packs their menu with calories, probably enough to jump start the number on your scale a bit. And instead of protein-rich meat, they just serve you even more carbs. Reverse-Atkins Diet.

You're really just trading in cholesterol for diabetes. Fair trade, until you realize Loving Hut charges mall price.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Westfield, a place filled with all kinds. Serious shoppers, casual browsers, tourist, and those people who just walk the food court grabbing free samples. Then you have me, this cat who honestly goes to Westfield mainly for one thing. And that my friends, is Loving Hut.

I happened across loving hut one day as I was wandering the food court and not being very interested in any of the options I passed by. As I continued toward the end of the area, it was then that Loving Hut hopped out at me. Vegetarian options? I'm game. I was feeling like I wanted something lighter, so I decided to try their heavenly salad. 

Let me honestly saw, this salad, paws down, lives up to its "heavenly" name. The salad has an absolutely amazing citrus dressing that is sweet and tangy and perfectly accentuates the flavors of the veggies and soy item. The portion is also very large and filling, but doesn't feel weigh you down. The salad is presented very beautifully and carefully which just adds another level of heaven for me. I can literally not stress enough, if you are here, GET THIS SALAD! I literally make trips to Westfield for this salad only, it truly is worth it. 

Service here is always prompt and friendly, and while this is a food court restaurant, it doesn't have that cheap "food courty" feel to it. I honestly feel like I'm at a restaurant when I am eating here. 

great service, and amazing food, right in the middle of Westfield! 

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
This place is getting five stars as compared to other food court locations. I felt it wasn't fair to dock stars for ambiance because of the location. 

The menu selection is fairly limited, but the food is so good. I find myself thinking about it regularly, though it's been a while since I've visited Sam Francisco. I've tried the soups, sandwiches, and some of the items from the hot food section, and all have been top-notch.

I've been to about 10 Loving Hut locations around the world, and this is one of my favorites.
author: Lisa O.

description: This restaurant is in the Westfield San Francisco Central Mall. The environment is nice and the waiters are so kind. They offer many kinds of vegetables, rice, noodles and beverages. I ordered fried rice and two dishes. It tastes good.
author: Nancy S.

description: I came here with my friend after work looking for some unique healthy dinner options. Nice staff and clean kitchen. Their choices are definitely limited but that is understandable as their kitchen is small. We got  vermicelli bowl, loving hut sandwich, and thai iced tea. Worth a try if youre into healthy vegan options!:)
author: Jeanie J.

description: Love the Loving Hut! I get the Rainbow Salad every time, so I literally can't speak for anything else on the menu, but the Rainbow Salad is enormous and delicious. Lots of cabbage and veggies, plus the soy protein (which is kinda weird if you're not into that kind of stuff, but I like it) and crunchies with a spicy peanut dressing (not too spicy, but it's on the side, so you can put on how much you like anyways). Always go here if I'm eating at the mall!
author: MaryKate M.

description:
The Queen sandwich is great. It's the only thing I've ever gotten here. I have never been able to try anything else in the food court because this place is so good. It's a little bit expensive for a sandwich, but it comes with a side salad and it's quality.

I'm not a big fan of faux meat, but the one in the sandwich is good! It tastes like a sweet barbecue sauce flavor. There are a lot of fresh veggies in it as well and some kind of mayonnaise-like sauce. 

My sister has also ordered the pre-made asian food that she likes to call "Vegan Panda Express" and she liked it! 

After a day of shopping, this is a great place to relax and eat healthy food.  I enjoy how they give me a buzzer so that I will know when my sandwich is done being made.  Then I don't even need to sit around to listen for my number being called.
author: Logan C.

description:
I've visited this location several times when visiting the Westfield. I've sampled the fresh veggie rolls, the Rainbow Salad and also gotten the combo plate with two hot items and rice. Each time, I've been consistently pleased with the taste and quality of the food.
To begin with the Rainbow Salad is huge!! With the shreds of soy protein, carrots, cucumbers and shredded lettuce, it's quite a colorful and filling meal. The peanut dressing doesn't drench the salad and they give you a good amount to mix in evenly. For $7.95 or $8.95 (forgot which it is) it's a fresh and delicious lunch.

As for the fresh veggie rolls, those can be a meal in and of itself with fresh tofu, veggies, not-fried wrap and their wonderful peanut sauce accompanying them.

When getting the hot items, I thought they were tasty and sufficient, although not blown away. It's decent food at a good price, but I'd recommend going with some of the fresher items like the salads or spring rolls. Overall it's probably a 3 star food experience, but I am bumping it a star for the quicker service and cheaper prices that are available versus other Westfield options. I also like the fact that they serve Thai Iced Tea with Soy Creamer-yummy!

The Yelp 100 Challenge!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Friends and I were studying in the food court. One person said they were vegan, but then they had a barbecue sandwich in their hands. Others were confused. We had laughs and good times.

Yes, behind their smizes the servers might want you to convert to their philosophy and way of eating. Yes, there's the TV playing the Supreme Master show on every channel. But these potentially Twilight Zonian factors are offset by the fact that I like this place's food when I'm already in the mall.

This kiosk-esque version lacks the full range of offerings found at the Stockton or Irving locations, but it also lacks the enclosure in which stacks of pamphlets and funny messages in the menu can begin to feel stifling. The open setting also gives some transparency to their "Chinese cult" image - one need look no further than the cooks to see that Supreme Pupilship is rather inclusive.
author: Dan B.

description: I was looking forward to trying this place out, I got the cheese steak sandwich and it was meh. It was way too sweet, so much mayo that it was difficult to eat ended up scraping some of it off. Side salad was also meh, had no dressing and tasted like Safeway bag salad. Did not feel like I got my moneys worth.
author: Lacy C.

description:
For food in a mall's food-court, this place is AMAZING. It's vegan, fresh and always has a good variety of food from which I can choose to fill up my plate with. 

Service: The servers are always slightly annoyed which is slightly annoying...but whatever. Not a huge deal. They fill up your plate well, but do sometimes skimp on the tofu, so watch out. 

Food: I love almost every dish I've tried there! I like that you can order brown rice instead of white if you want. The chowmein noodles are pretty good as well. The other really memorable dish that I have had is the mushroom tofu scramble. This was so great because it was just huge chunks of cooked mushrooms in a really good gravy and nice, medium soft tofu. With hot sauce and brown rice, this totally hit the spot! They also usually have some variety of vegetables and tofu dishes, noodles or fried rice, and currys (I've seen an eggplant one and lemongrass tofu one). 

Ambiance: It's in the food court, so they can't do much about that. But there is seating that they have attached to the little restaurant, kind of like bar seating near the backside. 

Verdict: I have been back here everytime I'm shopping in San Francisco, and I will definitely be returning!
author: Anu P.

description:
Great fast food - healthy and vegetarian! Thank you, Loving Hut! The wait for the food is a bit longer than some other options in the food court, but it's worth it. 

I actually planned my last SF trip with an intentional Powell St BART stop to get some sweet Loving (Hut)
author: Vanilla P.

description: Some of the best vegan food I have ever had. Had the Garden Vermicelli plate and it was fresh and delicious. Cooked in a lovely way, cannot ask for more when looking for a healthy meal surrounded by unhealthy food companies.
author: Dominic B.

description:
As a passive vegan, or cheagan, or someone who has neither the patience or militancy to ask, "Is there butter on these vegetables?"-- I adore this place for many reasons. It's centrally located, cheap, fast, tasty, inventive, ethical, need I say more? It's great, 5 stars.

Entrees are displayed under glass, cafeteria style.  The line goes quick, but you do get a beeper for special orders.  The food is Asian-inspired, with dishes like 'Rainbow salad' and 'Egg rolls," both good. They also have a 'Philly steak sandwich,' and it's so tasty carnivores would enjoy. 

It's located in a food court that has plenty of meat options. So, if you're in a mixed group and need a place to eat, Loving Hut is great for maintaining both your social and dietary needs.
author: Roel M.

description:
Best Veg Fried Rice Ive had in a long time! This place is super Yummy & great for lunch & I leave feeling healthy & satisfied!

Favorite dishes are Basil & Sauteed Mushrooms, Red Curry Vegetables with Broccoli & Green Beans, Sauteed Kale with seeds, & Veg Noodle Dish. Their Menu iz extensive & they even do Pho, Sandwiches, & Puddings.

( I dont care for Tofu AT ALL yuck! or the Soy Protein thing thats like a meat substitue .. double yuck!!!

I was V reluctant to give Love Hut a go but now im hooked & inspired to eat more Veg & cook/sautee similar items!
author: Julian I.

description: The staff were rude and pushy because they were almost closed. No one seemed helpful. The bowl of soup I ordered for $9 was delicious and worth the price though.
author: Margaret P.

description:
The vegan pho taste terrible. :( 
Not sure how much healthier it is, but I definitely would not order this again and pick a more flavorful soup elsewhere.
author: Jess C.

description:
Went to Loving Hut after Ajisen Ramen was closed for the night.  It's Vegan Asian food served pretty quick in the food court at Westfield Mall Bloomingdale side.

They give you a buzzer & when food is ready it starts flashing.

I got Spicy Royal Noodle Soup $8.25 - from the menu: Savory spicy noodle soup w/ tofu, mushroom, bean sprout & fresh basil.  Sounds good so I got it.  It was fairly tasty, I asked for no bean sprout & they did leave it out.

My total was $9.03 w/ tax.  They take credit cards.

Other stuff they have.  Ask for a take-out menu, it has an expired 10% coupon to use next time.

Appetizers:
Golden Rolls (3) $4.5
Spring Rolls $5.95
Crispy Tenders & Sweet Potato Fries $6.45

Pho Noodle soup $8.25
Garden Vermicelli $8.25

Salads:
Heavenly salad $7.95
Tropical salad  $7.95
Loving Hut Salad $8.5

Sandwiches:
Grilled Philly Sandwich $8.95
Loving Hut Sandwich $8.95

Buffet Combo Special 2 items w/ rice $8.25
author: Ann L.

description: I work nearby so if I am not in the mood to bring lunch from home, this is where I spend my lunch break. Affordable delicious vegan food!!! Try their Garden Vermicelli and you will also become a regular!
author: MT M.

description:
Typical food court chinese food you'd find in a mall, but veg friendly. 

I had the lemongrass tofu and sauteed eggplant with fried rice. I was eating lunch because I was at the convention center for work. A perfect place to get some quick vegetarian food, but I probably wouldn't go here if it wasn't for work.
author: Junior T.

description: Awesome spot for great food. Fresh, flavorful and great service. Had a really good lunch here with friends on iur big shopping day- we'll be back soon!
author: B. M.

description: While I was initially excited to see loving hut in SF as I have enjoyed their food in NYC and Chicago, I was definitely disappointed overall. Flavors were bland in the ramen I had.  My wife had an average salad.  Their cheesecake however was definitely the highlight. While their mock meat is cool, and as a vegan it is difficult to write anything disparaging about a veg forward restaurant, being vegan friendly in and of itself doesn't make for a good meal in 2016.
author: Michael A.

description:
I wasn't bowled over by the appearance of their food in the Westfield, but I tried the sweet potato curry and it was most excellent! I love pumpkin curry but have never come across a sweet potato version and have to say it was at least as good as any pumpkin curry I've ever had. Lots of perfectly cooked sweet potato, tofu and veggies in a well-balanced curry sauce and some fresh rice on the side. Their vegan cakes looked good, but the only other thing I had was their sweetened hibiscus tea, which not too sweet and made a nice change. Service was quite friendly too and the curry + rice was reasonably priced at $8.50. 

So, 4/5 stars for quality and value, and I'm also giving the Loving Hut 5/5 green stars for social and environmental impact. First, obviously, a plant-based diet is clearly better than a meat-heavy diet for the planet on several fronts: better use of land for feeding the population, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, avoids the animal cruelty that comes with the intensive meat industry, and is better for human health. Second, I really like their business model: each restaurant is independently-owned and comes up with its own menu. For a chain restaurant with over 200 locations worldwide (about 40 in the U.S., four in the Bay Area) it's a great idea to not replicate the same menu in every restaurant. Each restaurant can come up with their own menu depending on what's available locally, and can also suit local dietary trends and needs. The idea of walking into a chain restaurant that has thousands of locations worldwide and knowing that they churn out these identical meals in huge facilities (and then waste energy shipping them all over the country/world) is really a repulsive concept. Finally, if you're vegan or vegetarian, it's nice to know that you can order anything on the menu without having to ask the staff for a history of the dish (like the chicken in Portlandia).
author: James K.

description:
I have to say, I am really quite enamored with the Westfield Mall's food court options.  I realize that this more of a luxury mall than I'm possibly used to, but not McDonald's or Taco Bell in sight!  And to top it all off - a Loving Hut!

I opted for the the $8.95 meal with brown rice, some sort of mostly potato and a tiny bit of tofu pale yellow curry and what was presumably some protein nugget rendition of sweet and sour chicken.  It wasn't too bad, but I can't say I was really all that impressed!

The sweet and sour nuggets were a bit dry and very very fried.  This could partially be explained by the fact that we had descended upon the food court rather late during lunch time, and the lady scooping up my lunch didn't really have an immense reservoir left of the stuff to pick from.  It wasn't exactly hot - nearly cool.  It tasted all right, but it did pale in comparison to the food I've devoured at the Houston Loving Hut location.  The curry was decent, but more potato than anything else - a few tofu morsels here and there.  The flavor was quite mild.  Good ole sriracha saved me again!  For $9, it was all right, but the Loving Hut server/cashier was quite conservative with her scoops.  

I tried my cousin's sweet potato fries and chicken finger analogue - I've had the latter before at the Houston location.  It was WAAAY greasier here, like holy heart attack!  And not as tasty!  The sweet potato fries were just fried and left unseasoned.  Boo!  I felt a bit guilty for encouraging my cousin, an omnivore, to give Loving Hut a chance and she'd ended up with a super fried pile of rather bland stuff.  

I would really highly recommend you NOT opt for the $8.95 special or fried items and order from the made-upon-order stuff.  

It was all edible and not terrible, but I had high expectations and well, this just didn't meet them.  However, I am pleased that there is a Loving Hut at a mall, of all places.  Wish I could see more of that where I live!
author: Ellen C.

description:
I really believe that Loving Hut incorporates illegal addictive substances in their food because I have never found vegan food edible or appealing until this place existed.

For the $9 combo special, you get 2 entree items and rice (can be substituted with fried rice or chow mein). The one thing you'll hate about this place is being unable to decide what you want. They have a pastry section too. If I were ever vegetarian and live off of Loving Hut, I would gain 20 lbs.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
I've always wanted to try Loving Hut out of curiosity, so seeing it at the Westfield food court was a nice surprise.

I ordered the Grilled Philly Sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=F_5_UNX-wrAFCXuAkBZRDw&select=1i06bnUbdlkVIHoMDJWT5g).  Obviously, a complete 180 from Phat Philly, but it surprisingly filled me up and was quite good for a vegan sandwich.  Only downside to it though was that it was quite pricey.  The sandwich along with a lemonade cost around $13.  It's really too bad that the cost of eating healthy is higher than usual.  Still a great sandwich and I would order it again.

4 stars for Loving Hut.  I hope to come by the actual restaurant soon.
author: Rodney H.

description: Loving Hut is an island of goodness in a food court full of restaurants serving unhealthy food. Theirs is is delicious. The kale smoothie rocks and their curries are super tasty. Thank you!!!!!
author: Hans S.

description:
When I saw the menu, and the pics on Yelp, I had to try the soy nuggets and sweet potato fries.  And I was pleasantly satisfied.

And the green tea with soy milk was strong, but delicious and complimentary to my meal.

I definitely want to come back and try more of their a la cart options.
author: Vira P.

description: Loving Hut is a great place for a quick, filling lunch. Everything is vegan, and many options are gluten-free. It may not be the healthiest since the stir-fry dishes have a lot of oil, but they do use a lot of fresh veggies. My favorite parts of my meal were the eggplant and the hibiscus iced tea.
author: Amy K.

description: "I don't want to serve you anymore" was the response I received from their staff when I told her I didn't order the egg plant she gave me. What a horrible thing to say!!!! Mean and angry ladies. May they find their way and learn to be kind to people.
author: Eileen T.

description:
VEGAN CHINESE FOOD?!?!
(4.25 stars)

I am not on crack, this is for real!! VEGAN FOOD TASTING GOOD. We all automatically judge vegan food and condone it to being bland, healthy, hippy/activist food, etc. thats exactly At the time, i was on hardcore restrictions so anything vegitarian or vegan in need... i've gone thru my 'natural' phase. Decided to try Loving Hut, a small restaurant opened at the SF Shopping Center. 

- Everything vegan
- No MSG (that i'm aware of -- but you really never know)
- Everything Organic (that i'm aware of -- but you really never know)

ORDER
Fried rice with Lemon Grass tofu - i could never imagine myself to really enjoy Tofu the way I did. Imagine chinese food, almost as greasy, the smell, the serving, everything but its all healthy. 

I also ordered another dish which was vegtables but i cant remember exactly what it was but it did have green beans. All three dishes were less then $10 bucks. 

I didn't bother to order any beverage as they weren't "special" in any way, they were regular fountain drinks. However, they were serving free ice water but this was cucumber iced water. I love the purity of water when indulging into new foods so i can better taste things. but the cucumber in the water quenched my thirst and made things fresher.

* Ambiance - its in the mall, but they're layout is cute (their section)
* Price - fair
* Taste - delicious and healthy
* Services - proportionate

Until the next review.....
author: Jane A.

description: I'm so thankful these are in so many food courts in the malls I visit for work. It's 100% vegan and so yummy! You can get made fresh meals or pick from the bar in front if you. The desserts are really good too!
author: Aubree R.

description:
$10 for the lunch combo of two dishes plus noodles or rice- they let you try the food too! :) Both the eggplant and the sweet potato curry are great! 

Reasonable price for a filling and tasty vegetarian meal. Great service and the lines move quickly. Can't go wrong here!
author: Todd L.

description: Love the food especially since they cater to vegetarians and vegans.  My favorite dishes are the sweet potato curry and the sweet and sour faux chicken with brown fried rice. Also, delicious Vegan Thai Ice Teas!!  Good vegan cheese cake and they make a super thick and tasty Avocado Smoothie.  The Golden Era is related to this chain...heard the opened back up so have to check them out next.
author: Glam K.

description:
First Time: got that combo plate thing with rice/noodles and 2 sides. I choose two different curry dishes which I would totally recommend and their rice was better than Panda. 

It was 8 something here for the combo.

And my mom did the same deal, but got noodles, sauteed mushroom, and some tofu dish. All was good (well I didn't try the noodles though).

Would eat here again and it's salty, but not overwhelming so! 

Portions were pretty big! Ate there, they scooped everything onto this HUGE dish.
author: Lilian L.

description: bad customer service. the lady serving me was ralking to someone else. when i asked for where the forks are she just put up her finger and pointed. the forks are not in the usual place. they were in a plastic cup hidden from view.
author: Michael Angelo R.

description: I came here the other day and, like the previous two times I have eaten here, I had horrible service. The sautéed kale and the veggie curry are really good, but not worth the crappy service that you get here. I approached the counter and there were at least six people working, which is way more than any of the other food court spots. But they were all just babbling to each other and ignoring me. I stood there and looked around at all the employees for a good minute, I figured that I would be helped soon but nobody came to help me, they were all doing little tasks like chipping ice with a scoop and separating tofu out of a bucket.  One of the women even made eye contact with me at least twice but never said "we'll be right with you", much less came and served me.  After waiting another couple minutes awkwardly standing there, I finally just walked away and ate somewhere else. As I said before, a couple of items I've had here have been really good, but nothing is good enough to overlook the horrible service that I've had each time I've gone there.
author: Emma H.

description: Loving the Loving Hut! My first visit and the veggies in red curry and eggplant with tofu are fantastic! With the (vegan) fried rice it's $10. And generous portions.
author: Aimee C.

description: I've been here several times over the years when I visit and I'm never disappointed. The staff is very friendly and courteous. The garden vermicelli is so delicious and everything here is priced quite reasonably. I think it's so awesome that there's a vegan restaurant in a food court beside places like Chipotle and Panda Express offering healthier and cruelty free options. I've never seen that before. I'll be back soon.
author: Ashley K.

description: This is my favorite place to go to for fast and delicious vegan food.  I love coming here for food.  I usually end up here when I am in downtown.  I usually get the eggplant and tofu with red curry and vegetables, along with brown rice or chow mein.
author: May D.

description:
Working in the SoMa, you are surrounded by food. You can't walk a block without having access to all sorts of sandwiches, pizza by the slice, burrito-sized sushi rolls, and any food you can imagine pre-packaged in a paper or plastic box for easy transport back to your desk. 

It was one of those days that I wanted something a little more filling than a salad. Following a vegan diet, most of what you will eat in this area is lackluster veggie patties, tofu prepared in a dozen sad ways, and meals that simply have the dairy or meat left off. So, I decided to give Loving Hut a shot. The Westfield Mall is one of those locations I forgot existed as a majority of the offerings are very carnivores, which is great for them. 

For my first visit I ordered the Garden Vermicelli and was surprised how much food you got. I see a few people have complained about the price, well it's pretty on par with anything else in the mall's food court, and cheaper than many of the other vegan places the city has to offer. 

The texture soy protein, or whatever they may call it, has a color and feel very much like meat. Those vegans that are totally against any food resembling meat at all will have an issue with this. I don't, as i'm one of those that think certain elements of the diet can be textured and shaped in a way that it makes it easier for meat eaters to give the cuisine a try. The "all or nothing" attitude many vegans have does not help the arguments very much. Sure, we would all love for people to just switch over, but let's be realistic. Anyway, the second time I went I tried the steam table combo. For $8.95 you can get two items, which is a good deal. The sweet and sour "protein" was ok, nothing I would get again, and the chow mien was good, but the noodles had that feel that they get after sitting under a heat lamp for too long. But hey, this happens quite often at any non-vegan restaurant serving these dishes as well. Might as well eat some "ok", filling food, and not have to deal with meat at all.

It's quite enjoyable to not have to explain to the staff that you don't want meat, and that you don't want dairy. Too many times in the SoMa I have had to forfeit my lunch to a coworker because the place I ordered it from didn't understand my "I'm allergic to dairy" line I spew out before the money exchanges hands.
author: Josh G.

description: Love the food here!  Such great value for what you pay.  I love the soup bowl with the fried spring rolls.  The vegan philly steak sandwich and queen sandwich are favorites, as well!
author: Rocky B.

description:
Loving Hut saved my dinner!! I had Pho (Noodle Soup), Spring Rolls, and Green Milk Tea. 

I have to be honest- pho is not as good/fresh as the ones from Golden Era restaurant, but it's still delicious and the green milk tea was amazing! 

Also the service was fast, and I'm thankful they're open at weird times (like 4PM) and had extremely quick service.

TIP: This Loving Hut is located INSIDE the Westfield Mall, next to Bloomingdale's in C floor (which means it's 1 below ground level).
author: Yoon P.

description: Absolutely delicious, flavorful vegan food! Huge portions too. Got the chow mein, fried rice, and sweet and sour "chicken". All were so full of flavor and I almost never would've known it wasn't chicken. All their other dishes look really good too!
author: Jocelyn P.

description:
Super nice food, relatively good price considering its location in Central San Francisco. I love the food court in Westfield mall because it's really big and has free wifi, as is always kept very clean. 
Exactly what you want from vegan food; quick, hot and full of protein and veggies!
author: Cal N.

description:
One of my best meals ever in the US. I mean it. This is as good as it gets.

I was in SF this March and visited this outlet in Westfield. Delicious vegan food and large portions. Does not leave a huge gap in your wallet but still fills your stomach. 

Must try are the pho noodle soup, spicy royal noodle soup, and the smoothies. Vegan food at its best.

The staff is very helpful and when I requested that my soup have normal tofu and not fried tofu ,they were very accommodating.
author: Naman J.

description: Stick to the made to order menu I guess. Two stars for the steam table entrees because they're all way over-sauced; red curry vegetables especially were coated in something that had the consistency of gelatinous gravy and didn't taste at all like red curry (it was brown).  Glad there's a veg option especially since Corriander Thai changed some things on their menu and aren't very veg friendly anymore.
author: Jen G.

description:
Only in San Francisco will you find a vegan eatery at a food court. 

Despite the hippie dippie name (why must most of the names of vegan eateries conjure up images of people who don't shower and love to give hugs?), I find myself an immediate fan of Loving Hut. I didn't know that it was a chain, so add this to the very short list chains I like. 

I had the Loving Hut sandwich. It could have used a bit more protein, but that just goes to show that the protein featured is really delicious because I am often unimpressed with soy protein (which, let's face it, is vegan "junk" food as it's super processed). And the bread... wow. I'm prone to hollowing out bread on my sandwiches but this French bread is out of this world. It may be toasted with a touch of soy margarine. It's almost like garlic bread. Another shocker: the side of coleslaw. Normally I wouldn't even touch coleslaw, but I'm glad I tasted this one because it's perfectly spiced and has just a bit of soy mayo. Scarfed the little side of it immediately and was left wanting for more. Yes, a good thing.

Though not big into sweets, I cannot pass up anything pumpkin and I saw a cake with a sign saying it was pumpkin cheesecake. The girl informed me it was mocha, not pumpkin. When I later took a bite (took it to go), I realized it wasn't vegan cheesecake but regular cake. That was a bit of a disappointment, though I can't deny the cake was as good as mocha cake can be (especially the frosting and I don't even like frosting). And you can bet your Birkenstocks I ate the entire friggin' thing.
author: Joi B.

description:
Packed with flavor, healthy and delicious southeastern Asian food. I'm here at least once a month. Two items+ noodles or rice is less than $10 with large portions.

Favorites:

-spicy eggplant with tofu
-red curry vegetables
-basil mushrooms
-pumpkin curry
author: J L.

description:
Most of the workers here are rude. Most "culturally rude" but some are just because they know they can be. Being one of the few healthy places to eat in the food court they can rely on traffic alone. Two total of the workers who interact with customers are ok, the rest are not customer friendly. 
3 stars for the food being good, and they have brown rice! Wish they had better/friendlier staff.
author: Tim V.

description:
There is nothing to love about the Loving Hut. The short line should have been my first clue. This place is a total ripoff and has terrible customer service. The employees ignore the customers and act like they don't want to be there.

It cost almost $10 for my plate of two items: eggplant tofu, and veggie chow mein. I got ONE piece of tofu and mostly cabbage instead of chow mein. Seriously??? Plus it was all tasteless, but that's probably because it's vegan.

Next time I will take the five minutes to wait in line for actual food. Skip this place.
author: June L.

description: It was Tuesday night looking for a healthy option for dinner because I was bad for lunch. Tried loving hut and ordered the rice plate with two sides. The curry tofu and sweet potato sides were just fine. They skimped on the fried vegan rice- whatever fried vegan rice means. Didn't like that at all. What am I supposed to be eating with my sides?! Watch their portioning. They are trying to get by by charging $11 for not a lot of food.
author: Dan E.

description: Enjoying my avocado smoothie and rainbow salad. Nice to have healthy alternatives. I am here for a conference and suspect I will come back over the next few days to try their other meals.
author: Eric M.

description: Awesome place for veggie near Moscone. Too bad, it wasn't as flavorful. The boba in there bob drink felt plain, and neglected. However, you know what, it's a vegetarian place, and I'm all about supporting vegetarian restaurants.
author: Jay S.

description: Total surprise to find such good vegan food in a mall food court.  I had the eggplant with tofu and it was exceptional.  The carrot cake cupcake was a bit dry, but the frosting was great.  Highly recommend the place!
author: Paul N.

description: I am not a vegetarian so I was a bit hesitate to try this spot but I ordered a spring roll and was very delicious. However, I think the casher was not nice enough. Was a bit confusing where I should order the food and the server was not very helpful.
author: Anya C.

description: This place is awesome! I've never been a huge fan of tofu or the idea of eating vegan style food, but they make it so you don't even realize it. Their meal combo for 3 items is less that $10! For those who love meat, don't turn away form this place because as a meat lover they sure can satisfy your hunger. Just think of it as a healthier version of Panda Express lol. It's a slight bummer sometimes from all the 4 times i've been here their staff aren't the greatest when it comes to customer service. I assume it's because some of them aren't fluent in English which is totally understandable and something I find an issue, but I mean if you're running a business don't put some like who lacks in that department as the person running the cash register.
author: Pj A.

description:
Please, oh please, divine masters of Loving Hut, please come to SoCal.

Waling around SF, needed some lunch and Yelped for a vegan spot.  Directed to the bottom floor of the mall and I was already feeling a bit duped.  Food courts are just not my thing - no judgement, but I'm not down.

Little did I know that soon I would be enjoying an enormous bowl of spicy soup, a delicious sandwich and a smoothie that would all rank in my top 10 for vegan food.

What's not to like?  It's fresh, it's tasty, it's served hot and it's memorable.  In a food court?  That's a first for me.
author: Synergy K.

description: First met this wonderful chain in Gainesville Florida and it does not disappoint my only issue with this one is it lacked the love of the one in Gainesville
author: Laura G.

description:
Beef sandwich is amazing. Bread was so good. Highly recommended. 

Especially for vegetarian food in the area.
author: Paul D.

description:
I love this place. I've been coming here about 1-3 times per week for the past couple of years.

Everything is great here, but their pho and tropical salad are easily my favorites. Despite it basically being fast food, they exert a lot of attention to the preparation and presentation of the food. And it's all really delicious.

Tip: Pay an extra $1 for "extra noodles" for your pho, in case the regular portion isn't enough to fill your gullet.
author: Jason M.

description:
My first ever encounter with the Loving Hut and I think we should rent a hut so I can show it how much I love it. Yup! It's that good people. 

What the hell do they marinate that soy in?! I ordered the Loving Hut Sandwich and I could have sworn I was eating a genuine pulled pork bánh mì! I felt like I was cheating! It tastes amazing. The texture imitated real meat to me. I do not know how they did that but I don't care. It was delicious!!! Can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu. Pretty expensive sammie tho, a little under $9. So one star off for that. Maybe if the portion was bigger I could justify the price, but it's smaller than a footlong so I didn't think it fit the price. 

Ps. Tried the Thai iced tea and it was okay for me. I felt like it was too sweet, but then again I've never had Thai iced tea so maybe that's normal? Idk.
author: Abigail D.

description:
This place is awesome!  Buffet style Loving Hut menu items!  Hell yes!

quick, cheap, delicious.  

Food courts around the country should be taking note!
author: Cheryl R.

description:
I love this place so much!

I always get the garden vermicelli bowl and its delicious! The "beef" is soo meat-like, its unbelievable that it is made of soy. They also top it with a lot of lettuce and bean sprouts. The eggrolls are perfectly crispy and the "fish" sauce is perfect to pour on top.

I also got a vegan thai tea which was a little sweet for me, but still worth trying.

If youre in the bloomingdales food court, definitely give this place a try!
author: Angie S.

description:
So this is basically the only place where I can eat Asian food where I won't come into contact with any of my fish allergens. You know, because God forbid anyone clean the pan after cooking shrimp, or tell you the truth when you ask if there's oyster sauce in something. 

But this place is all vegan/vegetarian, so that's definitely not a problem here!

And their pork buns taste like real pork too, so there's that. 

I also like the chow mein, a bit too greasy for me to eat everyday, but I like it.
author: Queen B.

description:
The boo and I went and tried the (scarily expensive) banh mi.  It was worth every penny.  Nom nom nom.

The pumpkin cheesecake is also really good.  Mmm, cheesecake.  Thinking about it makes me want one right now.
author: Vincent Y.

description: Went back, and the bread was nice and soft! No issues here!
author: Shubh J.

description:
I'm so glad there are finally more options for vegetarians/vegans other than salads in the food court. 

This place has quite an array of choices. You can do it Panda Express style and pick a side and entrees from the steam table or you can order from their menu. They also have several appetizers and steamed buns for the not so hungries, giant salad for the green-grazers, and DESSERTS for the sweet-cravers. 

For desserts, they have cheesecake, mocha cake, carrot cake, and maybe something else that I missed because I was desperately trying to get the last piece of cheesecake before someone else grabbed it. I personally really-liked the cheesecake. It was creamy, moderately sweet, and very slightly tart. It was very similar to Vietnamese yogurt but with a firmer texture. It's definitely not as sweet or firm or savory as real cheesecake but still very enjoyable.

Their steamed bun was sort of like a Chinese BBQ Pork bun. The sweet-savory filling was a deep red. I couldn't really make out what it is made of because everything is mushed. I think I still prefer the veggie steamed buns from Out The Door because I don't like sweet fillings. But if you like the sweet-savoriness of BBQ Pork Buns, here's a vegan alternative for you.

Their salad is prepared to order. The Heavenly Salad...a bed of spring mix and shredded lettuce tossed in vinegarette sat on top of sliced cucumbers and tomatoes and topped with seasoned faux meat. And it's HUGE! The salad was pretty good. The veggies were fresh and crisp. The faux meat was well seasoned but really tough.

Service was great. The tall Asian middle-aged man was very friendly and always smiling like a skinny Buddha. The other girls seemed very nice and attentive too. They were giving other customers samples and helping them decide what entrees to choose. Even though they were busy, they asked me if I've been helped. 

The wait was a bit longer than usual mall food wait because I had to wait for them to heat up the steamed bun and prepare my salad. All the tables nearby were taken so I was awkwardly standing at the corner kind of getting into other people's way as I wait.

I really appreciate that they offer FREE water. You think that should be a standard already right? But usually places sell you bottled water and that's like the default even if they have free water. Here, they also have bottled water but they will give you a glass for water instead of charging you for the bottle by default.

Rating breakdown:
Food quantity: Generous -- 4 stars
Food quality: Average -- 3 stars
Price: Average -- 3.5 stars
Service: Great -- 4 stars
*base on the consideration of this establishment being in a mall and my personal experience

Good to Knows:
- they don't take AMEX
- utensils are located around the corner past the register and water dispenser
- water dispenser is located to the left of the register -- so don't wonder why they gave you a glass if you asked for water
- don't carry your filled water glass on the tray; it slips 
- after you finished eating, you can hand your tray to one of the food court attendants -- so don't leave your tray on the table or throw it in the trash
author: Jennifer L.

description:
First off, I think that the Westfield Mall has one of the best mall food courts anywhere. This also happens to be my favorite Loving Hut location. This is definitely a solid spot for Chinese vegan food. I find it comparable to, though definitely not as good as, Garden Fresh in Palo Alto (known to have the best vegan Chinese food in the Bay Area).

I've come here on multiple locations and had the following items: fried rice, chow mein, pho noodle soup (not the spicy one), and egg rolls. They have a variety of not only tofu dishes but also faux meats which are quite good.

I'm not sure why people have complained about their service - I have allergies to nuts and sesame and the people behind the counter have always double checked the ingredients with the chef for me.
author: Sarah S.

description:
This would have been 3 stars since I've come to Loving Hut before.. But these last couple of times have given me a stomach ache!! I don't know what it is!! 
I woke up at 1am this morning with bad stomach pains. All I had was brown rice, basil mushrooms and the eggplant and tofu. How on Earth did I get sickly from that!?

Who knows.. Maybe they poisoned me with their cult stuff.
author: Susy C.

description: great to see an all-vegan option in a mall food court. Great value and nice selection of prepared items. We also tried the "cheesecake" and a carrot cake muffin on different trips and both were tasty. Would like to see more Loving Hut's in the USA in food courts. My only suggestion would be for the people serving the food to help describe the food a bit better when asked a question.
author: Jim N.

description: Best pho I've ever had! Even counting the days when I ate meat this tops it. It's one of the busiest spots in the food court but they manage to make the line go fast.
author: Hannah L.

description:
I love this place. 

For food in a mall food court, leave it to San Francisco to create an epicurean delight/love fest. I love the freshness, the fact that it is vegan and the fact that it is actually really tasty. Like nicely spiced/not bland!

My go to order is the veggie combo with rice and 2 sides and I almost always get the spicy green bean and lemongrass tofu. On occasion, I'm a fan of the Red Curry vegetables and the Eggplant Basil. I got the Mushroom Basil this last time I went and it was pretty good too, if you're into brown sauce and mushrooms.

Not a massive fan of the sweet and sour but that it down to my taste and not something inherently wrong with the food. 

I love the chow mein option from time to time and the rolls are hot and fresh. 

All in all, I'm so happy to be able to shop at a mall where the only options aren't Subway, Quizno's, Taco Bell and Auntie Anne's.
author: Radhika P.

description: Amazing! I had the rainbow salad which came to $9.74 with tax. The salad was HUGE so it was totally worth the price. Be warned that the peanut dressing/sauce is spicy but it came on the side which was perfect for lightly dipping. Really impressed with this salad... I definitely recommend it and the hot food they have looks awesome too. Worth checking out if you're in the mall.
author: Kloi T.

description: I got lemon tofu and friend rice. The tofu and rice were so great. However, I found a hair in my rice. The food was also really expensive. I will definitely try loving hut again, but probably not this location.
author: Cass D.

description: Best vegan spot ive ever tried wow! I had the two curries and chow mein. And I went back the next day to have more cheesecake and try the pho. It is not cheap but worth every penny! I can't wait to go back!
author: Chary V.

description: It's alright. There wasn't a big variety of food. But the desserts looked marvelous. The entire menu is a little pricey though.
author: Wen M.

description: My favorite out of all the loving hut locations ! They have these basil mushrooms that are to die for. Friendly staff and good prices
author: Chantel B.

description: Sooo good! Table combo (2 items) w vegetable fried rice $9.25
author: Calum H.

description: Love the Lucky curry and spring rolls here!!! Amazing it is! :) The gourmet fried rice is also in the list of my favorites here!
author: Aparna I.

description:
This Loving Hut is in a shopping mall food court and, as such, has a different model than other Loving Huts. At this one, the food is already prepared and sitting out in a buffet line, behind glass (much like a Panda Express). You can pick two dishes and get a combo deal for about $8.

Most of the dishes are simple stir-frys and didn't seem to feature any mockmeats, which was surprising (though tofu is in abundance).

You can also get some sandwiches/burgers, and desserts.

I had a slice of the pumpkin cheesecake ($4 with tax) and was favorably impressed. It was smooth, subtle and had just the perfect amount of pumpkin flavor (too much can get overwhelming, in my opinion).

While I'm not impressed with Loving Huts in general, I'm glad that this one is around to mainstream the concept of vegan food. After all, a shopping mall food court is about as mainstream as it gets.
author: Kedar D.

description:
I've been to several of this vegan chain's locations including "Vegetarian House" in SJ. I'm a huge fan of them all. I was super excited to find that they've expanded to the Westfield Mall. It's always a rare treat to find a good vegan place amongst the usual choices in a food court.

Probably the best part of this location is since it's in a food court, you don't see the cultish-ness of the other locations. I come to Loving Hut for the food, not to meet the Supreme Master... The service isn't the greatest ever but the girls @ the counter are usually cute and smile every now and then. 

The prices are very good for the quality you usually get. The 2-item combo is a good option but I can't go here without getting the Royal Noodle soup. It's a pretty good portion of noodles, pseudo-meats, and plenty of spice. I'm not the scrawniest vegan out there but this bowl will fill me up with a quickness. The golden rolls are usually on point as well. I still wish they would do away with the "western specialties" items and expand the menu with more Asian cuisine. Seriously, who eats this stuff?

I may even have to make a special trip to the mall just to check this place out again.
author: John B.

description: Ok for mall food Pho but doesn't compare to mom and pop run Pho restaurants. At least the mall has a pho option.
author: Sil L.

description:
$10 (inclusive of tax) gets you a big plate of chow mein (or fried rice) plus 2 side dishes.  Good flavors.   

And free & surprisingly fast wifi here.

Also, I respect Loving Hut's focus on environmentalism and spirituality.
author: George K.

description: My favourite place on Market for sure. I love the two item plates with brown rice. So nice to know I can get a plate of vegan comfort food that's healthy and so filling in the middle of the city for pretty cheap. If I'm feeling like splurging, the cheesecakes are insane. I love Loving Hut!!
author: Morgen S.

description: This chain is one of my favorite places to eat. But this location is notoriously short on selection. Today's meal was not very hot and could have been a lot more fresh
author: scott h.

description:
I LOVE BANH MI....
CORRECTION:
I'M OBSESSED WITH BANH MI 
& Yes I am a vegetarian/aspiring vegan & the Banh Mi at this Westfield Mall Location is the BEST I HAVE EVER TRIED. 
It is called "Queen Sandwich" at this location and it is everything you'd ever want your vegan Banh Mi to taste like, except sadly you have to ask extra for jalapenos & it's usually still not enough for a spicy addict like me but oh well.
I think though my favorite part about it, besides the freshness of all the ingredients, is the "meat" that they use and the texture and taste of it. It's soft & delicious & I prefer faux meat in my banh mi instead of tofu.
This mall location offers so much deliciousness, way more & better options than the Inner Sunset Location (No offense guys) I cannot wait to eventually try more things...like that *VEGAN FLAN* 
but for now...I'll obsessively eat my Vegan Banh Mi in peace....

THANK YOU LOVING HUT IN THE WESTFIELD! YOU ROCK!!!
author: Zhenya S.

description:
I prefer my vegan food without cult-y overtones, but that can be hard to come by in these parts. We are sorely lacking hip vegan joints like Champs diner in Brooklyn with it's sassy attitude and eclectic, affordable eats. The hipster crowd here is still too wrapped up in pig guts and artesian mustache drippings to pick up on the more sustainable and ethical dining trends gaining ground in places like Seattle, Portland and New York. 

Thankfully, Loving Hut helps to fill the void with great food and a minimum of proselytizing, at  least at their Westfield location. I would Kumbaya regardless for the Garden Vermicelli salad, which hits the sweet spot between salad, noodles, fried eggrolls and a satisfying dosage of toothsome faux beef. The sandwiches are also quite good for sneaking into the theater above.

I usually pass on the buffet offerings as a general rule.
author: Cory W.

description:
Who knew you could get amazing food in a food court at the mall? Who knew you could get amazing food at a solely vegetarian/vegan restaurant in a food court at the mall? 

I did not know that until I visited Loving Hut. Located in the food court in Westfield mall, they serve up some pretty delicious food. On ceramic plates and real silverware. I went with the hot bar special, two sides with either steamed rice, noodles or brown rice. The serving was plenty. Definitely enough for two. And certainly a steal at $8.50. 

The food was very delicious. Delivered the right amount of heat and flavor. It was very unexpected given the location but it comes highly recommended. For omnivores and herbivores alike. Actually I am sure that even the carnivores would love it :)
author: Dee O.

description:
I have a heart-on for the Loving Hut! I get excited just reading the menu. 

So far I've tried the sweet potato fries, the Queen Sandwich and the Grilled Philly Sandwich. 

The sweet potato fries are perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked. They are great on their own but at the Loving Hut you get an amazing bonus BBQ sauce. The sauce is peppery and tastes great.

The queen sandwich is a BBQ sandwich with marinated veggie meat. I know it's weird to have fake meat but it helps when you're weaning yourself off of the real stuff. This sandwich tastes is delicious.
