description: Imagine my surprise and delight when stumbling across a 100% vegan eatery in a mall food court! Well, you won't have to imagine if you actually go here. It's totally worth a visit - they even have vegan philly sandwiches and vegan eggrolls, plus delicious desserts and very kind employees. Ate here three times during a recent trip and was very glad my hotel was within walking distance of this gem.
author: Tommy P.

description: Oh mah gawd, get their sauteed kale.  Soooo good!  The eggplant was also delish - mushy and melt in your mouth, just the way I like it.  Both were a little greasy but tasty.
author: Vivian D.

description:
The Loving Hut in the other areas has a better selection and quality. This is in the food court of the mall so to me the selection is limited and meh-meh. Not my favorite but I'll eat here when I shop.

--Update----------------------------------------
Found not one but TWO hair in my food when I ate there yesterday. I have a weak stomach for that kind of thing so I will not be ordering from there again. I'll just march over to the other full restaurant spot and enjoy my meal there instead.
author: Katie M.

description:
I really like this place!
Its super fast cos everything is already made.
Everything is already made, so you can decide what you want by actually looking at stuff.
Looking at stuff, you see everything is vegetarian.. yay!!
I almost always get rice with their potato/tofu concoction, alongside golden rolls (they make you wait for the rolls though :().
Lots of people watching to do in the huge food court.
author: Aditya M.

description: Who won't like this place.  Try steamed kale and sweet potato curry.  Simple, tasty and not deep fried.
author: Fenny K.

description:
When I was in college and worked in a mall, the only place I was able to get food from was Sorabol. If I had had Loving Hut instead I would have been elated. Seriously,  5 stars for being vegan on a mall. WHO DOES THAT? 

I had a salad which was composed of piles of cabbage, crunchy strips of won ton noodles, soy strips, ribbons of carrot, and cilantro, tossed in a creamy peanut dressing. If I had to order again I would have opted for the dressing on the side, as it was rich and filling. The rest was fresh and healthy though.

Would definitely do the vegan dance here again!
author: Amber K.

description:
Whenever visiting the Powell Street Bart station, I always find myself jumping off the train, wandering into the Westfield Mall Food Court and then getting my Loving Hut items to go and jumping back on the train going home. I love the concept of vegan Chinese food. I know I have turned a few of my friends' heads saying, "hey. yah. you down for some vegan chinese food?" This food is very tasty and filling. I'm sure I can empty a whole plate into my Buddah belly in 8 minutes flat. Also, this location seems a little more cleaner than the Chinatown location -- but I'm definitely not hating on them!

I prefer the basil mushroom side. The sweet potatoe curry is pretty legit too. I like to add sri-racha for some extra spice, not because they are bland, but because I like spice. I also like to divvy up my lunch combo plate with two items ($9.04 with tax incl), with both fried rice and chow-mein. At any given time, they have about 8 dishes going on and a refrigerated case of desserts that I have not tried yet.

My suggestion: get your food to go. I think they pack the food into it a lot more than if it were on a plate. Also, if you plan on waiting a day to consume, decorate with hot sauce -- perfect amount of time for the food to marinate the spice and give it a good kick. However, I don' t know if you can wait that long to consume -- you'll want to eat it right away. So nom nom!
author: Nicole P.

description: The best green papaya salad. Had it two days in a row. I'm a visitor from out of town but this spot was a great shopper's stop. Fresh, tasty and inexpensive. Many of the other outlets featured pretty unhealthy food.
author: Julie F.

description: Loved it. Fast, convenient vegan food that is super tasty. I got the combo plate with chow mein and sweet potato curry over rice. The kids had pho, nuggets and sweet potato fries and Tom got a combo plate with a veggie curry and sweet and sour something or other.  We ended our meal with a slice of Oreo chocolate cake. I also satisfied a much-neglected love for Thai iced tea.
author: C C.

description: Came here again recently and I am beginning to enjoy the sweet potato curry more. The chow mein was tasting especially delicious that day but not so much the fried rice. Did not get the eggplant since last time it was drenched in oil. I got the sweet and sour dish with the fake meat. It was really good. Always fills me up and can never finish the whole thing.
author: Carmen L.

description:
I don't eat a vegan diet. I'm a meat eater. But if you want to eat something somewhat healthy in the Westfields Mall food court then this is a good option. Their sandwiches are actually pretty good and I like the eggplant tofu as well as the curry. I can't eat it every day but what can you eat every day? But, can I eat it once a week? Absolutely.

*Please note that I work in the offices above the mall so I frequent the food court at least 2-3 times a week.
author: David C.

description: This is the only reason aside from Bristol Farms to go into the mall. Yummy veg food and big boxes to go!
author: Mahsa K.

description:
FOOD POISONING!!!! The hold a bucket while sitting on the pot kind. I will never eat here again. I may never eat again period.

Plus, the lady who took my order was really rude. She acted like I was trying to steal the buzzer that lets you know when your food is ready. Of course, if she was feeling as bad as I do now, I understand her attitude.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Delicious Vegan food! They let me try a sample of anything I wanted before I ordered. So far I tried the Sweet and Sour Savory, Yellow Potato Curry, and Veggie Chow Mein/Fried Rice. 

You don't have to be vegetarian or vegan to eat at this place. There should be more restaurants like this in the future.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Loving Hut isn't bad, but compared to Garden Fresh it's horrid. I had their combo which comes with rice or noodles and two sides. 

First complaint, the food was barely warm. It also looked and tasted like it sat out all day. Their sweet and sour pork could have had more sweet and sour flavor and less cornstarch and water. The noodles were dry, my tofu and eggplant side was generic in flavor and also absent in "wok heat" associated with Chinese cooking.
 
Indeed most of these vegetarian Chinese chains offer generic Chinese food, but food at Garden Fresh is at least piping hot and much more flavorful. I give Loving Hut an extra star only because they have fast food style pick-up whereas Garden fresh is dine-in only.  Even so, I am hardly a fan of the food. Sorry, no love to the hut from me.
author: Alesia T.

description:
I love loving hut!

This has been my new go-to spot for lunch. I got the pho once and was able to take the leftovers home and eat them for dinner. With one other person. Its freakin huge. Love it. 

But I have since discovered the soy protein nuggets with sweet potato fries and I have a new favorite! I normally dont like sweet potato fries. At all. But theres just something about these that I am so in love with.

AND they have thai tea with soy creamer that makes my tummy happy.
author: Britney K.

description:
Our fine (and foggy) city has plenty of good sandwich spots. And it has plenty of good vegetarian spots. But it doesn't have too many vegetarian sandwich spots, especially ones that serve soy based Philly Cheese Steak. And even rarer are ones that make them as good as Loving Hut.

On the expensive side, but also on the delicious/generously portioned side. An added bonus: perhaps because of my no mayo request, someone had the bright idea to swap the coleslaw side for orange slices.

Loved all around.
author: Jason B.

description: Great vegan fast food and in expensive too. I go there when ever I feel like a large somewhat healthy meal and the selections are great too, I'm a fan!
author: Beth P.

description:
So good. It makes me glad to be a vegan. In a sea of unhealthy choices, Loving Hut rises above the din to make me happy, fulfilled, in love.

They have a vegan buffet, populated with delicious Asian foods. Their pho is excellent. Love their "pork" bun.
author: Leo B.

description: Okay... can I just say that I am not a vegan or even close to being any kind of vegetarian and was COMPLETELY FOOLED by the food here? The idea of tofu anything freaks me out. All I can think of is that gelatinous WEIRD texture of some kind of slime dough with vegetables but I came to loving hut with my mother, a newly turned vegetarian. I was so upset, I could have gone to the burger place nearby, why would anyone want to eat vegan?!? But my mouth was quickly shut over the smell of their mongolian SOMETHING. I don't even know what it was, it had to be tofu, because its vegan, but IT WAS AMAZING. I could definitely convert if everything I ever ate was as delicious as this. GOODBYE PANDA. I cant see myself eating other types of fast food as long as this is available. It's so good! The textures of their "meats" were so spot on I had to post on facebook nonstop because I couldn't understand how it was done. I can't question it anymore all I can do is try to let anyone know who might be afraid that this is something you should try! Bacon lovers as well, open your heart to loving hut, I have. You can order entrees with rice or noodles. You can also order some spring rolls ala carte. Great price point!
author: Paula P.

description:
My friend was in town and we met up at the Westfield Shopping Centre. Had lunch at Loving Hut Vegan Cuisine. Although I'm not a vegan, just a vegetarian, I really enjoyed the food here. Had a combo with fried rice, Sweet Potato Curry, and Sautéed Broccoli for almost $10. Had a slight hang over (day after St Paddy's Day) and got a big plate of food that filled me up well. Yummy food and no problem finding an empty table in the food court area. Friendly staff.

Will eat here again next time at the shopping centre.
author: Anna S.

description:
Loving Hut has good food and it is delicious. I've eaten there several times; I use to be a big fan because it's conveniently 'fast food'. I admit its not necessarily healthy, but its healthier than most other fast food chains. That being said, I would've give more stars if it wasn't for the bad costumer service. The first few times, were minor. Not giving me my receipt when I ask for it, or, giving me an incorrect one. Other times the cashier /server talked back to my father when he gave his order. Scenario: Dad: "Id like the tofu eggplant and brown rice" Cashier/server:" You mean, white rice, yes?" Dad: No, the brown rice please" Cashier/Server: "Why tell me now? huh?" (rolls eyes) (dumps white rice out and annoyingly serves brown rice) etc... My dad use to work in the restaurant business, and he understands the pressure of work, he was forgiving about it...I wasn't to though. My last straw was when I ordered my meal and they didn't call me for over 15 minutes. (I ordered a salad) it seems like it was already done sooner but they didn't call me soon after. Its ironic because they give you these device that light up, vibrate and make noise when its ready...so, I'm not sure what went wrong there. Not to mention, I stood there wanting to ask them on the process of my order. The cashier and server both saw me standing, they turned around glanced at me...and believe it or not continued talking..as if I were invisible...fine I had to speak loudly at them to get someone's attention. The cook had to point them to me so that one could get my attention.. Overall it was uncomfortable for me so, as much I like the food. I had to let go of the bureaucracy. I can't stand unhelpful people there who treat there costumers like nothing. Come on "Loving Hut"? Where's he 'Love' for your costumers? :(

It pains me to give 'two stars" I love the Loving Huts mission statement and variety of food.... (sighs)
author: Stephany H.

description:
Update 06.13.10:
Came back and tried the stir-fried vegetables -- yum! Upgrade to 4 stars.

06.10:10:
Good place to get the vegan steamed 'BBQ pork' bun. Not a lot of filling but a tasty substitute for people who don't eat factory farm animals. Was a little taken aback that the bun is heated (microwaved?) in its plastic cling-wrap (ummm... plastic is tasty) which is not even recommended to be in contact with food though many restaurants use it to wrap food out of convenience. A little lack of concern for consumer safety perhaps? No matter... I just peel off the outer layer of the bun and enjoy it. 3 stars
author: Yvonne C.

description:
It's finally open!!

I don't understand why Yelpers post "reviews" before there's anything to see, but I've also been excited about a new addition to the food court.

The portions are generous, but not so stomachache-inducing like at Coriander or Sorabol. The food is a bit less greasy, but very flavorful and fresh. I had the two entree combo with tofu / eggplant and the tofu curry w/ sweet potato, and thoroughly enjoyed both. I think I've finally found a proper replacement for my favorite Chinese vegetarian restaurant back in Maryland!
author: Sharon W.

description: Good tasty food at decent price. Other than things mentioned in the menu, they have a buffet style take out food as well.
author: Rohit J.

description:
Very tasty

Two-Item Combo
Fried Rice w/ Lemon Grass Tofu and "Beef" and Broccoli.

The Fried Rice felt somewhat old with semi-crunchy edges.  The tofu was delightful, and the beef and broccoli were a surprise hit.  It was a pretty good portion of food... and for the price, it made it even tastier.

The ambiance? you share with the rest of the food court.  You can't exactly chalk that up to the Loving Hut's efforts.  Instead, you appreciate the hustle and bustle of the mall atmosphere.  

4 Stars purely based on taste.
author: Johnson N.

description:
This place is super convenient and quick. Everywhere else in the Food Emporium always has lines and a long wait for food. Loving Hut has sizable portions and I have never had to wait. The lunch special is rice or chow mein (I do half and half) and 2 main dishes. I am not a big fan of the fake meats, but the tofu dishes are great and the mushrooms are awesome. They also have great soup. 

If you are ever in need of a good vegan meal in the area, this is the place to go. At the Emporium they don't have all the Supreme Master stuff either which makes it better than the other location.
author: Peter V.

description:
I've only eaten two (2) of their sandwiches and their fresh spring rolls.  The sandwiches -- the Philly and the Queen's -- were delicious.  The spring rolls . . . not so much.  

This outpost has a very different menu from the Loving Hut in Chinatown (on Stockton).  I like the option for sandwiches.  I love their soy protein.  I enjoy having vegan alternatives to these classic delights.  My only criticism of their sandwiches is that I would like them to be filled more -- with more soy, with more vegetables.

Still, it's delicious and satisfying.

Recommended.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
It's pretty legit that this place cranks out such tasty, fresh food and it's located in a food court.  I guess the Bloomies food court is light years better than your average good court, but whatev.

I love this place.  I am addicted to the garden vermicelli and must eat it once a week.  

Their egg rolls are a must and come with the garden vermicelli or you can order it as a side.

The 2 item buffet special is also good.  I've tried the basil mushroom (drool), sweet potato curry and eggplant tofu, all of which I've thoroughly enjoyed.

When I get sick of the garden vermicelli, it's nice to know I have lots of other delicious options.
author: Kristine B.

description:
While it's nice that there's a vegan option, even in a food court, this chain tries to compensate for the lack of meat and dairy with too much frying, and too much fake, meat-esque products.  I would give them more stars if they did a better job bringing to the masses the deliciousness of a plant-strong diet, without all the grease and meat-like-ness.  

...that said, vegan beggars can't be choosers, so I'll definitely be going back! :)
author: Ted R.

description:
Having grown up in a certain religion, I was subject to a lot of vegetarian/vegan potlucks at church and vegetarian/vegan eating in high school.  Now, I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan mind you, but because of my exposure to the "fake meat/brown rice/bragg liquid amino" world, I have come to appreciate that kind of lifestyle and its health benefits.  I love my meat, don't get me wrong.  But, now and again, I like to (somehow) cleanse my body of artery clogging sisig fat and mounds of mechado beef stew, which has been sitting in a vat of oil.  

With Loving Hut, I can now fulfill my wanna-be cleanse by partaking in their 2-combo meal deal for $8.25.  Their portions fill me up pretty good and by the end of the meal I'm full.  But, this is a good full that doesn't force me to want to hop in bed and sleep.  I love their food, especially their sweet potato curry and eggplant tofu.  All times I will opt for 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 chow mein just because I like options.  I'm just super stoked they have brown rice.  

I may not currently be vegetarian (or in this case - a vegan), but with places like Loving Hut it wouldn't be hard to become one....even if it's only for a day.  hahaha.
author: Heizel M.

description: I had the fake pho.  It was not good.  It was WAY too salty and it just tasted really funny.  I get it, it's not real pho since it's vegan, but it really didn't have to be THAT salty.  I ended up going back to the office and gulping a 24 oz water bottle just to get rid of the saltiness in my mouth.  Augh...disgusting.  I will never return back here.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
pretty tasty alternative to the normal fare.  

Overall food was very good.  My only complaint was that it was salty from the sauces used to stir fry the vegetables.   I would have preferred a little less sauce.  

Price was a bargain too for two items and fried rice...only $8.50!
author: Matt V.

description: If you're looking for healthy food in a mall dining court, this is a good choice. I had the summer roll and was satisfied on it alone.
author: Theresa S.

description: When I am in Union Square catching a movie or shopping, I make a stop here for Pho Noodle Soup (without sprouts), especially when we have that SF breeze that can chill you to the bone.  The portions are so big that I bet you can't finish the whole thing on your own. I've tried and failed, multiple times.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Since the spot opened a couple weeks ago I've eaten there at least twice a week. You can count on the food to be fresh and the portions are good.  I usually get the 2 item buffet which runs about $9.  Not bad. You get to choose brown or white rice. (I recommend the brown rice. very tasty!) Only reason I knocked it down to 1 star is because some of the veggies are a little tough & undercooked for my liking.  

You cant go wrong with the potato & tofu curry, or the mushroom dishes.

ENJOY!
author: Jasmine S.

description:
The Loving Hut gets two enthusiastic thumbs up!
So good... I went back the next day. 
I enjoyed items from the buffet including lemongrass tofu, marinated kale, and spicy green beans. All were flavorful (even the kale which featured a light tasting soy dressing). 
I hate going to the mall but when I'm in the area with a craving for vegetarian, this is a healthy, tasty, go to spot.
author: Rakela W.

description:
Loving Hut minus Master Chin-Hai. I was rather shocked when I did not see "supreme master" grace the LCD television screen for Loving Hut inside the Westfield Shopping Center in Downtown San Francisco (newer side). 

I love Loving Hut and first discovered it in Chinatown. They recently opened this location inside the mall. It can get busy at times, but their food is well worth it. I love their curry dishes. Whenever I am eating at Loving Hut, I need to remind myself that I no longer have a limited menu since I can order and eat anything on it. I love that the restaurant is vegan and I've always ate fresh food from there.

Pricing: Prices are more expensive here than Chinatown. For example, a 2 item entree plus rice runs around $8 something + tax at this location. Meanwhile, the same lunch special is $5.99 + tax and includes soup at the Chinatown location.

Payment: Takes credit card. Very useful indeed!
author: Tina C.

description:
I came to Loving Hut really excited, because this place sounded akin to one of my favorite restaurants in Boston, My Thai Vegan Cafe.  Granted, My Thai is not in a food court - but it's still fast, cheap, and incredibly tasty.

Unfortunately, Loving Hut isn't quite as good as my old standby.  I ordered the Garden Vermicelli (side note: I majorly *heart* vermicelli and eat it prob at least once a week).  Disappointingly, their version was fairly bland (a little more sauce perhaps?), the ratio of noodles to all else is really overwhelming, the high amount of lettuce is ridiculous, and the lack of carrots is sad (there are a few paperthin slivers floating in the sauce, but you can't really taste them).

On the positive side, the spring rolls are fantastic.

I will more likely than not give them a second chance, because the sweet potato curry and the sandwiches look pretty good.  But it's definitely a solid 3 stars for the vermicelli.

-UPDATE-

After trying the Queen's Sandwich (essentially a vegan banh mi) I've upped my review to 4 stars.  The sandwich is effing delicious - I just wish it cost the same as a regular banh mi so I could eat one every day.
author: Allison B.

description: Really great food, definitely best food in the Westfield. I come here from the Financial District almost every day for lunch because it's that good. I haven't tried everything, but I think the Rainbow Salad is the best thing on the menu. The vegan Thai milk tea is awesome. Food is around $7.50-$9, friendly staff, fast prepared food, love this place!
author: Ruby L.

description: This location is great. Fast, friendly service. I get the crispy tenders & fries & am never disappointed. So happy to have a place in the mall especially for vegan food! I tried the carrot cake cupcake once, it was alright. The counter people are always friendly and I always find myself craving this food. My nonvegan friend tried the philly cheese steak & said it was good "for vegan food." I've tried the asian entree plate deal thing, but I pass on that now. It's a little greasy & bland. Stick with the fried goodness.
author: Jess H.

description:
The place is a big chain and it tastes like it. It's about as good as Panda Express.
They should rename it Diabetes Hut - everything is drenched in a sugary sauce.
I'm drinking extra water to wash the taste from my mouth and speed digestion.
This is NOT healthy food.
author: Chris B.

description:
My bf loves eating in the food court in the mall. I do not. Buuut.. the only way to get him to go shopping with me is to bribe him with food. Either the food court or one of those big pretzels from street vendors. ew

Anyhow, I was pleasantly surprised to see a new vegan option in the Westfield Mall food court.

I had the eggplant tofu, lemongrass tofu and noodles. It was the standard two items and rice or noodles combo. 
The portions were way way too big. It could have fed both the bf and I, but he was engaged with garlic fries and a veggie burger.
I ate about a third of it ..

It was okay. The taste was just a little off but I can't pinpoint what it was.
It gave me a moderate stomach ache too .. not bad enough to stop me from shopping but still .. 

I'd only go back if I had to in order to get the BF to go shopping with me again. Looks like time for me to find some chicks to shop with ;/
author: Amber F.

description:
I decided to come here after hearing the raves about this place from my other co-workers.  They have menu or you order what you like from the buffet for 2 items plus rice/noodles for $8.25.  Hey, for the mall, it's a good deal.

I got the brown rice with lemongrass tofu and beef with broccoli.  Everything was very yummy.  The texture was beefy to say the list.  It was a good, but healthy meal - all without the food coma you usually get from food like this at say Panda Express.

Will definitely try again this healthy alternative for lunch another day for sure!
author: Raymond G.

description:
A vegan friend brought me here recently.  It's in the food court at the Westfield, so I had already mentally relegated it to getting 3-stars at best.

Service was a little spotty.  They obviously didn't have their act together behind the counter.  But the food was delicious.

We split two sandwiches, and a side dish.  The Loving Hut Special and  Philly were just outstanding.  The Teriyaki beef and vegetables was quite a dish in itself.  

I've never been bothered by "ordinary" vegetarian/vegan food, but this "fake meat" approach was really quite interesting.  If you ever have to drag a meat-a-tarian friend along, they probably wouldn't know the difference between the soy and the real thing.
author: Ken B.

description: Very tasty food.  Great presentation.  Food looks very appetizing even to a non vegan like me.  I really enjoyed the food when I went here with my daughter last week.  She has been craving just vegetables and tofu.  So we went for lunch and I loved it.
author: RR S.

description:
I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan!!!  But I do need to get in more veggies in my diet and I am allergic to dairy....  However, I do tend to run FAR away from those veggie/vegan restaurants b/c of that whole "you're supposed to be eating our food" attitude.  (Sorry, RAW food people!  Nothing against 'ya, but just not my thing...)

So when I saw this restaurant and saw the spicy eggplant and sweet potato curry, I thought "Hmmmm?  Two of my favorite veggie!!!"  I just had to try it. I'm so glad I did b/c both of those items ROCK!!!  VERY TASTY w/o having it "sit" in your stomach!!!  And add to that.... vegan flan!?!?!?!  NO DAIRY!?!?!  OMFG!!!  A FLAN that I can actually EAT w/o getting sick afterward in the bathroom!!!  And it still taste like flan... very light, sugary.

Also, it's at food court price!  Now... it ain't Greens!!!  It's NOT for the refined palate.  It doesn't have the nice fancy schmacy table service and certainly NOT the atmosphere (i.e. Marina Green, pretty boats...)  You'll probably been sitting at the food court with a bunch of SCREAMING BRATS and parents yelling back at them.  But having the vegan flan and other desserts where it doesn't have dairy to screw with my stomach trumps Green's dessert menu!!!  And if I really need to get away and sit at a nice area, I can always order it "to-go" and sit near the water sculpture at Yerba Buena Gardens and have a picnic!!!  :P

Can't give a 5 yet... have to try the other desserts, the meat substitutes meals and that steamed "fake pork" bun.

And yes, this place is too small and at too mainstream of a locale for those religious videos that the Loving Hut at Chinatown has.   Nor do I have waiters, host/esses and owners shoving their religion down my throat... and that's the way I want it, thank you!!!  :)
author: Joanna R.

description:
I am not vegan or vegetarian but this place has amazing Vietnamese/Chinese food.  I have tried both their spring rolls, some stir fry options, and their Spicy Royal Noodle Soup.  Everything was tasty but my favorite is the Spicy Royal Noodle Soup.  It has tofu and soy protein in it and the broth is a perfect balance of sweet, salty, sour, and spicy (if you leave the jalapenos stewing in the broth).  I have eaten a lot of soy protein in my life and I have to say Loving Hut is one of the better restaurants that serve it.

The service is exactly what you would expect from a mall food kiosk.  Fast and nice but you have to keep in mind this is a volume business.

This is my favorite stall in the Westfield Mall food court
author: York N.

description: I didn't even order asian food here and it was still amazing. I got the queen sandwhich which was somehow filing and refreshing at the same time. The wheat proteins and sauce here are very flavorful.
author: Ethan J.

description:
I was in the city for the day and went to the mall. A friend told me about Loving Hut and I was eager to try it. It's nice to go to the food court and not have to wonder what food is REALLY vegan, or have to go on a scavenger hunt for something good. 

I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak sandwich.. The flavors were good and the sandwich was filling, I just wish there was more of the good stuff inside. The coleslaw was super yummy, I can't even remember the last time I had coleslaw!!!  I recommend this place to all the veggie peeps who are in a hurry and looking for good food at a good price.
author: Maria P.

description: WOW! This was my first experience with vegan food in a mall food court! Food was good. Easy to sample several items. Would recommend if you are shopping in the area.
author: Renee L.

description: Coming from the San Gabriel Valley in Southern California, I have had my fair share of Asian style vegetarian food. Loving hut does an amazing job of making great food that anyone (even meat eaters) can enjoy! I enjoy the soy protein, they make it where it is soft rather than tough and chewy. My only complaints would be sometimes the main entree for the two item combo is a little too sweet, but beside that, I love it here and will be coming back soon!
author: Tracy C.

description: Why did I wait so long to try Loving Hut? I'm as carnivorous as they come but their rainbow salad is truly delicious and filling! I'm eager to try other dishes now!!
author: Susan V.

description: Great place for budget vegan food, but not necessarily the healthiest menu, as far as vegan goes.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Yay! There's vegan food in the mall food court, with lots of options!

Wow, kinda expensive... but it looks great, and there are so many choices! And I don't have to check to see if it's faux or real chicken, beef etc.

Problem is, the tastiness is hit and miss. Some items are pretty good, others are bland and really not worth the money.

Still, the location is great, and the food is fresh, so I'll undoubtedly be going here again (I've been twice already). Hopefully they'll decide to move in a more spice-heavy direction.
author: Jamie F.

description:
I was really excited that Loving Hut was opening in Westfield. Alas, the food was only mediocre. My husband brought home a selection from the buffet and, while the food was tasty, it wasn't anything special. It certainly wasn't of the same caliber of Golden Era or Enjoy Vegetarian (the top notch vegan Chinese restaurants). 

Last night, I tried again, this time getting their Philly sandwich.  The faux meat bordered on being too sweet but the real crime was the extremely hard "French baguette".  Why on earth they chose this bread is beyond me--it was way too hard to chew and wasn't worth it. Compared to the seitan Philly sandwich from Jay's Cheesesteak, it really doesn't hold a candle.  It was served with a coleslaw which was good--I used it to stuff the sandwich which thankfully softened the bread somewhat.

They also need a better way to call out numbers for those who are waiting to pick up. The voices of the cooks are very soft and don't carry. 

I noticed a couple of reviewers mentioned steamed buns. I didn't see any, but I definitely would have ordered a couple if I did! If any good, my husband and I would probably purchase them on a regular basis. (It's hard to find good vegan steam buns!)

Anyway, I'll probably continue eating at the Westfield Loving Hut, as it is in a convenient location if you are out shopping or going to a movie and there's really not that much competition for vegan restaurants in that area. However, I think they'll probably need to step up their game in order to compete with the many choices available in the food court.
author: RM F.

description:
The veggie pork buns here are fantastic!

I have been not as impressed with the entree selections (I actually prefer the Yik Yak salad from the Buckhorn Grill).  

BUT ... those veggie pork buns!  OMG.  So good.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Stopped by at Westfield Mall and walked around the food court about 3 times before finally deciding on Loving Hut which seemed like a clean and healthy option compared to some of their competitors that surrounded them. I also noticed that most of the others had a queue as big as my hunger and Loving Hut had a very small one in comparison (obviously, not a good sign usually!) so I decided to eat there.

I ordered the Garden Vermicelli noodles which was basically a salad with two spring rolls and a thai sweet dipping sauce which I guess also acted like a dressing. That was just a little under $9. The lady who served me struggled to understand my english accent and I'd also struggled to understand her "?" accent but eventually I worked out that what she was trying to tell me was that they didn't have vermicelli noodles and would replace it with rice noodles instead. As I was waiting for my food I noticed some guy had ordered an asian sandwich which looked amazing. That was a good sign so was looking forward to seeing how mine looked. I didn't have to wait long and when I looked down and saw the salad on my tray resting against my stomach I soon realised that it was actually bigger than my belly.... which is going some!! 

I am ashamed to say that I couldn't finish the dish but I was pleasantly surprised that for a food court restaurant, the food tasted pretty good. There were some sort of black coloured food item that didn't look all that appetising which ran along the middle of the bowl... i presumed it was mushroom but after tasting it i was none the wiser. Spring rolls were crispy and very filling and the noodles were fine. There was a lot of green salad leaves, lettuce, mint and coriander which I just couldn't eat in the end just because there was so much of it.

I did feel slightly uncomfortable at the amount of people standing around my table, walking past hunting for an empty seat and trying to stare me out. This was very off putting but you have to expect that from a food court. In the end, I was happy with the choice but would probably suggest a takeaway or eat there when it's not lunch!!
author: Nigel L.

description:
Great vegan options and good for a quick bite or take away.

Their rice paper rolls and salads are great! I also like their hot buffet items. Some of the other menu items aren't particularly healthy and the drinks selections are limited (would love to see more smoothies etc but they obviously have limited kitchen space here).
author: Kat L.

description:
I walked into Westfield Mall food court needing food - I was seriously "brain hungry" and didn't want to have to fight through lines to see if anyone was vegetarian, no MSG, etc. And there was Loving Hut - their food is delicious, prices very reasonable and good portion sizes. Staff were friendly too. 
Now if only there was one a few blocks from me. Really good veggie food is hard to find (or it all tastes the same).
author: Zef A.

description:
I go to Loving Hut at least once a week for lunch during my work week.  I've had the buffet plate, the sandwiches, one of the noodle dishes and both of the noodle soups.   

First off, I absolutely love the lemongrass with tofu, basil mushrooms, noodle soup, spicy noodle soup, and the queen sandwich.  just for these alone i'd go back again and again.  they're tasty, filling, and the portions are huge.  it's rare for me to actually clean my plate.  Also, the freshly made lemonade is great.  My only complaint about it is that I never have enough.

The staff at this location is also very friendly and nice.  I enjoy my experience here.

Two drawbacks I'll point out.  The bread isn't to my liking.  It's not stale, but it's that day old stale where it's not soft and fresh, but it's not rock hard.  It's just at the turning point.  I don't know if that's the type of bread it is, or if they just don't use enough of it that they are using day old bread.  I really like my bread to be soft and fresh, so while I like the sandwiches and the fillings, the bread is a bit of a turn off.  I'll still get them occasionally, but not as often as the buffet or the soups. 

Second, I find the spicing to be variable.  As in sometimes I'm expecting spicy and it's not, other times I'm expecting not spicy and it is.  For example, they have two noodle soups that are very similar in ingredients, except one has chili oil/sauce in it.  It's pretty obvious which one does, it's got an orange tinge to the broth. I've had both and enjoyed both, even though I'm not a fan of spicy foods.  One lunch, I decided I wanted the noodle soup but I was *not* in the mood for spicy, so I ordered the non-spicy one.  The amount of heat in the broth was so over the top, I could barely eat it.  It was even more hot than the spicy version I'd had before.  I wasn't very happy with that since I had ordered the mild one for a reason.  

Overall though, it's still one of my favourite places to go at lunch time. Vegan, tasty, good for you and the animals.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Visiting San Francisco from Prairie Western Canada was a vegan dream come to. My friends and I were on our way to a movie and needed quick food. We decided to stop in this mall. Initially, since I was so accustomed to Calgary food courts being completely unaccomodating to my vegan lifestyle, I scoped out the grocery store. 
While choosing some eats, the power went out. Only in the grocer's. So I suppose it was fate that I would step out into the Food Court and lay my eyes upon Loving Hut. Vegetarian Cuisine... IN THE FORM OF FAST FOOD? You're lying!
I ate a delicious noodle type bowl. It isn't the best vegan fare I've ever had, and I definitely ate twenty million better meals during my time in San Francisco, but it's nice to see that there are options! :)
author: Sarah Louise F.

description:
When the wife and I were out to see a movie upstairs I was worried about what my food options were for dinner in the food court.

I had changed my diet to mostly veg/vegan somewhat recently and I thought I was going to be stuck with a salad for dinner...boring.

I was overjoyed when I saw Loving Hut! Yes! I can eat healthy and have a hot meal! Food was very good for steam tray buffett (I've had worse).  The tofu dish and string beans with "shirmp" was great and the portion size was perfict. Not too much and not too little.

I will be back!
author: Darius D.

description: Great choice for a vegan eater with plenty of delicious options and the fast, friendly service always leaves me feeling happy.
author: Tyson H.

description:
I just finished my vermicelli and it was awesome! I eat vermicelli on a fairly regular basis and i have to say this place serves one of the best! 

would definitely recommend!
author: J P.

description:
It's nice to see a vegan place in a mall.  In fact, it's awesome.  But the food and service and decor is ... mall food.  Surprise!  So, if you're shopping around Westfield Mall and feeling hungry and you're vegan, then stop here.

I'm not sure how to rate this place.  Compared to your typical restaurant, it is ... mediocre.  But it is just a food court place, so that's probably asking too much.  I'd say it's on par with other food court restaurants, with the bonus that it's 100% vegan.
author: Douglas P.

description:
Random adventure downtown = random dinner at Loving Hut.

First time eating here, and won't be the last. I ordered the Garden Vermicelli dish and it came out within 5 minutes. I was so hungry after a day from work, and this place smelt so good. Everything about their venue was geared towards vegans, and even though I am not vegan, I recommend all vegans to try this place! 

The noodle dish was so flavorful. The tofu and egg rolls were delicious. The sauce unlike all other vermicelli dishes I've had did not have a strong fish/shrimp smell and seemed kind of water-y. But nonetheless was not too salty. Usually when I eat noodle dishes with a salty sauce, my lips start to get overwhelmed and they get irritated. Here, at Loving Hut, for the first time my lips did not act out on me due to the sauce. Their dish selection varied with a few dishes in certain categories, but I noticed that they had an assortment of sides you can order with rice, all which are vegan-friendly.

The service is fast and friendly. They give you a water cup for self-serve water. I suggest, if you're a vegan, give this place a try.

Tip(s): - seating is easy to find because it's in a food court.
-utensils are AROUND the corner not the front. 

happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description:
I've eaten here several times, and I notice that the service is increasingly worse. They are consistently out of half of their offerings, and often there is a long wait for the food you want. Instead of recognizing that this can be frustrating for customers and working to handle it graciously and respectfully, the employees are rude, pushy, and unwelcoming. On my most recent visit (which will probably be my last), I noticed one of the cooks staring me down in a completely hostile manner. What the heck?!?! 

The food is alright, but not worth being treated with disdain.
author: Kat W.

description:
Overall, food is ok. I had the eggplant dish and the basil mushrooms and fried rice.  Definitely not a fan of the eggplant.  The basil mushroom was ok and the fried rice was decent.  

My gripe is that I honestly think that this is not a Vegan restaurant.  It is definitely not organic and based on what I can tell from the sauces and preparation, I dont think it would qualify as vegan. I tried to find out more but their website tells you nothing.  They mention saving the environment, but dont say what they are doing.  Hence, I get the impression this is just marketing with no substance.

To sum it up, if you want ok asian style food that is vegetarian, this place works as it comes at a good price.  But if you are looking for a good organic vegan option, this is not going to fit the bill.
author: Markus S.

description:
I'm not a vegan, but I do like veggies and eating healthy.  I work close to the mall so I like to come down to the food court because there are so many options.  However, one does get sick of the massive amounts of carbs and protein.  Sometimes you need to intake other nutrients.

I tried the sweet potato curry and basil mushroom with brown rice ($9).  It was a filling lunch and on par with any other place in that food court in terms of tastiness. Wish they had given me more veggies and less rice though. That being said, I will go back to try some of their other dishes.
author: Lara O.

description: Amazing place! The food is wonderfully delicious and the atmosphere is very serene. I really enjoyed it and will be coming back for more.
author: Sylwia E.

description: My sister and I aren't vegan but she loves this place. When she brought me here I almost turned around when I saw that it was vegan! I was pleasantly surprised and we actually came here two days in a row! the kale is our favorite, it's perfectly cooked and seasoned. we also had the lemongrass tofu and basil mushroom which was also delicious!
author: Kate W.

description:
After reading the reviews on here, I thought I would definitely try it out.  I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was sort of a buffet style where you can pick 2 foods.  I had the broccoli with tofu in black bean sauce and the iced Jasmine and Soya milk drink.
The food was really good, but a little bland, the Jasmine tea was fantastic.  I would definitely visit here again on my next trip to San Fran :)
author: Susana P.

description: I LOVE loving hut! I'm a vegetarian and being able to go somewhere where you can eat anything is awesome. This place had a short line, great service and awesome food. I asked the guy for extra tofu and he gave me lots! This play is a must have if you are vegetarian or just in the mood for something delicious
author: Maeve C.

description:
An afternoon of shopping left me starving mad and my BF thirsty.  Our compromise was one of the food stands down in Bloomies.  After perusing our choices, I stopped at Loving Hut.  Hey, this was different and plus we're vegan, sometimes!

We finalized our order on the "chicken" nuggets and sweet potato fries, and my "not hungry, but thirsty" BF got the fried rice with, water.  Just to give you some background info, we know our meatless nuggets, and we've tried almost every brand out there.  Having said that, these were pretty good.  The sweet potato fries didn't have much flavor, aka salt(?), although it came with a BBQ dipping sauce.  The fried rice was also pretty good.  I would come back again if I was starving wondering the street of DT SF.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
I've tried a bunch of stuff from here and some of it is good but other stuff is not that great.

philly cheese steak - it's bread with seitan or tempeh or something in the middle and vegan mayo (I guess); not that impressive IMO

chicken nuggets - I literally saw them opening a pack of frozen chicken nuggets so these are not even made by them

The mains that come with rice are pretty good I would say, and reasonable in price as well. The two items with rice combo is extremely filling for me.
author: Lori L.

description: I go to the sfsu business school and it is located in the mall, so after work I head straight there and am always hungry. I went up to the loving hut one day but didn't think it looked good so I didn't get anything. After awhile I got sick of the Bristol farms veggie rolls and just sucked it up and ordered the sweet potato curry with fried rice. I'm pretty sure it's not the healthiest vegan item out there but it made me regret not trying the loving hut sooner! It was delicious and I've never gotten anything else (it still doesn't look that great). It's a little sweet and a little spicy and double points because the fried rice doesn't have onions, which I hate. Downsides are that i never really get more than one or two pieces of sweet potato (mostly potato and tofu-but the curry sauce is made with  sweet potato) and the lack of visual appeal.
author: Madeline W.

description:
I figured that a place that touts health, sustainability, vegetarianism, etc. would be able to provide or at least understand what I meant by "an entree without wheat".  

But alas, no such luck. It took me asking 5 times, and 2 different people before I gave up.  Even once I got someone to listen carefully to my question "is there anything that does not have soy sauce,"  I still got a blank look.  (soy sauce is a big no-no for the gluten intolerant)

GF people...steer clear. I have a feeling that this place is as bad as any Chinese food place, full of wheat-filled entrees. But it's just a feeling...considering I still don't know the answer to my question. 

Bummer...it would be awesome if they offered at least one or two GF menu items, or at least knew what that meant. I don't expect every restaurant to understand...but when you tout yourself as a health-conscious place...hire people who at least have a clue what that means.
author: Lauren F.

description: It's my first time trying this place.  I guess for a meat lover, this vegan spot is not too bad.  The flavors were good, but I am not so sure how healthy this is... If you happen to be shopping in this plaza and want something quick to eat at the food court, this is not a bad option!
author: Tiffany H.

description: This place is a joke. The people are ALWAYS rude. They get mad if you ask for a cup or soysauce and give you whatever is left instead of making more food. I frequent this place once a month since its the only vegan place inside the mall, but after today's foul tasting coffee and HARD piece of cake ...I'm done. They get one star .. For being Vegan.
author: Tegan C.

description: Wow, this place is dang good. I had the noodle bowl with vegan meat, fried spring roll and assorted vege goodies ($8). It was amazingly fresh and tasty. I need to try the one in China town, but having this one right off the BART is a great option for a quick fix vegan meal while gettin' your shop on. Yay for healthy food court options!
author: Shira O.

description: I love the Loving Hut. I'm especially happy with this location being in the mall as my young son has many choices to pick from since he is peanut allergic and I prefer for him to not eat somewhere that serves nuts. Staff is super friendly, the food is delicious, atmosphere here is nice, doesn't feel like your typical mall food court, it is much nicer!! Great food, great prices, great experience!!
author: Debi B.

description:
Oh supreme master, I surprisingly have found thee in the posh SF Westfield shopping center! You're like American Express and everywhere I want to be!

For fast food, this would be number my one choice. I had the buffet with 2 items with rice for about 8.50 after tax.  You get your rice, brown, fried, or combo! I got the sweet potato curry and basil mushrooms. The servings size was HUGE and I was FULL! Food was really fresh and good. It wasn't heavy or doused with sugar, salt, or cornstarch like that panda run buffet joint. I washed this all down with the complimentary lemon slice water.

If you didn't know by now, this is a vegetarian/vegan place because that's just how the supreme master rolls. There are other choices like "chik" nuggets and lactose free desserts that are also yummy which are also offered at her other restaurants. And service, of course, is good. All of the master's employees  always appear to be quite kind and friendly.

Unlike the Vegetarian House in SJ or the Loving Hut in Milpitas, there was no wise words of wisdom on a pretty pretty flat screen encouraging me to live simply and to be nice to the animals. Instead I just had to resort to staring at the Bloomingdale's window and fantasize about champagne wishes and caviar dreams.

There are a million choices in this part of town and in this mall. I still wholly recommend this place as one of the healthiest,  fastest, and (relatively) economical choices here.
author: Kitty N.

description:
The Loving Hut is a healthy, nice oasis in the middle of the Westfield food court. The Pho in particular is a treat, because most Vietnamese places have only chicken or beef-based pho. Towards the end of the day, the broth is particularly rich and complex.

Regarding the bashers - yo, look, every Asian place cooks with soy sauce. If you can't eat soy sauce, don't ever eat at Asian places. They have no obligation to create culturally bizarre dishes just for your health quirks.  These people are practicing Buddhism, not following a diet trend.  If you are on a low gluten diet and can handle soy sauce, which frankly provides a miniscule amount of gluten, then you've got some options. Things to avoid- wheat buffet noodles; some of the fake meat may have gluten base, and obviously avoid the bao buns. Go for the tofu dishes sauteed with veggies, plus brown rice.

Generally a nice small business, with good options, at a fair price.
author: R S.

description: Had spicy noodle soup, awesome...wud definitely visit again.
author: Itisha J.

description:
I'm not so much a fan after the first try. 

I don't like waiting for my food, even though that is probably what I spend most of my time doing. I wait, and my food comes in a timely manner. But for some reason, my food did not come in a timely manner and I have no idea why. Is it because they open at 10am and I was there at 11:30 and there was absolutely no one there? Did it really take that long to put my vegan Pho together, which by the way, was to-go? Did it really take twenty minutes for them to put broth in a take out cup and noodles, tofu and mushrooms in a container, too? I was not a happy camper, let's just say that. 

Long story short, I waited twenty minutes for food that I have to say that I didn't really like. I was excited at the prospect of something new and somewhat different in the food court at the mall, but then again, it's the mall. I shouldn't hold such high expectations. 

I am though, willing to try this place again. Perhaps I was wrong in trying to order soup. All I could think was that if it took 20 minutes to put this 9 dollar soup together, then it should be good (in all honesty, I didn't like the flavors). I'm interested in their salads... they have some hot foods available but when I looked at what they had, I noticed their rice had that "hardened and sitting out for a while" look to it. Wasn't exactly encouraging, but I am curious as to how their salads taste because the menu did look enticing. I'd like to update this with a better review at some point.
author: Caroline L.

description:
This place used to be actually good when they first opened (excellent, even, if you compare it to the crappy food that can normally be found in the mall) . I'm not exactly sure what happened but it's like they decided their food too good for mall food.... and so slowly everything got greasier and more sugary to match with the rest of the veg offerings in the mall. I've gone here and thought I should've gone to Panda Express for health reasons. I felt sick to my stomach after last time I got a combo... there's just too much grease. The pho is suspiciously sugary... I could be wrong but I'm pretty sure it's not supposed to taste as sweet as some of the Japanese candies I was eating earlier that day. The fake meats they add to stuff are pretty good and there's quite a variety but they amount the add has slowly decreased over time as the prices have stayed the same or increased. The vegetables seem pretty fresh which is one plus. Service is fast and polite. The lemonade isn't that good and is sort of just a pricey rip off... if you ask them not to stuff the glass up with ice first, they'll charge you a decent chunk extra. (I haven't bought a drink from them since.)

It would be 2 stars but fast service and being vegan earn it three in my book. (That and the fact I've rated worse places with two stars.) I'll come here again, just as soon as I'm in a hurry to take BART to school and I have had enough time to forget exactly how greasy and sugary the food really is.
author: A J.

description:
Mediocre food and rather small portions.  It irritated me just watching them plate the food.  "Umm.  Should I give them one quarter block of tofu?  Maybe one and a half..."  It's freakin' tofu!!  How f'in cheap do you have to be to ponder serving tofu?  Just scoop it on the plate!!  

There are a lot better places in the food court than this.  NEXT!
author: Baby J.

description:
I am a big fan of their Milpitas full service restaurant, so glad that they opened in Westfield. 
Combo plate for $8.25 had good portions, I had brown rice with basil mushrooms and a sweet potato curry - DELISH. Portions good, I actually could not finish it in one sitting.
Gal behind the counter friendly & efficient, soymilk and Thai ice tea also perfect (although more than 3 bucks is kind of pricey for Thai ice tea...but I've spent that much on nasty Starbucks before.)
I'm not even a vegan, but I enjoy healthy fare that doesn't send me into worktime food coma.
author: H H.

description: Save your money on this one and eat somewhere else! Over priced food with small portions that have very little taste. Had the grilled Philly sandwich and it was terrible. They are giving vegans and vegetarians a bad name!
author: Kyle P.

description: a great vegan place to eat while at union square. love there spicy noodle and philly sandwich. the food is really yummy even though at first the philly tasted really odd after a few more bites it really tasted good, not exactly like a Philly but good non the less. sure place to go at union square.
author: K. K.

description: This is the place I go to when I don't want to spend $15 at Out the Door (or if they are closed).  If you love to eat tofu, go to this place.  They have several varieties of tofu dishes (curries, stir-fries, etc) that are great with brown rice.  I really like the tofu & eggplant entree.  The portions are huge- I normally tell the server not to give me so much rice.  Also they use a variety of veggies which is great instead of some places that fill you up w/ cheap veggies- celery, carrots, onions.  This place is also consistent...I've been there at least 5 times and the food is always good.
author: Puff G.

description:
I ate here at least twice a week for the past year as my office was next door.
I love the soups here.  Loving Hut Noodle Soup and Spicy Royal Noodle Soup (which is not actually spicy) are consistently great!
author: SF D.

description:
I got the Queen Sandwich to go and I thought it was bland and overpriced.  The bread was much thicker than what was inside (which was hard to see), and nowhere near as good as the cheaper, Vietnamese tofu sandwiches I've had at a hole-in-the-wall places around town for $4.  They need to bring the prices down or else make the sandwiches live up to the price.  On the plus side, the staff here are very nice and I've had a few average meals here before and it's the only veggie place right near the Metreon and Yerba Buena.  I would recommend to order a la carte, non-sandwich items though.  The pre-made stuff up front is hit or miss; sometimes, it's quite old; other times, decent.

THIS particular location of the Loving Hut has the best food though of the three Huts around the city.  The other two are worse (the one near GG Park gave me and another person INSTANT food poisoning...twice!). I will hand it to them though, the people who work at all three locations are really nice, but still!
author: Lisita P.

description:
Updating my review from 4 stars to 3. 
I've eaten there about twice a month since it opened and I found that the quality has decreased. 
I had their grilled seitan sandwich a few months ago and it was great. I had it this week and it looked different and was cold in the middle. I was hungry and in a hurry so I ate it and left. I'm not sure I will frequent this place so often now.
author: Howard S.

description:
Eating at the mall food court is usually not something to write home about.
However, this is not your typical over greasy and bland food court meal deal, Loving Hut is a vegetarian Vietnamese food stall with cook-to-order noodle soups. I don't know any other food court stall that offers that luxury.
Their pho noodle soup is flavorful and the steam bun is tasty as well. So next time when you pass by the Powell BART Station, try to grab a bite from Loving Hut, perhaps you too might become a fan.
author: Mit P.

description:
this loving hut is located in the  new westfield mall below street level.
if you're vegan and you're hungry, and you're around downtown, do eat here, they're as good as you can get for chinese and vietnamese style kind of food.
i usually order buffet combo special so 1 full plate: brown rice/fried rice/fried noodle plus choice of 2 things on a plate for $8.25+ tax. I tried the kale, mushroom with brown sauce, i love the sweet-sour chicken it's delicious. if you want to add the 3rd thing you have to add $2 each item.
another thing i love is: garden vermicelli (delicious soy meat taste sweet + long bean sprout + white vermicelli + lettuce + mint/cilantro + cucumber + peanut crushed + 2 fried spring rolls + 1 bowl of vietnamese sauce ) , it's served in a big bowl, so 1 bowl makes me real full already! but this garden vermicelli taste very vietnamese, so delicious yum yum! 1 dish will cost like $8.25 +tax.

the service is not that great because everytime i come here, nobody in this place is ever SMILE. It's like they don't reflect this beautiful stall of Loving Hut and the compassion and loving symbol of Loving Hut, it's such a shame. I think the owner should retrain all of them in the front (cashier/who serve your plate with food) who's not smiling, but hey it's probably the food court with no air that stresses them out?!? i don't know i guess i expect too much for a vegan place, it should be positive but this is the only negative i saw from this place oh well...  for the tips just ignore them, just get your dish and don't look at them for too long, just imagine you'll eat good soon. I always ignore them but sometimes they do annoying especially if you're real hungry you tend to be more sensitive and impatient. Oh also if you don't order anything for drink, you could just ask the cashier for a glass of water which they'll give you an empty glass you could fill out from a jug of water on the left of cashier.

will i go back? definitely, i will ignore those staffs and just enjoying my plate everytime i go here!
author: Ms C.

description: Great vegan food. I recommend the lemongrass tofu, the sweet potato curry, the philly sandwich, and the avocado smoothie.
author: Michael P.

description: The Westfield Mall food court location is excellent.  For vegan and the convenient location, the combo at $9.00 isn't too bad a deal.  The Chinatown location on Stockton is cheaper; however, the number of items in that buffet is limited and, of course, there's the hike to get there.  In the Westfield Mall, you select either white rice, brown rice, fried rice, or chow mein with two selections from 10+ dishes available.  My favorite entree is the basil mushroom but everything is good.  Highly recommended.
author: Brian C.

description:
As one review wrote:

"Nothing was fresh and it was all just diagusting meat substitutes. I'm vegan because I don't want to eat meat.  So don't subsitute it with a fake which is even worse"

Great, well, now we know why someone is vegan, as though we couldn't have deduced that much, but I digress...

My point here is, I wholeheartedly agree with the above statement, but if you want vegan "cuisine", not just "food", go visit Millenium or Golden Era.  Taking into consideration the price point and especially the location, after all it is in the mall, this is pretty good vegan fare.  

Basically, for mall vegan food it's does what its meant to do.
author: SF R.

description:
Just realized I misplaced this review!!!  I meant to write it for the Loving Hut that is between ChinaTown and Little Italy ... NOT the one in Westfield Mall..   

I had some required reading to do, but did not want to sit at home.  I wanted to adventure out and just find something good to eat, somewhere I could sit and read.    And my walk about led me to Loving Hut!  It was this restaurant with a cute name, who wouldn't want to go into a place called Loving Hut!?!?  So.. I walked in here, it said Vegan Food, Loving Hut!!  I'm totally in.  I didn't expect much, ordered the curried rice with the spring roll, and wow, it was pretty awesome!

I LOVE THIS PLACE!  It has a very relaxing energy.  The whole time I was there, I thoroughly enjoyed my food and felt really great!  I would totally come back here again!  Oh and they got vegan cakes too!  

I love my meat, I eat meat all the time, but this place is worth checking out.
author: Ramona D.

description: Run by a cult but who cares when the food is so good. Lemongrass tofu was fabulous!
author: Kim C.

description:
I'm really happy to have a good vegan place in a convenient location (Westfield Mall).  Like all food in a mall court, it's not fancy, but it is delicious and affordable.  

Get the rice plate with two items if you want a decent amount of food.  I love the sweet potato curry and the eggplant with tofu and mushrooms.  The steam buns are also pretty good.  I want to try the soups next time.  I will definitely be back. 

If you're looking for something vegetarian/vegan that also happens to be quick and cheap, this is a good bet.  This is better than most of the mall food and probably healthier.
author: Alison M.

description: I've eaten at Loving Hut in San Diego, and had a great experience (I will need to yelp them).  This location seems to be smaller and the menu selection is reduced as well.  This place reminds me slightly of panda express, except for vegans. It's nice to know that you can eat what's on the menu without having to pick out bits of meat.  I got the 2-item lunch combo with kale and lemongrass tofu; I also ordered the thai iced tea - i needed the caffeine boost to power through the afternoon.  The kale here was pretty good.  I also liked the iced tea.  The noodles and rice were bland for my taste, and I couldn't really taste the lemongrass in the lemongrass tofu, and the tofu was also kind of stiff.  I would eat here again - probably try something different.
author: Bebe W.

description: Looked good, tastless.  Move along and go to one of the other stalls at food court
author: S H.

description: I dont eat soy. I asked the person working there if there was anything soy-free, and the only thing was the sauteed kale. I love kale, but its not going to fill me up.
author: No N.

description: Who knew vegan could be so yummy, let alone Asian style vegan. There are a ton of great options at Loving Hut and it is by far one of the healthiest options in the entire food court. I usually go for the two item and rice or noodle combo. The eggplant is delicious and the even some of the faux-meat options are pretty good. This is always a great pick when you're at the mall and are getting a little hungry.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Super good vegan food.. you can order pre cooked buffet style food or order over the counter and youre food will be cooked fresh... I love the sweet potato fries! YUM!!
author: Kayla G.

description: The Loving Hut Salad is one of the most delicious salads I've ever had. The citrus dressing was amazing, and the salad was full of avocados and all kinds of yummy veggies.
author: Amy X.

description: What a let down! This place gets rave reviews and honestly I must part company with this. If you're going to put pictures on your menu, the food should at least resemble it. Everything just lacking. It does not hold a candle to Golden Era or Golden Lotus, both Supreme Master Ching Hai affiliates. I will give it another shot to be fair, but out the gates it left a last minute foodie unsatisfied and wanting. I have to qualify this with the fact that I'm a veggie and generally a food snob. So if you have low expectations for vegan food then you'll be pleasantly surprised, but if you drive a hybrid, wear Birkenstocks, have your own yoga mat and know that it's getting real in the Whole Foods Parking lot then this place will fizzle.
author: Christ P.

description: Awesome food there basil mushroom is the bomb.com. Oreo cake tastes really good can't even tell the difference. They have fresh smoothies they're really good and strawberries are fresh. Located in Westfield mall. Bart and Muni access from the mall.
author: J V.

description:
Whenever I crave noodle soup (more often than you'd think, by the way) I immediately think Loving Hut. I am obsessed with their spicy noodle soup--a great middle of the week pick-me-up. Plus, for eight bucks you get a lot of food. 
They also have a decent selection of vegan desserts. The mocha cake and cheese cake are both excellent. 
I have to admit that the lemonade is WAY too sweet--disastrously sweet (but perhaps that level of sweetness isn't consistent...I've only had it once) but Loving Hut gets a five-star review anyway. My love for the vegan chicken fingers trumps all.
author: Jeff H.

description: Try everything because it's ALL good! You don't miss the meat with Loving Hut. Food is tasty and I am always wanting to go back for more! Fremont NEEDS a Loving Hut!
author: Jacelyn L.

description: Quick, cheap and delicious vegan fare. I've come here a few times coming back from class or on the way home since they're just a short BART ride away. My favorite is their Loving Hut salad as it's a good balanced meal, though the Tropical salad is delicious too, with very fragrant plum vinaigrette, yum. The soy-meat they use in their cooking is pretty tasty. I always look forward to coming here for a bite when I'm in the neighborhood. 3.5 stars.
author: Kit A.

description: Had the sweet and sour dish, curry and fried rice. It was excellent! Can't wait to try other dishes.
author: Rod S.

description: Really random but their chow mein is tasty... and i suppose their food in general is healthier bc there's no meat?
author: Alias A.

description: Get the sweet and sour tofu, eggplant and the fried rice. SO GOOD. Anything else they have for the buffet options are hit or miss. Although the mushrooms and the kale are pretty good as well. The noodles weren't that great.
author: Jessica K.

description: I was really craving a cupcake during my lunch break and ended up walking past this place inside the mall. They had a vegan carrot cupcake that looked super delicious. Unfortunately the looks didn't match with its taste. The cupcake itself was very dry. The only good thing about it was the frosting. Definatly don't think I will be going back here.
author: Nava N.

description: The food healthy and delicious! Try the curry, I couldn't believe it was vegan. The vegan chow mien and coffee is amazing, I will be going back.
author: Cameron H.

description: Yep, Im a vegetarian, and need some good greens--so I go here when Im on the run! Their salads are impeccable, offering a wide range of veggies. The dressings are always light, so no need to worry about unnecessary calories. The sauteed japanese eggplant is divine, along with the kale. The service is friendly, and the prices are decent--you'll feel better for how much you spend b/c it's all quite healthy.
author: Brittany B.

description: I'm so addicted to this place that I go out of my way to come here.  Who knew you could get such fresh, healthy, original food in a freaking mall food court?  Every single thing I've ever gotten there has been exceptional.  The main positive is the freshness of the produce they use and the fact that they don't overcook anything.  You can really taste the vegetables.  Their sauces don't overpower anything either.  They're part of that "Supreme Master" cult, but you don't realize it unless you watch the TV in the food prep area that's always broadcasting Supreme Master stuff.  Whatevs.  The food kicks ass.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: This Loving Hut is owned by the same person as Golden Era (we can't wait until Golden Era opens in their new location!!) and has the same delicious, high quality vegan food.  It's great to have a totally vegan option in a food court!   Try their excellent sweet potato and tofu curry, sweet and sour, noodles, and sandwiches!  Yum!
author: Holly F.

description: I'm not vegan or vegetarian, but I still like eating here. The loving hut sandwich is the only thing I ever eat because it's so yummy, I never let myself get anything else. Everything's a bit pricy, but it's downtown SF AND it's vegan. What do you expect? Highly recommend the sandwich! Haven't tried anything else though, sorry! One day....
author: Jas E.

description: I've been here a few times but the thing that keeps me coming back is the Grilled Philly Sandwich. Now I love a real Philly Cheesesteak but there's those few times that I want the taste or the feeling of one without actually having one. Meaning that this sandwich comes with leafy lettuce and a nice serving of tomatoes and the soy is delicious -- so sure, it doesn't take like a Philly Cheesesteak but I feel a little better knowing that I've eaten something a wee bit healthier for myself and didn't have to [entirely] compromise on taste.
author: Shauna S.

description: I turned from a meat eater to vegan 3 1/2 months ago and I love this place.  Love the Loving Hut Salad - the imitation meat is awesome!  The sauce that comes with it is tasty but a little too much in quantity, so I would ask to put the sauce on the side.   The golden roll is great tasting too, though it's deep fried, so eat sparingly!
author: bright s.

description: Vegan Vietnamese food, no way! Found it on yelp as a very convenient location near my hotel (plus it's in the mall) - no brainer that I should check it out. Fast, healthy, and delicious - perfect meal when traveling on business alone (or when you're here shopping)! Ate here 3 times during my stay - spicy noodle soup and rainbow salad were both delish! ... Could've skipped the spring rolls. Overall great experience - when are y'all going to open a store in Houston?! :)
author: Minju L.

description: Some of the most convincing fake meats you will ever taste! Mostly Vietnamese and Chinese inspired menus consisting of rice plates and noodles. Tons of veggie/soy protein combinations that are never boring or bland. They also do sandwiches, sweet potato fries, and "chicken" tenders. Prices are pretty fair for vegan cuisine.
author: James P.

description: My coworkers were discussing vegetarian dishes this morning and got on the topic of vegan dishes.  It's one of Nicky's favorites.  So during lunch time Melissa headed over to get a combo platter and later called me in the office and asked if I wanted take out.  I had her pick me up an order of Chow Mein.  It was clean and the veggies were fresh.   There was an interesting item that even tasted and looked like meat to my surprise.  I'll definitely be coming back when I'm in the mall's food court.
author: Stacey L.

description: This is a great place to buy vegan/vegeterian food that is also tasty and cheap.
author: B C.

description:
this is going to be the series of Loving Hut that I am going to review. ha. ha .ha. 

Visited very often

food- yummmmmm, my favorite is the garden vermicelli.. always so fresh, always!  
service- really quick! they have this buffet style where 2 entree plus either noodle/rice or combo for $8.50 awesome price!  and they give you this beep if you order other things and have to wait; and usually beeps at you right after you find a table
price- good price
location- in the food court of the mall in the heart of San Francisco, can't complaint! 
atmosphere- this mall just seems to be better than other mall
others- i also like their homemade lemonade sweetened with agave.
author: Sharon L.

description: I liked the pho I got, but there were only shallow spoons to drink the broth. I felt so dumb that I was drinking it inefficiently, so I didn't drink much of it. The entire meal was very filling though. I also got diary-free Thai iced tea and it was pretty good. I'd eat there again if I don't feel like eating any other mall food.
author: k h.

description: I loved every Loving Hut I've ever eaten at! Yummy vegan food, great people!!! I go to Westfield shopping mall just to eat here.
author: Prem M.

description: I went here on a whim bcause I had the hot snakes from the night before (lactose intolerant) I ordered the Fried rice and sweet potato curry... it was BOMB!! For being vegan, I was surprised how good it was! I will return for sure
author: S B.

description: A vegan food court option?  The future is here!  Thai iced tea and Queen Bee sandwich were just what I needed.  Spring roll was only okay.
author: Margaret C.

description: Yeah! Loving Hut takes on the Mall Food Court! The menu is somewhat pared down from other Loving Hut locations, but that makes sense considering the size of this one. Lunchtime buffet, soup/salad/sandwich options and it's allllllll Vegan. And not sneaky it-just-so-happens-to-be-vegan but in BIG letters on the side of the kiosk-space. I don't spend much time at Westfield but I am much more inclined to go and get a bite to eat at Loving Hut now that it's in the mall.
author: M M.

description:
My only complaint was that my tropical salad was too big! If you're looking for a healthy option for $8-12 range in the food court, this is a great place to go. Don't be turned off by the "vegan" label, this is great, flavorful food and you will not be disappointed.

Looking forward to giving them my business again.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Amazing!  The tofu is always seasoned perfectly and the satin is the most convincing beef substitute I've ever had.  They also have always have a great variety of dishes and flavors to choose from.  The price, 2 entrees for about $7, is pretty decent too.

I recommend the lemongrass tofu and the mongolian beef and broccoli.
author: Mack D.

description:
i am not a vegan myself, but at times i do like to eat vegan food. the 1st Loving Hut i see is the bigger location in Chinatown at the corner of Vallejo and Stockton street. to be quite honest i didn't think they would last because it was in Chinatown, and the last time i checked Chinese people love meat! but anyways, back to the review...

so i finally gave Loving Hut a try, not the location in Chinatown but the small little stand inside the mall. it's actually REALLY GOOD!!! I've eaten there twice this week and i will be back for more for sure!

I ordered the buffet combo for $8.95 I believe, which is 2 items and a side of either chow main or fried rice. I got the chow main and the spicy green beans with curry today. the spicy green beans are no joke SPICY! you can taste the spiciness and the freshness of the beans. the curry with tofu and potato was YUMMY!!!!

their food is not oily at all, and you can even tell its not real meat!!! hands down this is one of my favorite lunch spot from now on =)
author: Jenny G.

description: Oh gosh, if I could give half a star, I would. Not sure why more than 70% of the reviews are giving this restaurant at LEAST 4 stars!?!?!? Not only is this place overly priced and the customer service is horrible, but the food is flavorless and not worthy of anybody's money. I have been to vegan Thai restaurants many times and this "cheap, fast" place is not even mediocre when it comes to compare... The food is buffet style and sits in warmers until you order, so you don't get that fresh taste of good food, and to make matters worse, they water down the chili sauce. I would never suggest this place to anyone. Two thumbs down.
author: Shadi R.

description: This place made me LOVE Chinese vegan food.  I now go out and seek chinese vegan, although, I have yet to find a place that I like as much!  Okay--that's a lie, I think I've found others, too, but this place is delicious!
author: Steph M.

description: You know how we're both always like, "Oh man, I wish there was some delicious vegan Chinese food in the mall food court", or "I miss the Supreme Master Ching Hai's warm, comforting, cult-leader presence"?  Well... BLAM! Now we can have our vegan cake and eat it too at Loving Hut.  I had the vegan bbq pork bun.  Take that, Jesus.
author: steve m.

description: Went here again on New Year's Day. I got TWO orders of the fried rolls and 1 order of the sweet potato fries. J ordered a noodle dish, which he liked. We consumed every bit of food. Loving Hut -- my new impetus for getting on Bart.
author: Grace C.

description: I want to like this place. I want to be able to have a healthy to-go meal. But on my recent stop the staff was both rude and condescending. And although the food was tasty, it made both me and my boyfriend SICK.
author: Radha R.

description: Don't get me wrong, I ate delicious vegan food for the first time. However, I was dissatisfied that there were not many items to choose from at the "a la carte buffet".
