For $8.25 my portion wasn't even 3/4 of what Panda Express gives. $9.03 was the total but my stomach was still hungry. I would return again but the portion sizes really piss me off.
author: Dominic T.

description: Easily the worst vegan food I have ever had. I litterally feel like puking moments after eating. Nothing was fresh and it was all just diagusting meat substitutes. I'm vegan because I don't want to eat meat. So don't subsitute it with a fake which is even worse. Give me some fresh vegitables and a little tofu. I do not recommend this to anyone let alone a real vegan.
author: Troy D.

description: I've been wanting to try this place since I read about it VegNews. Since we don't have it in LA, I've been super excited to try it today in SF at the Westfield mall. Immediately, I was drawn into the shinny lights and the word "vegan" at the food court, who would have thought! If I could, I would have ordered everything on the menu, but I've settled on a traditional soup to warm me up and a side of sweet potato curry. Both were excellent choices leaving me wanting more. Fresh ingredients, delicious taste and fast service. I am definitely coming back tomorrow to try some more and I can't wait until they will open a branch in LA. Great job Loving Hut, now I know, why all the buzz is all about!
author: Ewa M.

description: Omg this place is soo good, i loveee their sandwiches and their mushrooms are really good as well! I just wished they werent so pricey so I can stock up on their sandwiches or something, because it's seriously really good! :)
author: Jackie V.

description: I'm a HUGE fan of their Garden Vermicelli!  Sometimes I go to the mall just to get my fix.  I just wish they'd open up shop in Pac Heights.
author: linda p.

description: I stumbled upon this place on its opening day.  I was pleasantly surprised with the food.  It was tasty -- I had the tofu with eggplant, Szechuan greenbeans with tofu and the fried rice.  Large portions.  The food was not oily and the green beans were fresh and crisp.  This is a great food option for the food court where the meals are so heavy and expensive.  I read the review of the Chinatown location and come to realize this chain is run by a cult that cherishes the "Supreme Being".  Heck if I care -- besides, this Loving Hut is too small for literature or propaganda videos.   I will def, eat here again.
author: Ms. G.

description: Got the two-item combo with tofu eggplant and potato ragu, with chow mein. Surprisingly the best part was the noodles, nice and garlicky. I didn't care for the eggplant (usually a home run for me), but the potato ragu was okay.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
i always go with the same person and get the same thing, but it's pretty damn good.  and one star just for being a totally vegan place IN A MALL FOOD COURT.  how awesome is that?

the "chicken" tenders and sweet potato fries are great.  a nice crunchy coating on the chicken and a pretty great tangy bbq sauce for dipping.  i always get the two-choice buffet option.  if the sweet potato curry is available...get it!  so amazing.  i've had the eggplant (yum), lemongrass (eh) and the "shrimp" and green beans (scarily realistic).  the vegetarian bun was decent but it's no golden era.

really wanted to try the soup last night but it was a rainy day and by the time i got there at 7pm they were all out.   it looks amazing though.
author: kate s.

description: I always get the philly because it's so damn good. I need to try something else though because i'm sure its good too! i just wish it was a little cheaper! cant have everything.
author: Tim R.

description: I love this place. It doesn't look like much but the food is great and the family that runs this specific one is amazingly friendly, happy and helpful.
author: taylor w.

description: We went to the one in the Westfield food court a couple times. I got the pho (4 stars), the Thai iced tea (4 stars), as well as the 3 entree/rice plate (3 stars). I thoroughly enjoyed both. The pho soup tastes like a much healthier version of the usual but was just right in flavorl and there was an abundance of healthy ingredients (mushrooms and other mushroom-like vegetables). Even the Thai iced tea tasted healthier - just the right amount of sweet and milky. The plate was decent but a little too sauced-up and overwhelmingly flavorful. But I would definitely go back for the pho or to try something new.
author: Lilian W.

description: Delicious food, generous helpings, and very friendly staff.  I love the sweet potato curry and the soups are AMAZING.
author: Kacie O.

description:
being vegan for the past 7 yrs. due to  medical reasons has made my hunt to good "food" (not vegetables) very difficult.  i found 2 outstanding restaurants in southern california "veggie grill" and "native foods cafe" whose chefs has created truly "chicken" "carne asada" and a "reuben sandwich" that has even turned my carnivorous friends into frequent diners.
so,  when i saw the loving hut in the food court i was so excited.  after tasting their "chicken" i threw it away....it was a kind of "tofu" that didn't even look like chicken.  i'm sure it might be satisfying to some, however, comparing the above mentioned restaurants and their outstanding "meats", i think that loving hut has a lot to learn.  
i've asked  both restaurants to please start a chain in the bay area...maybe someday.
author: Pam W.

description: i cant get enuff of this place - tried the curry potatoes today and they were da bomb :)
author: Oleg H.

description: great vegan food! it's mostly buffet style, in the food court, and is always delicious. i especially like the mushrooms and the eggplant. their "cheesecake" is yummy too. and they keep a bottle of sriracha behind the counter. just ask...
author: joey e.

description: Not bad, for a mall steam-table buffet place. A little pricey, though. And it probably wasn't the best idea for me to go just before closing; I'm sure everything is even better fresh.
author: Brian W.

description: Eh to the Tropical Salad.  I can only review the one item I ordered, but I can say I  wouldn't order it again. It's a large, white salad -- by volume, it's about 85% shredded green papaya, 10% shredded carrot, and only a trace of soy protein, basil, or crushed peanuts.  The dressing is tasty.  You should definitely order this salad if you're trying to minimize your caloric intake
author: Taly J.

description: This is the best place in the Food Emporium hands down.  It is pretty good vegan food that is flavorful, filling and actually feels healthy to eat.  The restaurants here are notoriously over priced and the Loving Hut is actually worth the price.  Meals all seem to be under $10 and they give you plenty food to feel full.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: They had some good stuff and it feels good knowing it's meat-free. I suggest the yellow potato curry.
author: Cristian M.

description: They have a GREAT vegan pho option. After turning vegetarian, I pined for pho. My cravings were satisfied here at Loving Hut.
author: Sheena M.

description: Surprisingly good vegan food, especially for a mall food court. The cheesecake is more sour, not as sweet as Souley Vegan (in Oakland), but is good nonetheless. I recommend getting it to go, then picnicking in Union Square.
author: Phillip B.

description: quick and delicious! Best at the westfield mall. The chow mein is recommended and the spring rolls with the peanut sauce! My favorite quick vegan meal before the movies!
author: Kelly R.

description: Great spot if you want vegan food and something fast... Not the healthiest of vegan options but pretty good...
author: Joshua s.

description: I am a big fan of Loving Hut and am glad that they have opened one in Union Square. It is a convenient stop for vegans if they're in the area and desire some good vegan food. The first time I went to this one I was expecting their regular full menu, but then I understood the limited selection since this one is in a mall. I would prefer to eat at their actual restaurant than the one here if I wasn't in a hurry. Still though, good food and even better dessert!
author: Sade R.

description: So I've been wanting to go to this place for a while now, and used my shopping trip to Forever 21 (yes, I'm older than 21, have no business being in baby stripper clothes and I have no class) as an excuse to be near the mall so I could gorge myself at the Hut. If you were that weird guy eyeing my F21 bag like you were gonna steal that shit, or if you were the tiniest oldest hunch back-etiest elderly couple sitting next to me, I was the girl sitting in a giant blue windbreaker licking myself from forearm to fingertips as vegan mayonnaise and coleslaw dripped from the Loving Hut sandwich I was making out with, and I apologize if I ruined your appetite. Things got a little out of hand, but once I bit into that soft and crunchy French bread with the marinated soy protein and said vegannaise and coleslaw, I no longer cared that I was in public although strangely I remained clothed, as my neighbors unfortunately know, I prefer to eat in the nude. The sandwich was like $9, which is pushing it you guys. That, and the fact that I'm trying not to be a UberFatty as much anymore prevented me from trying everything on the menu. Also, I was greeted by pumpkin cheesecake which is my KRYPTONITE and I refrained from getting it for the fact that I'm trying not to be Obese Betty anymore as stated above. I guess I should feel good about the fact that I resisted the temptation and didn't trade 300 or so calories for fleeting happiness like my trainer says, but that skinny bitch doesn't know true happiness. Now I just feel sad and have to go back to   try the pumpkin cheesecake and then cry afterward. Also, from what I've gathered from reading reviews of their other location, the restaurant is run by some kind of PETA-esque cult? THAT IS AWESOME.
author: Joe T.

description: Yes, sometimes I drag myself downtown just so I can get some loving hut. The kale, eggplant and noodles are my faves. Their food is tasty, their drinks refreshing and oh they're vegan, so you feel good about the food you're eating.
author: Margaret Y.

description:
Loving Hut is great for some healthy food, but it's not entirely vegan. Check to make sure they aren't using animal by-products (like gelatin) because they tend to use them. When I confronted the cashier, she said that people don't really care. What the heck?

As a non-vegan, however, I like this place for a quick sweet snack that won't hurt my diet.
author: Olivia M.

description: The spicy noodle soup yum! I specifically come here to the mall just to eat here (not much of a mall shopping fan). Only 4 stars because the prices are a little high (I usually spend between $15-$20 on just myself!) which for mall food is a little much :) The girls are always friendly, and I like the ready made options to go if I am in a hurry.
author: Amy M.

description: I happened to be in the area and before heading back to the East Bay, I thought I'd get a quick bite to eat. I was wandering the food court and a couple places caught my eye, but I thought I'd better check out all there is before deciding. That is when I happened upon Happy Hut. Preferring to eat vegan, I was more than pleasantly surprised to see this place. I got the combo with noodles and it was tasty and very reminiscent of my favorite vegan place in Oakland called Golden Lotus. Yum. I will definitely eat the again when back at the mall or around Powell in SF.
author: Lm R.

description:
Sweet potato curry was pretty good, and I liked that they had a brown rice option.  Also got a pork bun, which was okay.  Liked the outside bun part, didn't like the filling very much (too sweet I think, had a weird texture).  REALLY didn't like that they heated the pork bun in the plastic wrap.  I do not like pthalates in my food, or anything else that leaches from plastic when it is heated.

Rather expensive for fast food (I was surprised that my curry and pork bun cost $11), but not terrible.  I wanted to try the thai iced tea until I saw that it was almost $4!  Crazy!  Even fancy thai restaurants like Osha only charge around $2 for it.

Overall, my experience was mediocre.  I'll return if I really need some food fast and I'm in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Rachael S.

description: Tried this on a whim after walking by it for a couple of times.  I normally have a buddy I eat pho with as our silly tradition, but I wanted to try the veggie version here.  Sooooo, what I'm getting to is that this is my new "need pho in a fix" place.  If my friend is nice, I might even bring him along!  Tasty, good portion size....had to wait a few minutes for it, but I'm ok with that.  It means it's super fresh!  My thai iced tea was a bummer- it tasted like they just waved the sugar by it and forgot to put any in.  I dont need super sweet, but a little sweet is good.
author: Shelley M.

description: I love Loving Hut!!! All of their food is incredible, I can't even say I have one favorite. Out of the deserts, the vegan Mocha Cake is one of the best cakes I've ever tried!
author: Dallas H.

description: When i was Vegan this place blew my mind. They had tasty food for a tasty price. I was really impressed with the food and the variety. It made it a lot easier to eat at a restaurant :)
author: Chloe C.

description: The Westfield food court can be practical for lunch when I am running errands downtown. I got the garden vermicelli bowl and really loved it. The veggies, herbs and faux beef on top of the rice vermicelli were very fresh and flavorful. I even asked for extra mint and thai basil and they gave me an extra small bowl of herbs. I will definitely be back to try their other items on the menu.
author: Niloo T.

description: "Chicken" nuggets and sweet potato fries. Yum!
author: Travis K.

description:
It's so nice to have a vegetarian (vegan actually) restaurant in the food court at Westfield. I'm a big fan of all of the Supreme Master restaurants, especially Vegetarian House in San Jose, and this one doesn't disappoint.

I split my review in two: one for the ready made steam table items, and one for the menu items you have to wait for.  The ready-made items are good, not great.  You get a good amount of food, and it's pretty tasty, but if you've got the time, order off the menu (usually 5/10 minute wait)

I've had the Golden Vermicelli - it's amazing: very fresh and flavorful, and the grilled soy protein is delicious.  Looks like steak slices and doesn't have that "off" taste that so many fake meats have.  The Loving Hut Sandwich is also great; I liked it much better than the Grilled Philly Sandwich. The crispy warm sandwich rolls they use are mighty tasty. 

So overall, I'd give the pre-made items three stars, and the order/pay/wait menu items a hearty five stars, for a blended four stars.
author: Jeff H.

description: I've been on this vegan and vegetarian spiel lately and came here the other night. I really liked their Garden Vermicelli, it was fresh and the egg rolls were really good! I felt like I was cheating since it was fried. Expect me to come back!
author: K. E.

description: This place is amazing!  It's a little weird going out to eat in the mall food court but that just makes it all the more interesting.  Both sandwiches on their menu are wonderfully tasty and so far the 2 item combos haven't steered me wrong.  The fried rice with sweet and sour veg chicken and chow mein is my favorite.  So happy you're a block away Loving Hut!
author: Janey F.

description: I had the vermicelli and spring roll boll with grilled protein. It was delicious - nice combination of flavors and textures, raw and cooked. A great addition to this food court!
author: Katherine F.

description: I am a meat eater and not a huge fan of vegan food because my impression of those cooking are usually bland and boring with not much taste. I tried the Loving Hut out of curiosity as one of my friends mention some raving reviews that the food is tasty here. She wasn't lying! I ordered the combo of fried rice or fried egg noodles with a choice of 2 dishes at $8.25 plus tax = $9.03. I had fried noodles, mushrooms in basil and lemongrass tofu. Note: the better description would be fried tofu. It is very hard on the "skin" and I much prefer other variation of fried tofu which are softer. Both dishes are tasty and very rich in flavour. I like it very much! The portion is just right as I was able to polish the whole thing off. I like the fried noodles because it is not greasy. I made the mistake of drinking ice-water with my food now I have stomach ache. I forgot to check if they serve green tea or any kind of hot tea which would be friendly to my sensitive stomach. I will return to try out that sweet potato curry that looks very yummy! Also, I saw them preparing fresh vegetables which is a comfort to know I am putting freshly cooked produced into my system!
author: Bella A.

description: Like their pan fried noodles but portions aren't that big.
author: Lisey W.

description: vegan chinese food... this is a dream come true! the food there is amazing... i guess you can say that it is more thai-ish cuisine then anything but they have a big variety of all good things asian! food is fresh, in season, and so damn good! service is eh, but your in and out of there so fast that you don't even have time to think about it. oh yeah, and did i mention that its all VEGAN! I feel so much better about the sweet potatoe curry and fried rice that i just devoured when it's vegan! sooo soo good!
author: Norma O.

description: I've seen the Loving Hut in the Chinatown location but never ate there.  A chinese vegan place, very interesting!  Finally decided to give it a try at the downtown location.  I ordered the heavenly salad and shared it with a friend.  It was soooooo good!  The vegetables were shredded really finely which soaked up the dressing really well.  Even with no meat, we both felt full from the salad.  The next day I went back and tried their rainbow salad, it was equally good.  Meanwhile, my other friends got the rice noodle with spring rolls and vegan beef.  It was mind boggling for them that it wasn't meat.  The consistency and taste was so meat-like and tasty.  They said if all vegan restaurant tasted like Loving Hut, they wouldn't mind giving up meat and eating vegan everyday.  Everyone that ate there with me enjoyed the food.  Who thought eating healthy can taste so good?
author: Samantha C.

description: I don't care if there are animal products in my food as long as it's good. And my sandwich was good (the Philly). But not that good. I ran out of filling long before I ran out of bread, it was $10, and I had to wait 10 minutes to get it when there were only 2 orders ahead of me. Also, I prefer my food sans righteous attitude ("go veg, save the planet") especially when they are handing out to-go orders in plastic handle bags. Nope, that was a oncer.
author: Lisa S.

description: went here for a quick dinner cuz the real hip girls at my work are vegan and won't stop raving about this place. i got the queen sandwich (i think that's what it was called) and it was just...meh. it wasn't necessarily bland it just wasn't as tasty as i thought would it be. for $10 i would have rather gotten 3 sandwiches from Saigon Sandwiches plus coconut juice, and i think i would have been more satisfied than after eating the "queen sandwich". maybe next time i'll try the noodles because that looked pretty good. but then again so did my sandwich.
author: Lea N.

description: vegan rainbow salad and spring rolls in the mall food court  - divine.
author: Fallon C.
